Floodwaters close highway a major highway between the Northern Territory and Western Australia remain block by floodwater today . the Victoria River have cut the Victoria Highway and also flood the remote Pigeon Hole Aboriginal community . Stockman Simon Ham describe the relocation of a hundred people to higher ground . they have all they vehicle move out of the community and they have a few camp set up and they be move more people and belongings out with a couple of boat , just onto higher ground , only 500 metre from the community , he say . they be up on a sandstone ridge at the moment and I think the river height might be up for a little longer but I think it -lsb- the Victoria River -rsb- will start go down . grain company sell for $ 9m Tasmania 's main grain company have change hand for the second time in just three year . the former state-owned tasmanian grain Elevators Board have be sell to local agribusiness Roberts Limited for about $ 9 million . the deal include silo at Launceston , Devonport and Powranna in northern Tasmania . John Macleod from Roberts Limited say the company bid when the board be first privatise . we be very disappointed we be not successful at that point of time , he say . wine worker stop work worker at Hardy wine ' Stanley winery in south-western New South Wales have walk off the job for the second time in a week . forty staff walk out this morning in a dispute over a new enterprise bargaining agreement . the stopwork come just as the region 's wine grape crush get under way . Hardy wine take the matter to the Industrial Relations Commission -lrb- IRC -rrb- on Friday . wool body eye sportswear industry the $ 50 billion global sportswear industry be the new target of wool promotion body , australian Wool Innovation -lrb- AWI -rrb- . AWI 's Len Stephens say although wool-blend sportswear will be at the pricier end of the market , shopper be willing to pay more . the sport apparel market sector be one of the biggest and certainly the fastest grow apparel sector in the world , and it be no secret that wool have not have a very big share of that market at all , he say . the level of wool , particularly australian merino wool in the sport market be really almost below the radar . Marine biologist Dr Kirsten Benkendorff say the work follow research overseas , where clinical trial be now investigate anti-cancer property . the whelk that I be look at at the moment be not currently harvest and not really consider a useful resource so I think that there be a lot of potential economic benefit from that side of thing , she say . processor fail to meet kangaroo meat demand international demand for kangaroo meat be put pressure on australian processor . despite high price , harvest quota be not be meet leave a big gap in the market . could only have one leg and you could still run it . the NZ apple debate continue in a New Zealand newspaper on the weekend , member of the New Zealand apple industry voice concern regard the legitimacy of the science use in the draft import risk analysis put out last month by Biosecurity Australia . the draft import risk analysis -lrb- IRA -rrb- determine the risk of fireblight and other pest and disease if New Zealand apple be import into Australia . under the World Trade Organisation 's rule Australia can refuse the importation of New Zealand apple if they be able to provide scientific evidence of a substantial disease or pest risk . but accord to the New Zealand apple grower , professional scientific evidence show that mature apple import into Australia pose no risk of fireblight . however the spokesperson for the New Zealand base australian Apple access Group Phil Allison say Biosecurity Australia have not provide the mathematical model use to determine the scientific evidence state in the draft IRA . a spokesperson for Biosecurity Australia say : the formula use in the risk assessment be provide in the Draft import risk analysis Report on New Zealand Apples , which be publish last December for anyone to read . a competent modeller can reproduce the model use in the risk analysis from the formula give in the report . the chairman of the fireblight task force , John Corboy , say the response and concern from New Zealand apple grower regard the draft IRA be not surprising , but Australia have to be able to exercise its right to refuse the apple base on the scientific evidence it have present in the IRA . I think it be just a fact that the export business be extremely quiet and I think you would find the same comment from other export country around the world . Code of conduct for rodeo organiser Rodeo organiser in Tasmania will have to comply with a mandatory code of conduct in the future . the code be be implement after a public outcry over rodeo practice . there have be two very public incident at rodeo in the past fortnight that have outrage animal rights activist and the television watch public . a bull be put down after drag its paralysed hindquarter behind it as it leave the ring and on Saturday a buck horse be put down in the arena after it break a leg as it exit the chute . the public outcry have force the state government to declare a mandatory set of regulation will soon be enforce on all rodeo before a permit be issue . a major requirement will be for a vet to be on site at all event , rather than only on call . Peter Harvey say he have always want to shear 700 head a day and have now achieve that goal but do not realise how hard it would be . live export to Egypt halt the Federal Government have halt live cattle export to Egypt in the wake of mistreatment claim . Iraq will still buy Aust wheat , Vaile say Trade Minister Mark Vaile have confirm Iraq will continue to buy australian wheat but not from current exporter awb , which be face claim it pay kickback to Saddam Hussein . but accord to grain analyst australian grower could stay shut out of Iraq until August . while some grain exporter have already lodge application to export to Iraq , grain analyst Lloyd George say the next Iraq wheat tender may not by for another four month . not have access to Iraq for maybe 60 per cent of the year would be significant , he say . but follow he mission to Baghdad , Mr Vaile say Iraq could be ready to take as much as 350,000 ton of wheat a month , but can not confirm any deal or when it may start . there will be further tender come up in the short term , we need to look at what mechanism need to be deploy in the meantime to get we wheat grower access to that , he say . meanwhile representative from grain company ABB Grain , CBH and Graincorp be meet with federal politician today . western australian Liberal Wilson Tuckey have organise the meeting to allow mp to meet alternative grain trader and learn more about the grain industry . ABB 's manage director Michael Iwaniw say while he company be not advocate change to the wheat single desk , it be ready to take advantage of it . if , and I stress if , the legislation be to change and if there be opportunity , and if perhaps we could assist in the marketing of wheat for the benefit of australian grower then we will certainly look at it , he say . a lecturer in business strategy at Melbourne Business School say grain grower would be better off without a single desk . Professor Paul Kerin say the oil-for-food inquiry justify the need to introduce free competition , and let alternative exporter to enter the market . Professor Kerin say the ability to spread risk be the key for grower . under free competition , grower have a choice and if one of those trader mess up , then it be not so much of a problem for grower because they can change to another trader , he say . in fact , grower should have the right to punish a trader if they really mess up , and so grower will be better off . wool market expect to continue gain ground the wool industry be closely watch how China react to climb wool price with the season 's biggest sale this week . more than 82,000 bale be on offer in the wake of strong global interest which have push price to a season high of 746 cent a kilo clean . but Maurie McNeill from Elders Wool say despite some concern among buyer , the market should continue to gain ground . we have get the largest offering of the season come up this week , so obviously yes we be cautious and we be see quite a bit of chinese resistance at these level , he say . Regional weed officer Steve Wingrave say that explain the rapid spread of the weed along 11 kilometre of the river . it be a ornamental plant , the same as rose or any plant you have in you garden , he say . lot of they be hybrid variety so they be not go to produce viable seed . it turn out that we have get a variety which be produce viable seed . but it might not be a result of the variety we have get . ABARE Outlook 2006 conference today 's National Rural News be broadcast live from the ABARE Outlook conference in Canberra . Matt O'Sullivan : the Bureau of Agriculture and Resource Economics be take its best shoot at predict what be go to happen in the farming and mining sector over the next 12 month . it be fairly good news so far , depend on how you look at it , because it appear there will not be too many nasty surprise for the nation 's farmer this year . James Martin have be talk to abare to get the latest , what be the story James ? James Martin : Matt , I do not usually like use the word normal when it come to forecasting , but this be as normal a outlook as what I can remember . it be a story of continue to build after drought , but with that predictable warning that without greater improvement in world trade condition , the term of trade for farmer be really go to squeeze . abare tell we though that perhaps more of the same be not necessarily a bad thing . he morning , for instance , it be tell we that the grain harvest for 05-06 be the second highest on record . we have also see , of course , good movement of beef into Japan , and we be even see some rebound in the wool price as well . Matt O'Sullivan : so it seem that there be go to be higher production in many area in the time ahead . be that go to translate to more money in farmer ' pocket ? James Martin : not necessarily . overall we be see export earnings at a record $ 134b , that be include mineral and energy . now in the farm sector alone , those export earnings be tip at $ 29.6 b in 06-07 , so that be up 6 per cent on last year . but the warning be commodity price be go to decline across many area , so while we have increase production push up export earnings from wheat , rice , barley , sugar , wine , lamb , live export and dairy , we also have price for many item fall . overall , abare say commodity price in the ag sector will fall by about 1.7 per cent , follow a rise in 05-06 of about 1.4 per cent . so the bottom line I suppose , the net value of farm production , will actually fall to around $ 6b in 06-07 . that be down 6 per cent . Matt O'Sullivan : what about the economic picture be paint by ABARE 's chief , Brian Fisher ? James Martin : Economic growth should continue at about 4 per cent , which it have be do over the last 12 month or so . there have be talk of that super-commodities cycle which be help growth in the mineral and energy sector actually cascade into agriculture . the message from Dr Fisher though be that will not happen : there have be people talk about the notion that we have get a super commodity cycle that a whole lot of the action that we have see in mineral and energy will then cascade into agriculture . I think frankly that be a bit simplistic . a lot of the story in the case of agriculture be on the supply side . we be as I say before see a good strong demand , but in the case of agriculture , it be both a demand and supply story . Brian Fisher also say that farm cost , thing like fertiliser and fuel , will actually increase by about one per cent . now on oil , the benchmark for oil price , that be West Texas Intermediate Crude , that will stay high in the near term , but over the medium term , down from the current 65 dollar a barrel down below $ 40 a barrel by 2010 . on the dollar , a moderate depreciation , around us73c for 06-07 , continue down though by 2010-11 . that be a long way ahead , but Brian Fisher 's say perhaps around us65c for the australian dollar . Alan Oster -lrb- National Australia Bank -rrb- : we think the aussie dollar be probably go to get down to the level that ABARE 's talk about , except that we think it be go to come down a lot quicker . so we expect something like 68c by this time next year . Matt O'Sullivan : and that be go to have a big impact on export ? James Martin : it clearly help in some sens , in the sense that it mean you be more competitive , but if you be on the import side , the oil price go down in US dollar , but it really do not go down at all . Matt O'Sullivan : now I do not think you have get very good news about rural commodity price ? James Martin : Again part of this be that we have a faster fall in the currency , be that in we view , when we look at US dollar agricultural price , we be down around ten per cent . now part of that be beef , which have come off really high level , and we think sugar eventually will start to slow down as well . so we be expect price to come back , and the volume broadly to offset that , so you get those different effect come through . Matt O'Sullivan : so that might be a faster impact than what ABARE 's predict ? James Martin : yes . Matt O'Sullivan : you have also be talk about continue concern about the labour shortage , particularly skilled labour ? James Martin : yes , when we run we business survey we find it be very difficult , in fact , even in December this year , it be more difficult accord to business to get suitable labour than any time , include the late 80s . Matt O'Sullivan : so the concern be always , will that show up in wages ? James Martin : at this stage , the good news be nothing 's happen . that be why the Reserve Bank be still talk about if we be go to move rate it be more likely up than down . at the end of the day , we view on rate will be , they will not do anything , but the wages one be critical , and if they see any sign of wage pressure start to move up , then they will pull the trigger . Matt O'Sullivan : will the importation of labour be likely to hold off wage increase ? James Martin : to the extent that you can take some pressure off by increase the level of immigration , that clearly do help . and in the rural sector we know about difficulty of get people in to help with crop , so it help there . but at the end of the day , I think yes , there be a element of that , but I think also the domestic part of the economy be really start to slow a bit as well , so I think unemployment 's go to go from 5.2 , 5.3 up to about 5.7 , 5.8 , and that will help . so I think the fact be that within the economy as such , you be probably not go to have to do anything . Matthew O'Sullivan : around Australia , you be listen to a special broadcast of National Rural News from the ABARE Outlook Conference in Canberra . well , the Federal Agriculture Minister Peter McGauran tell the conference this morning that the nff and the government be not in total agreement about import worker be a solution to the labour shortage , but certainly agree there be a problem . John Roach join we now , he be the chief executive of vegetable grower group Ausveg , John be this a critical issue for the horticulture industry ? John Roach : I think not only critical to the horticulture industry , it be critical to rural Australia , and I would probably go so far as to say that rural Australia 's undergo significant change in its labour content that it will require , particularly in the next five to 10 year . Matthew O'Sullivan : what about these guest worker scheme ? be they have a impact in you sector ? John Roach : if I look at other country , yes it do . if I look at New Zealand , part of the horticulture industry in New Zealand do use what I call cheaper labour . what they be do there be bring it it in , upskil it there , and send it back to those country as part of they aid project , for example . we in Australia do not have that opportunity at the moment , but if I look at the farm unit in itself , as vegetable grower , much of the innovation happen on small to medium farm business . it be not the big end of town in vegetable production . so that area be where the innovation happen . you would require less labour in that , but you would need more specialise labour . Matthew O'Sullivan : be there a need to protect smaller farmer in the future ? John Roach : it be more about go to inform choice . the vegetable industry in particular will segment itself into three area . one be larger production , larger farm , work on lower cost . the middle section be about innovation , smaller farm unit be out there on the cut edge . the last third of the industry produce about five per cent of production . I think provide inform choice for that sector , of what they actually do with they life and they farm and they asset , I think it be really important for Australia on social content to be able to allow those people to make informed choice about whether they wish to grow , or not grow and depart . Matthew O'Sullivan : we have also hear a lot over the past few year about the significant of China to the global economy , and australian agriculture . reporter Sally Davison have be look at the impact of China on the world economy . Sal , this week be critical in term of China 's future in the global market ? David Pearson from the Department of Conservation and Land Management say venomous and whip snake from the Kimberley be of particular interest . the thing be they be only useful when they be really fresh , he say . for instance if a snake be hit during the night , you get it first thing in the morning or that very night , by the time the sun get to they and bird of prey and other thing like that , they be smelly and a bit putrid - no one want to see they in they freezer and they certainly do not make good museum specimen ! if they have be run over a couple of time by a road train , they be not very useful ! swan Hill ethanol distillery work to begin work will start next month on a $ 60 million ethanol distillery at swan Hill , in Victoria 's north-west . australian ethanol have raise 12.5 million for the project , which should be on line by the end of the year . Mission Australia highlight city-country divide division between the wealth and health of city and country dweller be continue to grow , accord to a new report by welfare group Mission Australia . the report say rural Australians be less likely to finish school , more likely to die from alcohol abuse or be affect by domestic violence , or suffer mental illness . Anne Hampshire from Mission Australia say the concern will be take to Canberra next week along with a push for new program . the report actually have three component , identify the problem which we have , identify some of the great initiative which be happen on the ground so we make sure we can develop those further , but also we have suggest a whole suite of recommendation , she say . probe into low Vic commodity price the Federal Government be set up a taskforce to investigate the impact of low commodity price in western and north-western Victoria . farmer say low grain , wool , grape and citrus price be crippling the economy of rural community . Agriculture Minister Peter McGauran say the government will not subsidise farmer , but will try to reduce cost burden . hindmarsh mayor Darryl Argall say the taskforce will give rural community more direct contact with the Federal Goverment . dairy company compete for supplier competition for milk supplier be intensify between dairy company in Victoria . after year of dismal price , milk company Fonterra be now offer a sweetener of a 50 cent per kilogram premium to new supplier . Doug Chant from the victorian Farmers Federation be happy with the higher price , but he be worry the incentive will not give farmer long-term financial security . Rockdale beef at Yanco be develop a bio-gas plant , to make better use of 120,000 tonne of manure produce at the feedlot every year . General Manager Paul Troja say the $ 12 million plant will be one of the first of its kind in the country . the manure be collect and put into a digestor where the methane be extract , the methane be clean then put through a gas turbine which generate electricity and hot water , he say . the electricity be use in the plant and the hot water in term of we normal requirement in a abattoir operation . nt flower grower meet Games shortfall after cyclone cut-flower grower in the northern territory have have to come to the rescue of Commonwealth Games organiser , in the wake of Cyclone Larry . the red and orange tropical heliconia be a centrepiece of the bouquet present to medal winner , and have be provide from both north Queensland and the Territory . Darwin grower like Jan Hintze have have to come up with more than 10,000 bloom after the Games order double overnight . I have to find another 1,000 flower , from Monday lunchtime to Tuesday lunchtime , which be actually quite difficult , she say . but however , we all get together and sure enough I do manage to get they all together and they go off on Tuesday night and they will be the bouquet today and tomorrow . SA barley grower vote to keep single desk marketing system grain grower in South Australia have vote to keep the single desk marketing system for barley . a total of 5,900 barley grower be send out the South Australian Farmers Federation 's barley ballot , ask grower whether they want to retain the single desk or complete deregulation . only 2,000 respond . this come after month of debate over poor barley price which have lead to some grower demand competition for the state 's barley market . fourteen hundred grower vote yes to the single desk , while 300 vote to remove it but one change have result , with 1000 grower want a independent single desk , with a similar structure to the wheat Export Authority . fall aust dollar good news for farmer in some good news for farmer , the fall australian dollar be add hundred of million of dollar to export return . Dr Chris Briggs from the Workplace Research Centre at Sydney University believe regional worker will see major change . these type of law be trialle in Victoria in the mid-90s under the Kennett government and what it find be that ... thing do not change all that much in the middle of the capital city but where they change be in regional area where you have three time as many low pay job , particularly in job like retail , construction and hospitality , so it be likely that regional area will feel the effect of this , he say . but farmer and other regional business say the change will lead to more job in regional Australia and greater flexibility for worker and employer . only farm that be incorporate or in Victoria will be able to negotiate under the new law but the National Farmers Federation -lrb- NFF -rrb- say it will be encouraging farmer to incorporate so they can access the change . the nff 's Denita Wawn say over time the new law will lead to better relation between employer and employee . Dr Ian Colditz say , if successful , the e-nose could help the industry save more than $ 160 million a year . the device work by have some electronic sensor that be pick up chemical that be part of a odour and that create a electrical signal that can be pick up by a computer and could be relay to the farm office , Dr Colditz say . milk price increase anger WA farmer western australian dairy farmer be angry at milk price increase announce by dairy company Fonterra , because they say they be not enough . David Carter of Newfishing Australia be call on the Commonwealth Government to urgently buy back licence . we expect in the next couple of week , the Department of Agriculture , Fisheries and Forestry will invite all operator in the northern prawn fishery to tender they right , that will be in the form of a buy back , Mr Carter say . residue concern open up japanese hay market concern over residue find in hay export from the United States to Japan be open up new market for australian farmer . the hay export company Johnson Asahi want more farmer to grow oaten hay for the japanese market , to capitalise on Australia 's clean , green image . Spokesman Anthony Chapman say it be not yet clear what the residue find in the US hay be . flood market make life tough for citrus grower Citrus grower say they outlook be go from bad to worse . Growers say a large crop , a flood of cheap import juice concentrate and shrink export market be prevent many from sell they fruit . the summer crop be be dump in southern New South Wales , with grower angry at a offer of $ 80 a tonne for they fruit . Frank Battistel from Riverina Citrus say he be not confident about the future . I know quite a few property that have turn off water to they tree , they just can not continue to lose profit every year like that and they need to make a decision to either keep go and lose money or just get out of the industry . but citrus grower in the west believe China could be they salvation . it have take more than five year for the chinese to approve australian fruit import , which will largely come from the eastern state . wa orchardist Mark Scott say that will mean less fruit send west . we compete against import from those state here in WA every day and so that the take fruit out from they market will mean less competition here in WA , Mr Scott say . european winter hit global poppy industry the global poppy crop have shrink , with the estimate surplus also half the size of this time last year . a exceptionally cold european winter and smaller planting have cause the drop . Lindley Chopping , from the Tasmanian Poppy Growers Association , say the worldwide glut have previously equal two and a half year 's supply of opiate . it be down to about one and half year supply , she say . tough time for SA potato farmer south australian potato grower be face a poor harvest , with below average yield and low price . grower say there be be a oversupply of potato for the past three season , and there be no relief in sight . Greg Rodert who grow potato for the fresh market in Bordertown , say the below cost of production price have force many grower to cut back on the amount they produce . ` we be down in we planting generally through lack of finance I suppose you might say , Mr Rodert say . jail threat for farmer employ illegal worker farmer and business operator who knowingly or recklessly employ illegal worker could go to jail under new law announce by the Federal Government . Everytime they want money they seem to think ` oh well we will just whack a levy on for a while ' . salinity threatening Barossa Valley : expert a Adelaide professor say one of Australia 's most renowned grape grow region could be infested with salt in 10 year . a professor in meteorology at Flinders University , Peter Schwedtferger , say grape grower need to minimise irrigation in the Barossa Valley . he say saline water be be pipe from local reservoir , which be already cause problem . if the Barossa be over irrigated with this relatively saline water that be currently be use , the Barossa 's life be go to be limit , he say . once the really serious saline infestation occur it be go to be too late . but one of the Barossa 's biggest grape grower , Ed Schild , say salinity be not a problem and estimate only half a hectare be affect by salt . US reach agreement with Japan to reopen beef market US Department of Agriculture -lrb- USDA -rrb- official say they have reach a agreement with Japan on step to reopen that country 's beef market . import of US beef be suspend in January after a shipment of veal be find to include bone material prohibit by the japanese . Plantation tree may contribute to greenhouse gas level new research suggest plantation tree could actually contribute to greenhouse gas level rather than lower they . a report in the international science journal Nature say the tree emit methane . it be previously think methane emission from plant come from area where oxygen be limit , like rice paddy . Research scientist Philip Polglase say while the finding be totally unexpected , it be not necessarily alarming . what we in Ensis have do recently be compare expect rate of methane release from tree plantation with the rate of carbon uptake , he say . the amount of methane release be only a very small amount or the carbon equivalent take up . we think it be about less than 5 per cent . New crop variety double yield in East Timor New crop variety be trialle in East Timor have double yield . Maize be the stable crop along the rugged country on the doorstep of Darwin and harvest be now under way . in the steep upland of Liquica overlook the capital of Dili , some maize farmer have record yield of up to three tonne per hectare . that be twice the average and be the result of five year of research and collaboration under the seed of Life project , which include rice , casava , sweet potato and peanut . this australian-funded initiative aim to improve nutrition and wellbeing amongst the subsistance-farming family of this newly-independent nation . wine grape oversupply to impact on company profit the global oversupply of wine grape be start to hurt the industry 's big company . the world 's largest wine business , constellation , be tip to announce a lower than expect profit to the New York Stock Exchange later this week . US wine industry forecaster John Fredrickson say the global market be in a down phase , particularly for country produce cheap bulk wine . but he say in Australia , the answer be not in grow fewer grape . you start to talk about pull grape , well that be really drastic , that mean you have some other alternative and I do not think it be go to be any huge percentage of vineyard that run into that kind of extreme difficulty , he say . meanwhile a new research program for the wine industry will develop new export market and create wine to suit specific taste . the grape and Wine Research Development Corporation be use federal fund to investigate the wine taste of consumer in country like China , India , Eastern Europe and South America . Professor of wine marketing at the University of South Australia , Larry Lockshin , say packaging , labelling , pricing and wine style will also be consider . we be not go to come up with a answer that say , ` this be the wine for China ' , he say . we be go to come out with the same thing scientist have come out with . this be , these be yeast and these be the flavour they produce , these be pruning and canopy training technique , this be what they do to you tannin level . we be go to develop a method . company will then be able to decide whether they want to use it to develop wine for they own brand that suit different market . and the victorian Farmers Federation want better regulation of tax incentive scheme to stop oversupply problem . President Simon Ramsay say the scheme have contribute to over-investment in vineyard , lead to a oversupply of wine grape . he say in south-west Victoria tax incentive for timber plantation investor seem to have affect normal competition for land . what we do not want to see be good traditional agricultural farming land be turn into plantation that have a sort-of unclear 12 year profit period where we be not allow the food and fibre production to continue for generation , he say . I do not say that that be the only structure that can deliver that , he say . but what I would say be that if you change it you have to be very careful when you change or you effect change because in fact a lot of it be wrap up in the intellectual and brain power of the people you employ to deliver the excess return to you . meanwhile India be look to import a further 1.5 million tonne of wheat this year . Central Australian beef producer benefit from wa rain Central Australia 's beef producer be reap the benefit of recent heavy rainfall in Western Australia . despite the rise freight cost , WA pastoralist be say to be buy cattle from the centre as they look to cash in on the best season in year . Alice Springs livestock agent Herby Neville say it be the first time in four year that he have see central australian cattle head west . they be experience a very , very good season over there and I think it be give the Pilbara and all that western Australia , the Gascoyne and all that a very good drink , he say . and because of they flush of the season over there , they sometimes come over here and get a bit excited and buy a few cow and calf . but agent in the west believe pastoralist be more likely to look to the Kimberley for cattle , because of the high cost of transport . WA pastoral livestock manager Eric Broad say despite this year 's high rainfall not everyone can afford to restock . it be a interesting question , there be a belt of country that be be hammer for about five year without any rain . and they be the one that be really low down in number , he say . lesson learn from mad cow epidemic the discovery of mad cow disease have teach scientist how to better manage disease and improve how farmer and industry respond to new virus outbreak . it have 10 year since the link be discover between mad cow disease in cattle and cjd in human , with billion of dollar spend in control and research ever since . Professor Colin masters from the University of Melbourne say science have learn many lesson from the mad cow epidemic . we have learn a lot about risk minimisation and disease management , he say . if we have learn anything at all we should have learn that it be not a good thing to feed one species back to itself . in Europe it be be virtually outlaw , the situation in North America be different , they be watch very carefully what be happen in Europe and they be take what appear to they to be appropriate measure at this time . dam to house turtle hatchery the new Paradise dam in south-east Queensland be soon to be the home of a world-first turtle hatchery . concern be raise over the future of the endanger elseya turtle during construction of the dam on the Burnett River , south-west of Bundaberg . but the new hatchery be design to restore turtle number , with thousand of baby hatchling expect to be release over the next five year . Craig Thamm from the Burnett dam Alliance say attack on egg and hatchling by predator be the single biggest risk to the turtle 's future . particularly you feral predator such as fox and pig be -lsb- prey on -rsb- the egg and you be get very few , if any hatchling back into the river , he say . New plan call for change to single desk wheat export AWB would lose control of the single desk for wheat export and its power to stop rival company from export wheat , under a new plan release at grain week . the report , prepare for the grain Council , also call for the wheat Export Authority to be replace with a grower-owned licensing and marketing body call australian wheat Associates . Report author Colin Benjamin say the Cole inquiry show the wheat export system be fail and grower risk lose control of they sector unless they accept major change . to get into a global competitive game you have get to be play in the league of you competitor and you have get to be strategic , he say . US Wheat Associates have be the long term major league champion fight we which we have successfully beat to a pulp over the decade , we now have to be see as fight on a level playing field , prior to the Doha Round because if we do not , we will have it impose upon we . the grain Council say australian wheat Associates would be model on industry body for the meat and dairy sector . the Council say that would give AWB 's current veto power to grower , along with its responsibility to market and promote australian wheat . Chairman Murray Jones say if the change be adopt , they will be implement over three year . the last thing grower want be to have a abrupt change , he say . it just can not happen . it be just not go to work , it will affect we financial system , grower want security and planning , they want to know they finances be secure , they want to be assure they be go to get they payment , they want to have a transparent system they can see through . that be what they be ask for . meanwhile five US farm state senator have ask the Bush administration to investigate AWB payment to former iraqi dictator Saddam Hussein . the group also want AWB sanction if it be find to have violate US trade law or World Trade Organisation -lrb- WTO -rrb- rule . the senator cite the finding of a UN audit of AWB , which find it pay some $ 220 million in alleged kickback to secure wheat contract through the UN oil-for-food program . top Senate Agriculture Committee Democrat Tom Harkin 's spokesman Dave Townsend say US farmer should not have to compete with foreign government in trade . it be clear that there be gross violation of the UN oil-for-food program by the australian Wheat Board and we feel that the US Government need to make a determination whether the law be break , he say . Agriculture Minister Peter McGauran say Australia lodge submission on the protocol last year but do not hear back from Indonesia until the condition be impose on April 4 . Indonesia do not respond to the submission of Australia and the various other country before decide on a new decree , he say . Chief market analyst at Meat and Livestock Australia Peter Weeks say the news will not affect Japan but the latest controversy could delay the resumption of US export to Korea . but outside of Hong Kong be far more significant particularly in Korea where they have link they reopen , the timing of they reopen to instance , to the previous instance as well as the third BSE case in the US and the circumstance surround that , he say . Riverland citrus grower lock out of indonesian trade Citrus grower in South Australia 's Riverland have be lock out of sell fruit to Indonesia despite be free of fruit fly . Australia 's $ 35 million fruit and vegetable trade with Indonesia be at a standstill because of new import protocol design to address fruit fly concern . the Riverland 's fruit fly-free status be recognise by other asian market like Japan and Taiwan but not by Indonesia 's newly impose quarantine protocol . Judith Damiani from Australian Citrus Growers say it be a important market . it be not one of we largest market in term of volume or value but we do send quite a significant amount of mandarin and valencia as well , she say . Chief executive Rob Gordon say change across the business be expect to save $ 42 million a year . locust swarm across WA wheatbelt Locust plague be emerge as a big concern for winter crop in Western Australia this season . locust have make they way from the wet pastoral region into agricultural area , with farmer now report locust swarm across the wheatbelt . senior entomologist with the Department of Agriculture Kevin Walden say the green feed in the agricultural region could help locust survive for week . we be likely to see these locust survive into May but by the time the female be complete they cycle , then number will drop off very quickly , he say . but , as I say , if the break of the season 's early , then there may be a bit of a overlap between crop emerge and locust still fly around . arid zone research group research to focus on desert area Pastoralists and researcher from around the country have take the first step towards create a new arid zone research group . the group will work independently of state and territory organisation , focus on problem that affect pastoral production in all desert area . Q fever be a debilitating disease which mainly affect meat and livestock worker , and be transmit through infected animal . though the tender process should be complete by next month , the Government say it be unlikely a new supplier will be find in time to prevent a vaccine shortage . Mr Agius say the commission have obtain clearance from the United Nations but be still go through necessary protocol with the British Foreign Office . extreme weather event affect rural commodity outlook Cyclones and hurricane continue to affect the outlook for rural commodity across mining , wheat and sugar market . the latest commodity Price Index from the National Australia Bank be predict a slight ease in rural price over the next two year , with sugar , beef , wheat and cotton all expect to perform well . agribusiness economist Skye Dixon say extreme weather event have a big affect on rural price . they do certainly have a impact because so much of rural commodity price be derive from what be happen with supply , she say . nsw drought worsen New South Wales be slip further back into drought , with 46 per cent of the State now drought declare . that be up eight percentage point on last month . only 20 per cent New South Wales be consider satisfactory for rainfall . but the State 's primary Industries Minister , Ian Macdonald , say despite worsen condition , farmer be optimistic about a bigger winter crop than last year . the State need widespread rain particularly in the north but also many area in the south-west which be major crop region need a good downpour fairly quickly , he say . tomato plant virus spread there be confirmation today that the tomato yellow leaf curl virus be spread in one of Australia 's major production area . the virus stunt tomato growth and drastically limit yield . discover for the first time in Australia a couple of week ago in Brisbane , it have now be identify on two commercial property near Bundaberg . inspection be be plan in other Queensland tomato grow region . Chris Adriaansen from the Department of primary Industries say it be prove difficult to trace the origin of the virus . this be what we be find as we be go through all the property that we be get positive diagnosis on - there be no common linkage in term they be not use the same supply of seedling , they be not use the same supplier of anything , there be no other linkage , he say . protester vow to continue gold mine protest environmentalist be continue to picket a New South Wales gold mine over the use of cyanide , which they claim will permanently poison the local water supply . the Lake Cowal open pit mine , in the state 's central west , begin process recently but operation be shut down yesterday and a delivery of cyanide have reportedly be delay . eight protester have be charge with trespassing but Graham Dunstan from Cyanide Watch say the protest will continue until the mine be close . this mining company have be grant water lease by the NSW Government to pump up 3,650 megalitre a year for this cyanide operation , he say . they leave this water behind permanently poison . now in a time of drought give people the equivalent of a Dubbo 's water supply each year be profligate . search for grapevine genome move a step closer a italian team of scientist have produce the world 's first draft of the grapevine genome sequence . the work , on the pinot noir variety , could lead to the development of high yielding , disease resistant grape that still make good tasting wine . Project leader with CSIRO Plant Industries , Doctor Mark Thomas , have be in close contact with the italian team and say it be a important step towards the final grapevine gene map . once the genome sequence be complete it will be the foundation I think for 21st century grape research as it will allow we to understand what gene be involve in grape quality and those gene that also control fruitfulness and yield , he say . in Australia , the CSIRO have be work with a group in France try to isolate the gene responsible for powdery mildew resistance and downey mildew resistance . grower satisfy with grape price Riverland grape grower who supply to wine giant McGuigan Simeon say they be satisfy with the fruit price determine by a independent analyst . the analyst be call in after a dispute arise over price for grape , many which have already be deliver to the winery . Floodwaters affect search for banana prawn Floodwaters and muddy river sediment be make it hard for trawler in the Gulf of Carpentaria this season . the banana prawn harvest begin on Saturday , across the northern fishery . newfish Australia 's Steven Valentine say the fleet be be force to use depth sounder to find the prawn . with the water clarity not be as it be - not very good , due to the mud slick - and we can not spot the mud boil , boat be have to rely heavily on they sounder , which mean we do not cover the area quite so efficiently , he say . so it be be a pretty slow start to the season . traditionally we road freight they out of Karumba . but , at the moment , with all the road close , we have not get anywhere to send they to . hopefully within the next four to five day , the river will drop enough so that the road will be open and we can truck prawn out . the Newfishing Australia fleet be hope to catch up to 60 tonne of banana prawn per trawler this season . bureaucracy to blame for closure , scallop fisher say tasmanian scallop fisher say they be feed up with a bureaucracy that have lock they out of the Bass Strait scallop fishery for the past six year . now the Federal Government say the fishery will remain closed for another three year . Australia have one of the last sustainable wild catch abalone industry in the world , he say . most of the other have be fish to extinction . nursery to encourage kid to garden the nursery industry be set out to re-educate Australians about how to garden . market research have find gardening be lose market share from change lifestyle , bigger house , smaller garden and a loss of skill . the industry be fight back and will soon launch a kidsgrow program , where local nursery can work with school to encourage child to garden . Jenny Lambert , from the Nursery and Garden Industry Association , say gardening have social , educational and environmental benefit . the industry be concern that the strength of the community knowledge about gardening have drop over the year and we be worry about where the next generation of gardener be come from , she say . global oil price continue rise global oil price continue to climb to record height as Australia 's grain grower prepare for this year 's plant season . last night New York benchmark crude oil close at more than $ us70 a barrel for the first time in 23 year of trading . Commodity analyst Tobin Gorey say run cost and fertiliser price will rise further but there could be more demand for wheat and canola to make replacement biofuel . the cost be actually higher so people need to be compensate farmer and so on for produce it so it be profitable otherwise they will not stay in the business , he say . but the other side of that too be that demand for thing like ethanol or biodiesel that create further demand for oilseed and grain as well . perhaps that can also help boost the price and be perhaps already influence market now to a small degree . the combination of rise fuel and fertiliser cost be cause for concern for many farmer . Graingrowers in South Australia 's Mallee tell Kerrie Lush cut back on crop be not a option and they be look at other way to reduce cost . we be certainly not cut back on any acreage we be sowing but David 's certainly go to try and do as much direct seeding without work up anything to save a bit of fuel that way , val Gibbs from Wunkar say . she say fertiliser price be also far more expensive than last year . we have trialle put zinc on through seed dress instead of through fertiliser so that save a bit of money that way . call for bureaucrat or mp to act as AWB ` moral conscience ' the Queensland Nationals be call for change at the top of awb to help protect the single desk for wheat export . Mr Neville say the appointment would prevent question over AWB 's integrity if it retain the single desk . it be important that its probity be above any form of suspicion , he say . for that reason I would be more comfortable if we have a government appointee or someone from the public service on that board . meanwhile tough international wheat marketing condition have be reflect in AWB 's first payment to grower from the 2005-06 national pool . the dividend of just over $ 30 per metric tonne for australian premium white -lrb- apw -rrb- grade wheat represent just 16 per cent of the total price grower can expect to receive . South Australian accountant Peter Hayes be part of a group that be lobby federal politician to increase the threshold , which have not change for seven year . one client of mine want to relocate and they combined asset be in the order of $ 6 million , so they do not comply with the CGT small business threshold and for they to move be go to cost they $ 1 million in tax , he say . Canada record 5th mad cow case Canada have confirm its fifth case of mad cow disease . but it be unlikely to cause further trade restriction with the United States . Mutton make comeback in UK if you think mutton be a cut of meat that go out with the war year and the depression , think again . Iraq finalise wheat purchase the iraqi grain Board say it have finalise a $ 100 million wheat purchase from Australia after almost two month of negotiation . although the three company sell the wheat say they have not yet sign a contract , the grain Council of Australia believe term have be agree . the head of the Iraq grain Board Khalil Aassi have tell reporter the country will buy 350,000 tonne of wheat at $ 190 a tonne from the wheat Australia consortium . the deal be broker by Trade Minister Mark Vaile , who visit Baghdad in February to save the Iraq wheat trade , after it announce it would no longer deal with monopoly exporter awb because of the oil-for-food kickback scandal . the deal with wheat Australia , which include ABB , GrainCorp and Cooperative Bulk Handling , break AWB 's hold over wheat export . but the grain Council 's David Ginns say the deal will not be a lucrative one . as we know , time cost money and they certainly spend a lot of time and money on finalise this deal , he say . Australia have traditionally supply around a quarter of Iraq 's wheat , make it Australia 's third largest wheat market . critical month wheat exporter awb say the next few month be critical for the global grain market , as weather condition determine the size of the world crop . australian grower have already receive a lower than expect return on the 2005-06 crop , largely due to fluctuate demand for hard wheat variety and tough international marketing condition . and general manager of AWB International , Sarah Scales , say global demand remain subdue . I think the next couple of month be very critical , I think it be make or break as far as the world wheat market go for the next 12 month , depend on particularly rain condition in the hard red winter wheat belt of the United States , she say . Queensland will lose 23 , Victoria 32 , with 38 to go in New South Wales . worker at the silo be tell about the closure yesterday , but be also tell they job be safe . graincorp say the change be in line with what grower want , which be better rate on rail service and a trend to use larger full-service silo . Apple packhouse set for $ 2m upgrade Australia 's biggest apple packhouse be launch a multi-million dollar upgrade . Federal Agriculture Minister Peter McGauran will unveil the $ 2 million upgrade of the Batlow Fruit co-operative in southern nsw which feature Australia 's first automatic blemish sort system for apple . the technology have be import from New Zealand and second grade fruit be identify electronically and then remove from the premium packing line . it be expect to increase its efficiency . the grower-owned co-operative be establish in 1922 and produce 6,000 bin of apple each year . the district 's grower be suffer after price fall last year under the weight of a big crop and import apple juice . it be well recognise that the gap between city-slicker and they country cousin be grow . but farmer be out to restore they image by hold a National Farm Day next month . victorian wool producer Debbie Bain say farm gate will be open to city people to help they better understand decision make on a work property . if we have somebody up here and we be bring sheep into drench they , why do we give they these chemical ? we be shove these chemical down they throat , what for ? she say . but when you explain about worm burden and and the detrimental -lsb- effect -rsb- that worm have on sheep , they will suddenly understand a little bit more about chemical use in animal . drought program speed up aid application farmer will get faster access to drought assistance under new change unveil by state and federal agriculture minister today . they be the first in a raft of drought assistance change farmer hope to see over the next six month . the National Agricultural monitor system -lrb- nams -rrb- be expect to slash the time it take to gather the information farmer need to lodge a drought assistance application . it will provide instant online rainfall , soil moisture , crop yield and commodity price information , streamline contact between farmer and local , state and federal government . vice-president of the National Farmers Federation -lrb- NFF -rrb- Charles Burke say there need to be fundamental change to the way drought assistance be deliver but this be a positive first step that will help farmer . it will really give a overall picture of say one particular region and how it be perform in a drought , he say . money laundering law change ` draconian ' rural bank branch and agency could be under threat from propose change to federal money laundering legislation . while the law be design to target organised crime , a report by the Chartered secretary of Australia say it will be too hard for many smaller bank agency to comply . Chief executive Tim Sheehy say bank will need to have personal contact with client , there will be change to identification requirement and big fine . they be draconian , they be unfortunately a one size fit all approach , he say . the way that the propose legislation be , there be no difference in penalty for a fairly minor transgression or a major $ 10 million one if you be a agent . -lsb- when -rsb- you be face with the risk of a major penalty for a small error , you be probably go to pull out of the business . Truck driver ` live below poverty line ' New research show the family of truck driver be suffer from record fuel price , drought and long work hour . more than 70 per cent of the nation 's transport fleet be make up of small operator and the report by the transport woman of Australia Association say tough time be be feel everywhere . Spokeswoman Pam McMillan say the study back up anecdotal evidence . we do find that some operator be live below the poverty line and more than what we would like to consider , she say . they might have a nice house but perhaps can not afford to buy decent grocery every week and it be not that they be be frivolous , it be just that the money 's not out there . debate intensify about fuel alternative as oil price rise oil price be not get any better with the price of West Texas crude jump again last night to $ us72 a barrel . as price go up , debate be intensify about fuel alternative . Bruce Robinson from the Association for the study of Peak Oil and Gas say Australia could halve its transport fuel usage by minimise its dependence on car . he say fuel tax should be increase similar to the system introduce by former prime minister Margaret Thatcher in United Kingdom in the 1980 . if we continue to provide very cheap petrol and to give excise free petrol to everyone and subsidise it as happen in Queensland then we be just go to continue down the oil dependence -lsb- road -rsb- , he say . the enormous legacy Margaret Thatcher have leave to Britain , she be give the price signal that oil be go to be more expensive then they be not nearly so dependent on cheap fuel as we be . the higher price of crude oil be cause investor to take a closer look at the biofuel industry . a new ethanol plant open in the US every 10 day and around the world million of dollar be be pour into biofuel project to reduce dependence on oil . agribusiness investment adviser Shane Kelly say australian investor be also keen to back a local ethanol industry . it be fair to say that as oil price increase , the interest in ethanol plant have increase markedly , he say . cyclone cause minor damage there have be big rainfall in the wake of cyclone Monica in far north Queensland . the category three cyclone cross the north-east coast late yesterday but do not appear to have cause too much damage . Cyclone Monica follow almost exactly the same path as cyclone Ingrid which rip through the region about 13 month ago . Monica hit land just south of the Lockhart Aboriginal community . very few commercial fishing boat be shelter in Lockhart River 's mangrove and so far there have be no report of major incident . on cattle property in the cyclone 's path the strong wind bring down some branch , tree , shed and fence but overall damage have be minor . Salt interception project to benefit Murray River A project to stop thousand of tonne of salt enter the Murray River have just be open near Kerang in north-west Victoria . the $ 13 million salt interception project will pump saline groundwater from pyramid Creek into evaporation basin . the salt will then be commercially harvest instead of flow into the Murray . Goulburn Murray Water 's Carl Mather say the project will benefit both farmer and the environment . the scheme will stop approximately 22,000 tonne of salt reach the river Murray , he say . record price set for yearling at Sydney sale the thoroughbred industry have set a new record price for a yearling at the Easter sale in Sydney . south african trainer Charles Laird pay $ 3 million for a Redoutes ' Choice colt last night , beat the previous record of $ 2.5 million . the record come as a surprise for the breeder . it be the best ever yearling sale on australian soil . after two day of selling , buyer have spend $ 68 million on 240 lot , with the average price at more than $ 100,000 above the previous year . Victoria , New South Wales and South Australia will have $ 10 million , $ 13 million and $ 3 million in competition payment withhold respectively , open up a new row between they and the Federal Government . South Australia and Victoria claim they be be punish for New South Wales fail to agree on they trading model but the Iemma Government say it have meet all of its water trading requirement . National Water Commission chairman Ken Matthews will not buy into which state be responsible for the hold-up . I be not take side among the state , all three state have be work hard , he say . but Parliamentary Secretary to the Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull say the Federal Government have no constitutional power to end the state stand-off . that be the constitutional reality , he say . Victoria and South Australia have agree on a exchange rate system of open-border trading but New South Wales be call for a different model which take into account its lower security water entitlement . Minister for the river Murray in South Australia Karlene Maywald say she be bitterly disappointed because a agreement on water trading reform have be reach with Victoria . we believe that be grossly unfair and we think that South Australia be be dock $ 3 million when we have do everything we can to ensure that we border be open , she say . AWB ` apology document ' suppression ruling loom a bid by wheat exporter awb to stop the release of a apology document be be hear in the Federal Court in Melbourne . earlier this month the AWB board vote to lodge the court challenge to AWB inquiry Commissioner Terence Cole 's decision to lift a non-publication order on the document , which be prepare for the company last year . the document be write by a crisis management expert , who suggest the company take a strategy of over-apology . Commissioner Cole rule the document be not prepare for the purpose of legal advice and so could be publish . a AWB spokesman say the board feel the document , and other to do with awb 's internal investigation into the scandal , should be protect by legal professional privilege . former managing director Andrew Lindberg have tell the court he engage a US public relation consultant to put together the statement of contrition , which would be present to the Cole inquiry . under cross-examination he deny the statement be prepare for pr purpose but maintain it be part of the company 's legal strategy . however Mr Lindberg acknowledge any statement to the inquiry would attract widespread publicity . the court be expect to make a decision today on whether to release the document . Darwin resident prepare for Monica 's onslaught preparation for tropical cyclone Monica be under way across the city of Darwin in the northern territory . the category 5 system have already create major disruption with commercial fishing . as tropical cyclone Monica track west across the Gulf of Carpentaria , many of the 75 prawn trawler that fish the remote off-shore region take shelter in calmer water to the south near Karumba and the Northern Territory-Queensland border . other steam back to they northern port such as the Francis Bay Mooring Basin in Darwin . the interruption to the banana prawn harvest have create at least one week of disrupt fishing time and waste fuel in not ideal fishing grounds . one of the largest company , NewFishing Australia , estimate the disruption will cost they ten of thousand of dollar . it be a unusual sight to see trawler and fishing vessel in the Darwin Port in the middle of the season which end in just under one month . they be be double lash to mooring with rope and pack in tight side by side with tyre fender between they to reduce friction . and the level of water in this mooring basin will be drop to allow these large vessel to rest on the bottom for the worst of the weather . flooding and rain from cyclone Monica be cause the worst flood in live memory in part of far north Queensland . resident from a Cape York Peninsula aboriginal community and at least three family from cattle property have be airlift to drier ground . Glen Shephard from Lilyvale Station , near Princess Charlotte Bay , say he have never see anything like it Wednesday afternoon it start to rain and by about seven o'clock the next morning we would have seven inch so the water be start to tickle we toe , sort a thing , he say . it come through the house about fourteen or fifteen inch ... have to walk across the airstrip to get over on a bit of high ground . it be always a concern about croc in this country -lsb- but -rsb- ... I do not tell the kid that . senior forecaster at the Bureau of Meteorology David Alexander say Monica be one of the most perfect cyclone system he have see . he say it be far more dangerous than cyclone Larry which cause massive destruction in far north Queensland last month . it be probably the best develop cyclone I have see in many , many year , he say . it be get a perfect circular eye , it be right at the top of a category 5 range , so it be a very , very severe cyclone . Ensis have predict the area most likely to be at risk be the nt , coastal Queensland and NSW . however , generally warmer condition could see it easily colonise region further south . in Brazil , there be a 40 per cent fatality from the disease . footrot control review the continuation of the state 's sheep footrot control program have be assure after a comprehensive review by representative from the South Australian Sheep Advisory Committee , the South Australian Farmers Federation and PIRSA . in the 1950s , about one third of the sheep flock in the south-east be suffer from the disease but eradication program and improve diagnosis have eradicate the most virulent strain . I do not think we will see any croc because as soon as water get a bit rough the croc seek quieter land . we do not worry about it , we walk around chest deep in the water now and then outside to salvage more thing and get the boat and barge tie up and get to the generator shed , and we do not even consider it . council seek to fill job through Melbourne advertising a group of western victorian council have resort to advertising in Melbourne newspaper to try to lure worker . Research have show female fruit fly be attract to the sterile male but they be not always satisfied and head off look for other mate . Dr Phil Taylor from Macquarie University say they be now try to fix the problem , to stop they from cause major damage in horticultural region . Wild fly do not seem to mind mate with they , however the sterile male have some issue with the amount of sperm they transfer and then the female 's likely to re-mate , he say . study to investigate GM crop issue the Federal Government have place further pressure on the state to lift they ban on genetically modify crop by announce eight case study into the sector 's most contentious issue . the study will be do by the Bureau of Rural Sciences and the australian bureau of Agricultural and Resource Economics , and the private sector will contribute . there will be four different report on the impact of release genetically modify canola , while weed control and the affect on organic farmer will also be consider . water trading available for southern qld farmer Queensland have give the go ahead for its first water trading scheme involve river system . previously farmer could only buy water attach to land or from government-run irrigation scheme . water trading will now be introduce across the moonie and Warrego catchment in southern Queensland . a entitlement to access 120 megalitre a day from the moonie river will be auction next month and Clayton Smith from Elders believe it could sell for well over $ 2 million . exist irrigator will be keen to get more water to do more development on they property and secure they future , he say . Jeffrey Newton from the Macropod and Wild Game Harvesters Association say record roo meat price mean too many people be vie for a share of already limit quota . as with any industry , big dollar attract people that be chase that quick dollar but unfortunately this industry can not sustain that , he say . water in the bank while water scarcity be not much of a issue in the top end at the moment , in central Australia attempt to develop a new horticulture industry depend very much on new water save technology . the water re-use project in Alice Springs have be under development for some time but emerge technology could make a number of similar project viable and workable . Professor Stuart White from Sydney 's University of Technology have work on water saving project with government and council around Australia and he say there be a new sense of urgency to develop water savings project . when we start to move away from the urban sector and talk about water use more generally and remember 80 per cent of water be not use in town and city it be actually use in irrigated agriculture and so on , we do have to take a bit of a long hard look at some of the industry that be use water and say be this appropriate and what be the trade off between the impact of some of these industry and the impact on water way and the benefit we derive from they . however there be huge scope for efficiency there , I mean we be talk about efficiency level which can be improve even beyond what we be talk about in the city , in term of relatively low cost savings , and some of those be start to be pick up and that be a good thing . crop planting to follow weekend rain despite the high diesel price , crop planting be expect to get into full swing across much of Victoria and South Australia this week after good weekend rain . most of South Australia 's grow area have rain and there be also fall of between 44 and 30 millimetre across northern Victoria . victorian talkback caller Shirley be certainly relieve . we have have 51 millimetre . we have one of those scatter thunderstorm . we be actually away for the day and we get home here at about 6:00 pm and the further we come towards home , there be more water and we get home and there be just water everywhere , she say . AWB delegation to investigate wheat pesticide find a 50,000 tonne shipment of australian wheat have be stop from unload in India after test reveal unacceptable level of pesticide . the shipment , which leave the port of Adelaide last week , be now on standby at Chennai port , await further testing from indian and australian authority . it be the first consignment of a half million tonne tender win by exporter awb and spokesman Peter McBride say the company be send its own delegation . they have identify that there be a high level of pesticide reading , so AWB be send a high level delegation to India which will leave today to meet with we customer to address the issue and obtain more information , he say . we have run test here as the ship leave and we will do that for future vessel . we can not really provide further detail until we have meet with we customer and hopefully we will have further information later this week or early next week . trucking company to pass on increase fuel cost the transport industry will start pass on the increase cost of fuel this week as company begin to include fuel surcharge in contract . the australian Trucking Association -lrb- ata -rrb- have be urge operator to act for some time , especially smaller business who be struggle to absorb the higher diesel cost . the ata 's Stuart St Clair say he be relieve at the industry 's decision and believe most customer have be expect it . I think the majority of customer would understand because they would be under some similar price pressure themselves , particularly those that have a lot of vehicle on the road , whether they be stock and station agent or whether they be farmer or other , he say . WA native title battle resolve a 12-year native title battle surround the western australian town of Broome have finally be resolve . the Federal Court have recognise the Yawuru people as the rightful native title holder of land surround Broome . the full effect of native title will take place on the indigenous-owned cattle property , Roebuck Station , while the neighbouring property , Thangoo Station , will continue to operate as a privately-owned lease . Fred Chaney from the native title Tribunal say the decision also extend to area like the famous Cable Beach . the beach be of course a very significant feature of Broome and that be a area where you can not have exclusive possession the court find but where the aboriginal people have continue traditional interest which they share with the general community , he say . there be area of town where native title have be find to survive -lrb- in other word not extinguish -rrb- and there be very large area outside town , in particular the Aboriginal own pastoral property which have exclusive possession native title . Fran Heintz from the Wanga maya Aboriginal Language Centre say the event have a massive impact on indigenous worker . it be be a fairly significant event for the region and in many way we believe it be a significant national event , he say . some people actually call it the black Eureka . it do set what be be in place now for 60 year and that be the equal respect .
