Farmers wary of govt change to fuel rebate farmer already fight higher interest rate and the strong aussie dollar now face change to they fuel bill from July 1 , which could add further pressure to they budget . the Federal Government will scrap a tax subsidy rebate worth up to three cent a litre to regional motorist , and change the 18-cent a litre on-road energy credit scheme . under the scheme , farmer and transport operator will receive they fuel rebate off they gst bill , instead of a cash grant pay directly into they bank account . Luke Fraser from the Livestock Transporters Association say the change will create a cash flow headache for rural and regional business . we have a business where over 30 per cent of we total cost input be fuel . Farmers would probably understand that sentiment , he say . and in that sort of position , when you be be ask to go through administrative hoop to try and claim that back , and you never actually see it in cash , it be just come off a tax bill , well that be a big change . to say , look on July 1 it be all go to switch over and everyone will be fine , be incredibly naive and insulting . a spokesman for Assistant Treasurer Peter Dutton say it will be simpler in the long run to deliver the energy credit to farmer and trucker through they gst bill . Aileron resident don sombrero for mexican mutton chase it be not often you see Mexicans swill tequila and ride donkey in central Australia . but this weekend at the bush carnival at Aileron , 130km north of Alice Springs , you have better be prepare to don a sombrero . while the adult gulp down bean and tequila and race donkey , organiser Sarah Debney say it be sheep that people really want to see . that be the mexican mutton chase ... we have get team of two child and the team put on they poncho and hat and they run down the other end and do the same scull with water and baked bean , run back and we let sheep out of the shoot and they have to herd the sheep over the line , she say . crowd flock to Broken Hill for Agfair The far western New South Wales city of Broken Hill be pack to capacity today , for the area 's biggest biennial event . there be not a spare motel room available in Broken Hill this weekend as swarm of people have converge into the city to celebrate Agfair . three hundred exhibitor be on show slightly down on two year ago , as organiser claim high petrol price have discourage some from travel the distance . Exchange rate hit wool market rise exchange rate and high pass-in rate have hit the wool market again this week . the eastern market indicator drop off 6 per cent , to finish the week at 708 cent a kilogram clean . price be 46 cent lower than the season high in March . among the offering be 1,700 bale offer by the New Zealand Merino Company . a whopping 41.6 per cent be pass in . beef program add to producer return a new economic analysis have find the beef quality program MSA be add a extra 20 cent a kilo to beef producer ' return . the meat standard be develop by the beef Cooperative Research Centre and use a set of scientific criterion to allow consumer to identify beef which be guarantee to be tender . Centre head Dr Heather Burrow say the program will add $ 85 million to beef revenue this financial year . overall , she say it have generate three time what it cost to industry to develop . average 20 cent a kilo , beef producer , retailer and processor be get a premium for beef that they can guarantee be better than every day eat quality , she say . the Bureau of Statistics will conduct a census of livestock producer for the first time in five year . it will collect datum from 190,000 farm across the country and be expect to highlight the value of the cattle industry to the australian economy . Census manager , Jim Williamson say the datum will help to drive the live export industry . be able to ensure we can meet future export market if we want to enter into future contract , we can be confident we have enough cattle to fill the contract , he say . people can keep a handle on whether the cattle herd be go up or down . primary producer frustrate at lack of harvest labour support primary producer in Western Australia be disappointed at miss out on harvest labour support . the Federal Government will fund service in 16 harvest area across Australia , but say tender from the west be not up to scratch . the service help to match the pool of worker with seasonal job vacancy . David McKerrell from the Kimberley primary Industries Association say it be frustrating fund have not make it to all region it need to be recognise that there be production area right across Australia that have a requirement for harvest labour and all area should be give opportunity to take part in those sort of scheme , he say . Maritime protect area boundary to be announce the Federal Government will this afternoon announce the final boundary for marine protected area off the Tasmanian , victorian and south australian coast . they be expect to be significantly different to the Government 's initial proposal , which draw criticism from the fishing and scallop industry for be too strict . the tasmanian scallop sector say it would be wipe out if the area be enforce . Poppy processor defend price cut Poppy processor , tasmanian alkaloid say its latest price cut will not be a disaster for tasmanian grower . the company will slash price for the come crop by 17 per cent , although it plan to double the size of its supply contract . the Poppy Growers Association say the price cut can not be support , but Rick Rockliff from tasmanian alkaloid say higher yield variety and a better season should help farmer to improve they profit . we feel confident that if grower pay attention to detail and follow they field officer ' advice , give a more normal season , we be pretty confident that growe will have substantially more money in they bank account this time next year , he say . nff call for school to examine interest group the National Farmers Federation be call on government to ban special interest group from unvetted entry to school classroom . animal rights group Voiceless have launch a web-based education program which offer prize for the most humane school and encourage child to speak out about factory farming , kangaroo culling and live export . nff president Peter Corrish say the website have link to extreme animal rights group . what we be say be the principal of each school and certainly the parent of the child involve need to have a look at this website and actually go to these link and see what information they child may be access , he say . shareholder expect to launch class action against AWB A class action by shareholder against monopoly wheat exporter awb be expect within week . investor will seek compensation from AWB , allege the company do not report its activity truthfully . the Cole Inquiry have spend the past four month investigate AWB 's action under the oil for food program in Iraq . Ben Slade from Maurice Blackburn Cashman , say the class action will raise a number of issue . the most extraordinary positive act of misleading conduct we think be October 27 when the company issue a statement to the stock exchange after the Volcker suggestion be make in 2005 that the company may have be involve in sanction bust , he say . the company make a statement to the stock exchange that it be not . well that be another course of action that be even more powerful . AWB share have defy stockmarket trend to gain ground this week , despite the Reserve Bank 's decision to lift interest rate . awb stock fall considerably during the Cole inquiry , but yesterday gain 5 per cent . Stockbrocker Matthew Baker say the prospect of more trade with India be behind the gain . but basically AWB have get on with its job and it be go out there and it look like it be go to win more business in India which be basically ship more product out the door , he say . they price will vary because of the currency side but they be happy because they be go to be sell a lot more stock . the indian government be expect to announce a tender for 3 million tonne of wheat within a week . soar domestic price and a lower than expect crop be put pressure on indian authority to provide enough wheat for the population . milk , cheese , yoghurt price to rise on top of petrol hike and higher interest rate , the cost of food be now on the way up . National Foods and Fonterra say they will lift price for milk , cheese , yoghurt and fruit juice product by up to 3 per cent , and supermarket be expect to pass on the increase to shopper . the increase be to try to cope with increase packaging and transportation cost . for farmer it be a different story , with most unable to increase they price . Andrew Young from the Central Markets Association say farm gate price will not change just because wholesale price have go up . there be not a automatic link essentially unless they have get contract pricing in place , which for a lot of sector of the industry that just do not exist , it be commodity market pricing , he say . nff seek regional road and rail spending commitment farmer be call for regional road and rail spending to come before further investment in the Future Fund when Federal Treasurer Peter Costello hand down the Budget tomorrow night . the fund be design to cover future superannuation payment to public servant . the National Farmers Federation -lrb- NFF -rrb- be warn the government against boost investment in the Future Fund and add to the surplus , at the expense of infrastructure spending and tax reform . Chief executive Ben Fargher say the government must commit to lift the standard of grain rail line in New South Wales and Victoria . and he be call for basic all weather road access to farm and the seal of all designate arterial road by 2013 . farmer need to actually get the produce from to the farm to the National Highway in the first place , he say . Mr Costello be already talk up big money for regional road and rail , with spending expect to be in excess of a billion dollar . Better transport mean a better economy with a higher speed limit for growth , he say . the government be also hint at capital gain tax reform , which should help succession planning for farmer . meanwhile transport operator in the Northern Territory be look for funding in the Budget to improve remote road . for the past fortnight 60 road train have be unable to cross the Victoria River , west of Katherine , due to damage cause to Highway one by flooding . the delay be estimate to have cause the industry at least $ 7 million , with weight restriction only lift at the weekend to allow single trailer through . Scott Van-Loom of Shaw 's Darwin Transport want to see remote road funding announce tomorrow night . it have be the longest -lsb- delay -rsb- for a number of year . it be two week , which just put Darwin in chaos from Perth , he say . we have seven road train there , there be a total of 60 wait in Kununurra to get through . that be come north , come south there be probably about 40 road train wait on this side . oil price may pass $ us100 a barrel a transport expert say although biofuel and ethanol may help in the long term , nothing can stop oil price hit high of $ us100 a barrel . David Lamb , who head the Energy flagship of the CSIRO , say there be no way production of any alternative fuel can match more than about 1 per cent of we energy need . he concern come as a world expert on energy market , Claude Mandil , warn that with strong demand and fall supplies , oil price could eventually rise above $ us100 a barrel . Mr Lamb say without any alternative fuel , cut consumption be the only option . by 2011 we government 's plan be to be produce 350 million litre of ethanol per year but that be only about 1 per cent of the amount of oil we use so that be no solution by 2011 , he say . wool price expect to pick up a new report say wool price be about to climb again , despite seven week of loss . the eastern market indicator be 46 cent per kilogram below the seasonal high record in March . the latest business survey from marketing body Woolmark say the fall be inevitable , with not enough demand to support high price . but with stronger order come through from China , western Europe and East Asia , Woolmark economist Kerry Stott say price will pick up through the June quarter . it be the best it be be in almost five year , he say . the really good thing be that it be more widespread geographically than in the past and not only that , it seem to be more widespread right through from comb through to weave . and I think if people look at what be happen to we price in US dollar , and see that we price be still go up in US dollar , they would be pleasantly surprise . the eastern market indicator close at 708 cent a kilo clean on Friday . Woolmark 's prediction be be back by some analyst . Elders Queensland wool manager Maurie McNeill expect a decent recovery base on price indication out of China . we can probably see 20 per cent retracement of the loss that we have see in this market over the last four or five week , particularly in the finer end of the market , he say . fear new marine park boundary will force out fisherman the fishing industry say new boundary for propose marine park off the coast of Tasmania , Victoria and South Australia will not restrict commercial fishing as much as first thought . after complaint about the draft boundary , Federal Environment Minister Ian Campbell have now finalise the plan for the marine protected area , which will cover 200,000 square kilometre of ocean . although the government will provide $ 220 million compensation , Ross McGowan from Seafood Industry Victoria be worry about fisherman who will be force out of the industry . for we to sit here and say ` it be minimise ' be all well and good . but the end of the day these marine protected area will have a significant impact on some individual , so significant that they will have to get out of the industry , he say . dig finally under way at new gold mine on the back of record price , another gold mine have open in Western Australia . Tanami Gold have begin work at the Coyote project in the Tanami Desert , south-east of Halls Creek . there have be delay to start the desert operation because of the wet season . with the price of gold above $ 880 , Tanami chairman Dennis Waddell be relieve to be finally digging . we have have plenty of rain and that have just delay access more than anything , but we have make that up , he say . we start mine on Friday , which be a pretty momentous day . the excavator and dump truck arrive last week and we take the first bucket of ore out on Friday afternoon . Resources boom raise housing shortage fear in silver city the resource boom have raise fear of a housing shortage in the silver city of Broken Hill , in far western New South Wales . with the opening of the Bemax mineral sand mine and the development of the Honeymoon uranium mine , there be concern the town will not be able to accommodate a influx of worker . Broken Hill real estate agent Jim Hickey say the mining industry be now look to house worker in service apartment , which be in short supply . we be go to be shortly in need of some good development if other company start to bring people in , he say . Golden Circle back in the black Queensland food processor Golden Circle have announce a jump in profit , less than three month after appoint a new chief executive . despite lose $ 26 million in 2003 , the company make a $ 10.4 million profit before tax last year . Chief executive John Cox say he have also improve communication between the company and its grower shareholder . Golden Circle recognise that we be go to have to do thing a lot smarter , and more in line with we grower , he say . cotton result receed expectation a gamble on this year 's cotton crop appear to have pay off , although yield be down , and quality be mixed . with harvest in full swing in New South Wales , the result be better than expect , despite a record-breaking summer heatwave . although grower in the Macquarie Valley face almost zero water allocation at the start of the season , Auscott Macquarie plant almost 75 per cent of its normal acreage . manage director Chris Hogendyke say most have make it though . we get lot of allocation increase during the summer and the crop the crop turn out to be really good , he say . we be look at about 10.5 bale per hectare average and we be very happy with the result . olive oil shortage drive up price south australian olive grower be look forward to a bumper harvest this year , with price up and more order than oil . a poor european crop have compound a worldwide shortage of olive oil , push price up to between $ 5.50 and $ 6 a litre . olive SA chair , Lisa Rowntree , say even with the higher price , olive producer will not be able to harvest enough oil to meet demand . sale be fantastic . this be very much a seller 's year for olive , she say . I have sell everything that I be responsible for sell in the region and all the other grower as well have sell they olive and we could have sell they probably twice over . gelbvieh bull take champion award a gelbvieh breed of bull have be name supreme male champion at Australia 's biggest stud cattle competition at Rockhampton , in Queensland . more than 2,000 nomination across 33 breed for the title make it the biggest stud cattle competition in australian history . Guyra producer Michael Jackson , who own the win bull double j Zulu , be understandably happy about the win . we have be show cattle for nearly 20 year now , and we have never win anything like this , he say . Vic expert play part in mine rescue three mining explosive expert from Victoria have play a role in the final stage of the Beaconsfield Gold mine rescue . the tunnel inch towards the two trap man hit very hard silt stone , which resist the hand drill and jack hammer . general manager of Stawell Gold Mines Mark Mitchell say the man test the explosive in other part of the mine before they have to be use in the Beaconsfield rescue shaft . we send the guy down to help with the pcs type explosive , which you would have hear people talk about , he say . we use that at Stawell Gold Mines for a number of task . it be something we use in the normal course of we operation . we do not consider it to be a particularly specialist thing , it be just something we have some experience in . India tender for 3m tonne of wheat import wheat exporter AWB will face tough competition in the latest tender from India for 3 million tonne of wheat , which be announce overnight . the indian market have emerge this year as a replacement for traditional market in the Middle East , which be buy cheaper wheat from Europe and the Black Sea . grain analyst Malcolm Bartholomaeus say that have leave Australia and the US struggle to find other customer for last year 's bumper crop . India be very important both for Australia and for the global wheat market this year , he say . Egypt , of course , be a major importer of wheat . right at the moment they tend to be favour cheaper wheat out of Europe and Russia , so that both Australia and the US be miss out on that particular market . in term of the australian crop , and obviously lose a lot of market share in Iraq , India be equally important from that perspective as well . while awb have confirm it will tender for the contract , detail on price and volume remain confidential . meanwhile , it be unclear if some of AWB 's legal cost for the Cole inquiry will come out of the return for the national pool . the legal bill be likely to have blow out from the $ 16 million AWB shareholder be tell about at the annual general meeting in February . the chairman of AWB International , Ian Donges , say AWB Limited be pick up all account at the moment . but he say there be still discussion about whether some of those should be pass onto AWB International on behalf of the pool . local council ` starve of fund ' with a quarter of all local council in New South Wales on the brink of financial collapse , farmer be call for change to Australia 's system of government . a symposium hold in Sydney have hear expert on governance discuss how local council be struggle to cope with new responsibility and a lack of fund . former president of the NSW Farmers Association , Mal Peters , say state government be ignore rural community and what be need be a system of government that be closer to the people . Credit scheme change anger farmer impending change to the energy grant credit scheme have not be welcome in rural Australia . until now , claim the 18 cent a litre credit have be a simple process of post off a claim form and get the money back quickly . but from July 1 , the fuel rebate will be deliver through the gst report process . for farmer and other agricultural business who be not file a monthly business activity statement , it will take much longer to get the money back . livestock transporter Jim Savage , from Tamworth in New South Wales , fear delay payment will create problem with cash flow . see you , you get ta be up front to pay you fuel bill , otherwise there would be no fuel , he say . banana do big business for nsw farmer Banana grower on the north coast of New South Wales be continue to harvest some spectacular profit in the wake of cyclone Larry . mullumbimby wholesaler Jan Trueman say carton of fruit that fetch about $ 10 to $ 12 before the devastation of the Queensland industry , be now worth between $ 60 and $ 80 . he say it be set to become even more lucrative as winter approach . oh most definitely , for sure , he say . we fruit be , y' know , be at a premium now and go into winter , I mean we fruit start to slow up anyway , so it be only go to get dearer and dearer . Flinders University and the CSIRO have grow the cell so they can experiment with antioxidant to extend the shelf life of tuna and test for virus . Dr Kathy Schuller from Flinders University say it be much cheaper than use live tuna worth $ 50 a kilogram . we can test 24 different concentration and combination of antioxidant at a time , she say . unwanted grape to be use in non-alcoholic sparkling wine a small group of grape grower in South Australia hope to use up they unwanted fruit by crack into the non-alcoholic sparkling wine market . the Virginia Horticulture Centre , north of Adelaide , have begin a pilot project to see if it be viable . dingo may be use to sniff out cane toad enlist dingo be the latest suggestion to help keep Western Australia free of cane toad . dog trainer Sarah Fyffe have apply for a licence to use dingo as sniffer dog at the border and in bushland between Western Australia and the northern territory . she say dingo be natural for the outdoor job , we be not talk about work in a building , we be not talk about work in a airport , we be talk about work in rugged terrain , she say . -lsb- it be -rsb- very unforgiving - and where 's the dingo from ? that be its natural habitat and they cope brilliantly with it and know how to handle the element . Budget good news for rural Australians there be a fair bit of good news for rural Australia out of Treasurer Peter Costello 's 11th budget . there be more than $ 2 billion in extra funding for road and rail , money for the Murray River and a big crackdown on illegal fishing . there be also wide range tax cut , which be suppose to leave more money in we pocket and change to capital gain tax to make it easier for farmer to pass on they property . President of the National Farmers Federation Peter Corish be certainly happy . this budget be probably the most positive budget that Treasurer Costello have deliver for rural Australia , he say . nff have three major priority lead into this budget , the first one be sustainability , the second one be infrastructure and the third one be taxation relief for rural Australia . and I can say that positively we have have movement on all three area . more rural Australians will also be able to access the aged pension . there will also be incentive for farm and mining business to invest in new plant and equipment with change to depreciation rate . there will also be around $ 50 million for extra mental health service in country area . Vaile start Budget sell the Deputy Prime Minister and leader of the Nationals , Mark Vaile , have be out this morning tell rural area the Budget set up the bush to take advantage of the current resource boom through big infrastructure spending . he be especially proud , as most national party member be , of the $ 2.4 billion in road fund he say the Nationals have help secure . if you be talk about regional Australia , my view be one of the most important target component in this budget be that $ 307 million of extra money direct at local government for local road and bridge this year , they be the important thing to regional Australia , he say . when Australia 's peak rural lobby group the National Farmers Federation say this be the best budget in 11 year , that should not leave too much room for the opposition to be critical . but that have not stop labor 's agriculture spokesman Gavan O'Connor describe the Budget as miss opportunity . he point be you can have all the new bitumen in world but if it be not too dear to drive on that bitumen because of high fuel price and higher interest rate , well the big spending backfire . he be also talk up what he say be the Government 's failure to target its infrastructure spending , failure to address environmental issue and failure to ease skill shortage in regional area . no mention of the productivity challenge and no attempt to get on top of the foreign debt , he say . no attempt to address the massive skill crisis in rural Australia and there be no movement on the last great frontier for australian agriculture that be the regeneration of we soil . there be no attempt to engineer through these expenditure a new wave of research and innovation in the rural sector . on that basis I think there will be some significant question ask about this budget . punter what do the punter think of the Budget ? for I , I be in a retirement age so the amount that I can earn tax-free have go up , the threshold there , so I think the threshold for low-income earner have be very good , one person say . it be quite encouraging about the water , that be go to be the biggest problem and I think people in the town have get to realise that they have get to pay more for they water and not be so greedy and they have get to do something about storage , another say . I think the Budget lack vision because it should have look at the longer term infrastructure issue and I just think that politician be drive by short term decision make all the time which we pay a big price for , a third person say . Economist warn about spend the tax cut be expect to ease pressure on rural household which have face higher petrol price and grocery bill in recent month . the expert say while the cut will not put pressure on interest rate in the short term , there be no guarantee the Reserve Bank will not increase rate towards the end of the year . ANZ chief economist Saul Eslake say there be still reason to be cautious about spending . even allow for the fact that people in rural area tend to drive longer distance than those in the city , the tax cut be enough to offset the most recent roughly 10 cent a litre increase in petrol price and the rise in interest rate , he say . but any further rise in petrol price or indeed in interest rate would probably be sufficient to eliminate the benefit of the Budget tax cut altogether . meanwhile Treasurer Peter Costello tell a media conference yesterday the only way fuel price will come down be if the cost of crude oil fall . there be more than $ 11 million allocate for two new study on the use of biofuel but Greens Senator Christine Milne say Mr Costello be waste he time spend up big on road , when it be become too expensive to drive on they . he be about the only person in Australia who do not see increase oil price as a major issue , she say . industry group concern about lack of initiative there be concern about a lack of initiative in the Budget to improve the national skill base and tackle the labor shortage in Australia . although new measure have be announce to make it easier for overseas worker , the australian Industry Group say the Budget should have make more progress in big nation building project . while happy with many of the initiative announce for business and the road funding , Heather Ridout say there be a long way to go to provide the necessary infrastructure to improve productivity and cope with future demand . I think that be another area where there could have be more do , she say . they be certainly bring forward some of the spending which be important , some increase in road funding but it need a more coherent plan . we still need better interaction between road and rail , I think we still need more of a national plan and that be get to be really agree between the state be very big spender in this area . little in budget to encourage exploration , say mining group the WA Chamber of Minerals and Energy say there be little in the Budget to encourage exploration in the resource sector . the industry want a flow-through share scheme to boost exploration but do not have any joy last night . Chamber director David Parker say more need to be do there as well . this be something which industry have be argue for a number of year , he say . we see exploration as very much the future of the resource industry . we be tend to rest on we laurel in term of the future sustainability of the industry . I think if you look at the medium to long term outlook for renew Australia 's resource inventory we really be at cross road . Budget fail to tackle climate change , green group say the Federal Government have come under fire from green group , which claim the Budget fail to tackle climate change . the major allocation in environmental spending be $ 500 million for the Murray Darling Basin Commission . that money will fund project like salt interception scheme , fishway , local and weir upgrade , and possibly buy water from farmer . South Australian River Murray Minister Karlene Maywald say the money have be desperately need . project be underfund , the Murray Darling Basin Commission be underfund , we project that we all agree to from a jurisdictional point of view be all start to slip and it look like we be never go to achieve what we need to do to save the river Murray , she say . Budget boost funding for illegal fishing fight the Federal Government have announce a big crack down on illegal fishing in Australia 's northern water . the $ 389 million package be design to double the number of boat apprehend each year through increase surveillance and patrol , along with improve boat-burning facility to destroy illegal fishing boat . indigenous coastal ranger will also be employ as part of the plan but Gary Ward from the Gulf of Carpentaria Commercial Fishermen 's Association say the money be be use in the wrong way . spending this money on aboriginal community be very fine but you be talk about a radius of probably 25 kilometre each side of the community , he say . now these boat range widely over the Gulf of Carpentaria , we need more surveillance but we need more active now , the fishing fraternity in the Gulf of Carpentaria that be work so hard for a sustainable and viable fishery have be leave out in the lurch . Plan unveil to secure veg industry future a new $ 3 million strategy to secure the future of the vegetable industry have be unveil in Brisbane this morning . VegVision 2020 be the product of month of talk between grower , the Federal Government , supermarket and food processor . it be a $ 3 million plan with a very simple message - how to lift the industry 's growth from a unsustainable 3 per cent by get more vegetable on consumer ' plate . Fair Dinkum Food Campaigner Richard Bovill be a member of the australian Vegetable Industry Development Group and say grower must work with retailer and processor if they be to secure they future . there be adversarial issue out there , there will always be competitive pressure but we also have to understand we common goal and work together with those , he say . I think we can look to a range of different industry model and we should not just look at vegetable and the horticultural sector . US Farm Bill debate begin the battle have start early in Washington over the next US farm Bill , due to be draft next year . the White House and Congress do not see eye to eye on farm policy . while US Agriculture Secretary Mike Johanns and the White House be call for sweeping change in US farm policy , lawmaker be defend the status quo . top Democrat on the House Agriculture Committee Collin Peterson tell a farm bill field hearing in Texas , US agriculture should not be single out for cut . this budget talk irritate I a little bit because agriculture do not cause these budget problem . and I do not agree that we ought to be the one that have to pay the price because we have actually save money , he say . row erupt between grain Council and Agriculture Minister A rift have emerge between Federal Agriculture Minister Peter McGauran and Australia 's peak grain lobby . the grain Council be outraged that the oil-for-food inquiry be be use as a excuse to backflip on plan to reduce a key levy for the wheat Export Authority . the council want the industry levy reduce from 22 cent a tonne to 19 , leave the authority with a million dollar cash surplus . Spokesman David Ginns say the surplus will now be double and have accuse Mr McGauran of ignore grower . there have be a number of matter that we have raise with he where he have not take the advice of the key industry body and we be concern that we batting average be not particularly good at the moment and we seem to be get some excuse back at the moment , he say . but in a unprecedented attack on a peak commodity council , Mr McGauran have accuse the grain Council of act dishonourably and not work in the best interest of grower . Mr McGauran say the council have also deliberately leak confidential ministerial document and spread misinformation . I believe this be a ill-considered and ill-timed intervention by the grain Council which be more puzzling than anything else , he say . saltbush shrubland plan anger grazier grazier in western New South Wales be furious about a proposal to list old man saltbush shrubland as endanger . the New South Wales Scientific Committee have find saltbush shrubland have fall by 70 per cent since european settlement and the rest be at risk of extinction from clearing and grazing . but Graham Morphett , who have a property north-west of hay , say the plant be thrive in the western division due to good management and rabbit control . I have get 170,000 acre out here and I have ten of thousand of acre of old man saltbush with up to 5,000 acre stand , he say . call to scrap WET tax the western australian wine industry want the wine Equalisation Tax -lrb- WET -rrb- abolish despite a big Budget boost . the Federal Government have increase tax rebate to smaller wine producer by $ 210,000 . they be available to producer with up to $ 1.7 million in sale . but Ron Fraser from the Margaret River Wine Association say it be band-aid therapy , which be lull smaller producer into a false sense of security it be avoid the issue that the WET tax be a impost on the cost of wine and should be scrap altogether , he say . the only way that you can get the benefit from this extra threshold be to increase you sale and in today 's market to increase you sale be a increasingly difficult job . grape grower mull mothbal vine grape grower in South Australia 's Riverland be consider mothbal they vine , hope to ride out the industry 's oversupply . many local grower could not sell they fruit this year , with winery suspend or not renew contract . with no relief in sight , grower say they could prune heavily or use chemical to hinder fruit growth to hibernate vine instead of have to pull they out . Berri grape grower Bill Ruediger say he will have to make a decision very soon . accc to investigate Sunbeam price-setting the australian competition and Consumer Commission -lrb- ACCC -rrb- will investigate whether dry fruit processor Sunbeam Foods breach the Trade Practices Act in set low price this season . Wayne Carlson from the National Australia Bank say price be expect to even out in the next 12 to 24 month . we probably do not really expect price to come down , he say . we expect more a plateau effect . these may be some discount in the lower , standard and marginal type lend . and there be no doubt the trend of this off-farm investment super fund , manage investment scheme et cetera will continue to tip money into this market . Plantation tax reform plan unveil the Federal Government have unveil propose change to tax incentive for investor in the plantation timber sector . the incentive , which currently provide 100 per cent tax deduction for manage investment scheme , have be under review for the past 12 month . Dr Judy Clark , from the australian National University -lrb- ANU -rrb- , say the draft change which will affect investor interest . put a cap on the immediate volume of money that can be tax deducted and you also add on that reduction in top marginal tax rat from 47 to 45 per cent , both of these work to down play the attractiveness of these scheme for investor , she say . we do not need to plant more softwood to meet Australia 's entire timber need . I hope to expose the character the lifestyle , some of the difficulty of course , he say . leap croc shock scientist a airborne four-metre crocodile have make scientist ' heart skip a beat during research on the Ord River in the far north of Western Australia . scientist have be use a electrical current to temporarily stun fish , so as to study they . but they accidentally send a shock wave through a nearby crocodile . Scott Goodson from the Department of Environment say the jump croc give everyone a start . he breach the water , he get a metre out of the water , that be a big croc ! he say . he get a fairly good tickle up , I would have think ! Mr Goodson say the reptile be probably just a bit stunned after the accidental shock treatment . he be probably take off and just kick back behind another rock , I do not think he will come too close to that boat again , he say . USDA World Agriculture Outlook Board Chairman Gerald Bange blame chronic drought and tough competition from Australia and Canada for lower export . we be look at export , begin June 1 at about 900 million bushel , which would be about 100 million bushel lower than we will export in the 2005/06 year , which be currently estimate at a even 1 billion bushel , he say . Mr Bange say part of the reason be a stronger US price forecast in ' 06 / '07 due to lower production and tighter end stock . wheat price look set to improve on the back of the USDA report , which have also reveal a substantial increase in corn export . there be also higher domestic demand in the US for corn to make ethanol . Siam weed can be see in 90 per cent of the countryside in East Timor , and it cover the grassland , he say . the -lrb- stem -rrb- gall fly be re-produce here . they release 200 gall fly here last year . the gall fly survive through the dry season and be grow here now . Reverend John Flynn establish the Flying doctor at Cloncurry in north-west Queensland back in 1928 . senior flight nurse at the Mount Isa base , Mary Noon , say the rfds have come a long way since then , but still play a essential role in remote area . one day you can be deliver a baby , and the next day you be help somebody with chest pain , so it be a huge variation , she say . you get to meet such a variety of people , you get to see new place , different place every day as oppose to the ward . mining loss a correction , say analyst the mining sector have have a rough couple of day , with metal price fall sharply on the commodity market overnight . copper be the biggest loser , at one stage fall 9 per cent , with gold down 4 per cent , and silver 5 per cent . but analyst say it be not a global market meltdown , merely a long overdue correction on the mineral boom . I do not see any further risk or downside risk for wool at this stage , he say . we might see the market just tread water for a little while now . obviously grain , wheat be on a bit of a upward spiral and I mean generally there be no correlation between those and the other mineral commodity that we export . but obviously as far as food stuff go people have to eat and I think we be go to see a lot more go into Asia . rise inflation fear in the US have largely contribute to the weaker commodity price . the all Ordinaries Index have fall 93 point at the close of trade yesterday , with bulk-commodity company like BHP Billiton and Rio Tinto the hardest hit . President Jock Laurie reject suggestion the former chief executive be push by a divide board . cool reaction to qld water plan the Queensland Government be look to buy two large cotton property in the state 's south-west to return water to the Murray-Darling Basin . the buy-up be expect to cost up to $ 60 million and deliver 58,000 megalitre of water a year over the New South Wales border . the Federal Government reject a similar proposal four year ago to purchase the huge Cubbie Station . Grazier Pot Peterson be among New South Wales landholder who have be critical of the amount of water Queensland irrigator take out of the Condamine-Balonne river system , and say this plan will not be very beneficial . I be not say that they should not purchase it , but I just think it would be far more beneficial if they purchase something upstream that would have a big affect on we , because really the water virtually stop at Cubbie , he say . as we see in the 2004 flood they do have a big flood at St George but we do not get any of it here . the plan will be out to the Murray-Darling Ministerial Council meeting in Melbourne on Friday . meanwhile the Cubbie Group , which run Cubbie Station , have slam call by the New South Wales Government for its water allocation to be reduce . the station can store 500,000 megalitre of water for its cotton-growing operation , and grazier south of the border complain they be be starve of crucial flood water flow . but joint managing director John Grabbe say New South Wales should fix up evaporation loss in the Menindee Lakes in the state 's west , before attack Queensland 's science-based water allocation . oh get you own house in order , but let 's be fair dinkum , not just throw stone at each other , but let 's be fair dinkum , he say . I mean , water be too valuable a resource to be go up into the air in shallow storage system . now we do not do it at Cubbie , and I implore the southern state to seriously look at they storage system . Federal Agricultural Minister Peter McGauran say the CSIRO be scare-mongering , with a report call for bigger environmental flow for the Murray River . a extra 500 gigalitre have already be commit to the Murray , but the scientific body say up to five time more will be need to restore the river 's health . despite criticise that finding , Mr McGauran acknowledge progress have be slow on the live Murray Initiative , and say the report will be consider . eldest child not always the best farm manager : research New research have show the tradition of pass the farm onto the eldest child could be cost the sector its best talent . psychologist and social researcher , Dr Ian Ploughman , say by nature , older child be more conservative . he say younger sibling tend to be the most innovative and creative , but do not have the opportunity to contribute . the younger brother and sister commonly have less interest in stay on the farm , and be more creative and more mobile , he say . debt a obstacle to wool merger the wool industry remain committed to a merger between its promotion and research arm , despite a dispute over a $ 27 million debt . australian Wool Services , which own the woolmark brand , be seek financial help from the Federal Government to pay the debt , without success . the owe money relate to a pension fund for former uk-based employee . Chairman of Australian Wool Innovation Ian McLachlan say he understand the Government 's position , but there will not be a merger between the two company until the bill be pay . I have be in government and I think when a government have a position , it have to repeat that position , and it will hold that position until somebody come up with a really bright idea as to how we can solve it , he say . awb search for new market for strand wheat wheat exporter awb say it be try to find another market for a shipment of wheat strand at Geraldton in Western Australia , due to a quarantine dispute with India . the ship have be dock for a month , while talk have be under way to resolve the problem . the ship be expect to be load today . Land use bid concern fishing industry member of the aquaculture and fishing industry on South Australia 's Eyre Peninsula say they be worry about the possible impact of aboriginal claim over the region 's coastal water . negotiation have begin for indigenous Land Use Agreements -lrb- ILUA -rrb- , cover coastal land and water from Cowell to Venus Bay . Michael Whillas from the Seafood Council of South Australia say because the process be new , there be uncertainty about the future legal status of aquaculture lease and fishing rights . the problem that we face be that under the native Title Act , a native title claim be extinguish when there be a exist licence or lease , he say . under the ILUA , that do not necessarily happen . at this stage , there be some grey area . Group oppose give national park back to traditional owner a campaign to prevent 17 national park be return to they traditional owner have step up in the northern territory . the Territory Government intend to hand over the land title to traditional indigenous owner , and then lease it back for 99 year under a joint management plan . with plan to circulate petition , save we Parks campaigner Francoises Builder say there be plenty of opposition to any single group own park . WA to reap reward after Brazil iron deal western Australia 's economy look set for further growth , with Brazil , the world 's largest iron ore producer , negotiate a better-than-expected price hike . the market have tip a rise in the iron ore price of between 10 and 15 per cent , instead , it will go up 19 per cent . the deal between Brazil 's CVRD and German steel-maker ThyssenKrupp set the scene for increase iron price for WA miner . ANZ Bank commodity analyst Andrew Harrington say it also mean more royalty for government coffer . the higher the price the higher the volume , will inevitably lead to higher tax revenue for the government , he say . earlier in the year abare be forecast that iron ore would become the highest exporter earner for the country . Tasmania set for rail upgrade toll 's successful takeover of transport company Patrick have pave the way for a multi-million dollar rail upgrade in Tasmania . Pacific National , which be jointly own by the two company , threaten to stop cart container freight by rail last year , unless state and federal government help to improve infrastructure . after month of stall negotiation , Pacific National have now agree to invest $ 38 million in new rolling stock , while the government will provide $ 118 million for infrastructure . Tasmanian Minister for Infrastructure Jim Cox hope industry will also support a better rail service . draft dairy report recommend support for GM crop the dairy industry have be embarrass by the leak of a draft report that recommend it join other agricultural industry in support genetically modify -lrb- GM -rrb- crop . until now state government have have the backing of the dairy industry in ban commercial GM crop . the draft report be commission by the australian Dairy Industry Council -lrb- ADIC -rrb- and be not due to be release until much later this year . policy director with australian Dairy Farmers , Robert Poole , say the current policy be write seven year ago , and be due for review . have we not have it happen where it be now become public we would have certainly go to the point where we would have consult widely especially with dairy farmer and with dairy company , although they be part of the adic process and obviously ultimately government as well , he say . Mr Poole say it be a draft report and not industry policy . meanwhile a lead plant breeder say the dairy industry would save million of dollar , if it embrace GM crop . virus in pasture such as white clover cost the industry $ 110 million a year , but a virus-resistant clover could be on-farm by 2009 . Research director Professor German Spangenberg say that be just one reason for introduce genetically modify technology . Court rule against awb over ` apology ' document a Federal Court judge have rule against wheat exporter awb , in its fight to keep a so-called apology document confidential . the document be prepare on the advice of us-based public relation consultant , and be mistakenly include in evidence awb tender to the Cole inquiry . Justice Neil Young take just 10 minute to rule , AWB have no claim for legal professional privilege , and reject the company 's effort to keep the document confidential . Justice Young also find Commissioner Cole have every right to rule on the legal status of the document , a point dispute by AWB . Burgess make case to lead NFF no surprise and no big policy change be how prospective National Farmers ' Federation -lrb- NFF -rrb- boss Allan Burgess , say he will lead the organisation if elect president . Mr Burgess , NFF 's trade representative , will contest next month 's leadership ballot against former Meat and Livestock Australia boss David Crombie . the victorian say make sure farmer get a fair price for they produce and maintain a good relationship with urban Australia be key issue . he say bring Western Australia and South Australia back into the nff fold be also high on he list of priority . at the very highest priority for Allan Burgess in any organisation he be ever be a part of have be about get a collective view , he say . in my experience farm organisation only work well when you can come to one consensus . Inquiry release AWB apology the head of the oil for Food Inquiry , Commissioner Terence Cole have just release the apology document , prepared between AWB , company lawyer and US public relation consultant Dr Peter Sandman . the document , draft by former MD Andrew Lindberg , state that AWB accept in pay money for inland transportation and after sale service , it pay money to the Iraq government in contravention of the UN sanction . the document also state that although there be warn sign , awb do not challenge the payment and for this they be truly sorry , and deeply regret any damage this may have cause to Australia 's trading reputation , the australian government or the United Nations . the statement admit they fail to consider the implication of UN sanction , and should have have they own internal system of check and balance to stop any abuse of the oil for food program . it conclude there be no excuse for what happen , that the company simply should have do better , and that Mr Lindberg be deeply sorry that it do not . AWB have decide not to release the document , but it be mistakenly tender to the Cole Inquiry , along with other AWB evidence . live trade to Egypt may re-start soon the Federal Government have confirm it be work on a plan which could see the livestock export trade to Egypt reopen in a matter of week . the trade to Egypt be ban in February when the 60 Minutes program air footage show animal be treat outside industry standard . Agriculture Minister Peter McGauran say he investigation prove the cattle be not australian , but he shut the trade because the humane handling of australian animal could not be guarantee . the Minister now say industry be form a plan which will animal treat better . there may well be some australian stockman or vet or locally employ and trust staff , he say . but RSPCA National President Hugh Wirth say more than increase supervision be need . you can do all the supervise you like , it be not go to change the fact that the abattoir worker have a great deal of difficulty deal with australian cattle . around 12,000 head of cattle be export to Egypt last year worth around $ 10 million . the cattle industry say the finding of a new report add weight to the argument to resume the live cattle trade with Egypt , with appropriate monitoring . Cameron Hall from Livecorp say the report have find Australia have the highest animal welfare standard in the world . there need to be appropriate system and appropriate monitoring to ensure some of the reason that the trade be halt and suspend in the first place , can not continue and particularly we can guarantee level of assurance that the animal that we market into those country be process and handle with a level of care that we would expect , he say . the report be commission by Livecorp and Meat and Livestock Australia . the first shipment of live cattle out of the far north Queensland city of Townsville in three year be due to leave at the weekend . boom time for feedlot strong export demand and the ongoing drought have push the feedlot sector to record height . Australia now have just under 900,000 head of cattle on feed , with Queensland and Western Australia record the biggest jump . but Malcolm Foster from the Lotfeeders Association have sound a note of caution . he say the United States could be back supply beef into Japan and Korea as early as next month , which will provide stiff competition for we grain-fed product . it be very good news , but this situation 's be go on now for two year , he say . Report recommend GM grass for dairy cow the South Australian Dairyfarmers Association say it will support the introduction of genetically modify -lrb- GM -rrb- pasture grass if consumer accept they . a leak draft report for the australian Dairy Industry Council recommend introduce GM grass for dairy cow , after research point to massive productivity gain from the new technology . SA association president , David Basham , say the industry need to do more investigation . we need to keep that research go , we need to make sure that if consumer be ready to move on , we be there ready to adopt , he say . if the market be not willing to accept GM product then we as a industry can not accept it and that may be the way it go . and there be deeply divide view on GM pasture in Victoria . concern over inferior wool in bale concern have be raise about the grow number of wool bale that have inferior quality wool deliberately hide in they . the australian Wool Exchange -lrb- AWEX -rrb- say buyer be lose confidence in the quality of australian wool because of falsely present bale and a rise in contaminate and unprepared fleece . awex woolclasser registrar Greg Sawyer say the market slump have see grower try to cut corner , but it be turn buyer off altogether . we know of mill around the world that have notify AWEX of wool that for argument sake may have 10-bale line of fleece wool , eight bale be well prepared and the last two bale may be top up with inferior wool which have not be , he say . nlis frustration in Tas Tasmanian cattle producer be frustrate by the state 's roll-out of the National Livestock identification system . they be still require to use tailtag , as well as the new electronic ear tag , even though the rest of Australia will be tail-tag free from July 1 . tasmanian nlis coordinator John Cameron say they need to be able to guarantee trace-back to the last property of origin before tail tag can be remove . at the moment there be still a lot of cattle with nlis tag in they ear that be not register to the correct property on the database , he say . so if they be send to a saleyard or abattoir the database do not have the correct information about where they be . Govt assess drought in NSW the ongoing impact of the drought be be assess first hand in New South Wales by Federal Government assessor . the National Rural Advisory Council have embark on a extensive tour of area come to the end of exceptional circumstance drought relief . Sheep specialist Doug Alcock have help the council to understand the severity of the drought from Canberra south to the alpine region . water be the biggest issue in term of the effort and money that be be put into infrastructure in term of tank and new bore and reticulation system , he say . people run polypipe anything up to a couple of kilometre just to get water into paddock , it be very expensive and heartbreaking in country that nobody have any live memory of ever go dry some of the spring . Coastal farmer in the region be also be hit hard by drought . sick sheep seek out healthy food : research scientist have know for a long time that sheep seek out food to gather the nutrient they need , but new research suggest they can choose food to cure illness . CSIRO Livestock Industries in Western Australia believe sick sheep will search for plant that make they better . it be conduct a trial in WA 's wheatbelt to work out which plant be eat by sheep to improve they health and production level . senior research scientist dr Dean Revell say down the track , farmer might even be able to incorporate medicinal paddock into they farm management . maybe they have to have a continual exposure to these , so they have to be incorporate into the grazing base , the feed base , he say . the former option be more attractive , where we can set up and manage a separate paddock and take they there when need . WA impose ban to stop virus western Australia have ban any plant material from the east which could host the yellow leaf curl virus . the virus be find in tomato crop near Brisbane and Bundaberg last month . Fiji look to dairy Fiji be hope for a boom in its dairy industry , as its dominant sugar industry face a downturn . a delegation have be tour dairy farm in Victoria this week to investigate alternative way of farming . until recently the European Union have give preferential market treatment to fijian sugar , but with a EU restructure , it be become hard for sugar grower to stay in business . Economist with the Fijian Ministry of Agriculture Waisiici Gonemaituba think favourable rainfall condition will be a advantage for dairy farmer . we get rain nearly every two day which be good for pasture production and the dairy industry as a whole , he say . landcare to honour Farley the australian Landcare Council plan to pay tribute to co-founder Rick Farley by a annual award in he honour . a former head of the National Farmers Federation , Mr Farley , as also instrumental in establish the Landcare movement . he die on Saturday . landcare chairman Bobbie Brazil say the award will honour Mr Farley 's work and vision . Wimmera farmer say awb should have release apology letter sooner wheat grower say awb could have take the heat of the accusation it have pay kickback to the former iraqi government , by publish a letter of apology before the oil for Food Inquiry . the Inquiry yesterday release a document prepare by former AWB manage director Andrew Lindberg in December , which say the company be truly sorry it do not challenge the payment , despite warning sign , and it should have do better . farmer in Victoria 's Wimmera region say by try to block the letter 's release through the Federal Court , AWB have only raise further question about what it be try to hide . I would have believe that if it have have be presenter prior to the Cole Inquiry it may have defuse quite a lot of the heat and argument within the Cole Inquiry itself , one farmer say . in hindsight awb should have publish a very similar letter , if not the same letter early on in the piece and the witch-hunt might not have go on to the extent that it have , another farmer say . a rural public relation consultant agree that the apology document should have be release earlier . Mark Paterson from Currie Communications say it would have make a big difference to AWB 's reputation . look at the draft statement of contrition , it be a excellent letter of apology , he say . yes it admit guilt , but what it show be that AWB be human , and at no point at any time during this whole process have they demonstrate any humility at all . meanwhile , eight wheat exporter , include Cargill , Glencorp and AWB have bid for the latest tender to supply 3 million tonne of wheat to India . States debate Murray River fund allocation there have finally be some progress in effort to establish a national water trading system . the eastern state appear to be try to settle they difference over the future of water at a meeting of the Murray Darling Ministerial Council in Melbourne . the council be also debate how to carve up a extra $ 500 million in federal funding to improve the environmental health of the Murray River . while there be yet to be a national agreement on how water may be buy back by government into the Murray system , the state be make some progress of they own . Victoria and NSW have reach a in-principle deal to trade water which may be up and run by the end of the year . while the detail of exit fee and other cost be yet to be work out , both state have agree the australian competition and Consumer Commission should review any deal to make sure it be fair for all side . Victoria and South Australia have already a agreement on water trading prior to today 's meeting . Doug Miell from the New South Wales Irrigators Council , say the state have manage to convince Victoria and South Australia of the merit of a system of tag trading . we have get the water that Victoria and South Australia have really get they eye on , so it be simply a case of he who have the gold make the rule , he say . irrigator group oppose Snowy Hydro sale key irrigator group in southern New South Wales have withdraw they support for the sale of the Snowy Hydro electric scheme . they be worry about a plan 10 per cent cap on individual shareholding after the company be sell by the federal , New South Wales and victorian government . George Warne from Murray Irrigation say the propose safeguard be not enough to protect the business from a international takeover . I think one of the really big issue be the fact that Australia 's largest single store water resource - the Snowy Hydro scheme and its operation and the timing of release and the power that be generate from - it be go to leave government ownership and go into private hand , he say . we think they would dissipate that effect by have a maximum cap of 5 per cent or 10 per cent that any one party could own . Australia to lead climate change deal negotiation Australia will lead negotiation on a new international climate change deal to replace the Kyoto protocol which be due to expire in 2012 . the framework , to be co-develop with Germany and South Africa , will apply to almost 200 country . Mick Keogh from the Australian Farm Institute say farmer have lead the way in reduce greenhouse emission and should not be further penalise . he say federal and state government can not take credit for work largely undertake by farmer . there be only one sector of the australian economy that be make a very significant contribution to the reduction in the growth of Australia 's greenhouse emission and that be the farm sector , he say . seven-day forecast now available to regional area Farmers across Australia can now access seven-day forecast from the weather bureau , as well as the traditional four-day advice . week-long forecast have be available to city dweller for some time , but they have now be roll out on a trial basis at 600 weather site around Australia , include regional area . Anne Farrell from the Bureau of Meteorology in Brisbane say the forecast have some shortcoming , but will be accurate for a range of factor . temperature-wise I think the performance be generally pretty good , she say . rainfall-wise there be still a lot of work to be do to try and get higher reliability in that as we go further ahead in that seven-day outlook . but it be at the point that we think that there be sufficient skill in that , that its worth put it out there for the public to make use of . the seven-day forecast will be available free of charge through a website call australian Rio Tinto set new iron ore price benchmark mining giant Rio Tinto have confirm it will receive 19 per cent more this year for iron ore ship from WA , make it the benchmark price for other deal . the deal between japanese steel mill and Rio Tinto closely follow a similar deal between Germany and Brazil . I be certain that there be crop that require intensive farm that be suitable to small holding , he say . pyrethrum price cut tasmanian crop farmer have be deal another blow , a cut in pyrethrum price . Tasmania be the world 's second largest producer of the daisy , which be use to make natural insecticide . grower group chairman Scott Langton say the 5 per cent price cut have be attribute to a world oversupply and be likely to halt further development . what we be really after be just a fair and equitable return so that we can still maintain forward advancement in technology so that we be ready to take up new technology that come on , he say . WA farmer anxious for rain Graingrowers in Western Australia be anxiously wait for some substantial rainfall to come out of a cold front expect to pass through in the next two day . along with many farmer in the east , grow in the northern agricultural region have be dry sowing since March and be now start to worry about the impact of the ongoing dry . CSIRO plant scientist John Passioura say farmer underestimate how strong seed really be . if you have a false start and you get a bit of rain and the seed start to swell up and so and it be do all of the get the machinery ready to go , the biochemical machinery , then , it will skip that phase when you get the next good rain , he say . demand for alpaca wool increase if you have get a alpaca or two run around the backyard , you be be urge to shear it and sell the fleece . the industry 's marketing body say there have be a big jump in demand for alpaca fibre which can not be meet . Dr Mike Tyler from the University of Adelaide say they be hope cane toad smell will have a similar pull power . if it be a attractant we would be able to attract perhaps female in such number that instead of have to go around and pick up one here and one there , we might be able to attract they together , he say . Brett Stevenson , from market check , say even better price be be offer for wheat for March 2008 and 2009 , and at around $ 250 a tonne , they be just below the 1995 record . we be face for the first time a situation where the forward price three year in the future be at extraordinarily high level , nearly record , Mr Brett Stevenson say . we have get massive amount of money invest into the metal . we think some of that money maybe come in to the soft commodity fund in other word , wheat , you know , grain , that sort of thing . weaker price for indian wheat deal despite a boom in wheat future and the lowest global wheat stock in 25 year , australian farmer be not get top grain price this season . in the latest deal , Australia be believe to have offer to sell wheat to India at a much lower price than its major competitor . grain analyst Malcolm Bartholomaeus say that be largely due to the practise of sell each year 's stock , before the next season 's harvest . while it may be tempting to hold wheat back against this rise market and achieve higher price later in the year , the practise in Australia have really be to clear each crop before the next one come in basically at whatever price , he say . the storage and handle company and grower get pretty cranky if we go into the next harvest with stock still be hold in the system and I guess if awb think that to get rid of the wheat they need to push it out at lower price , then that be what they be do . continue bear market may lead to nervous investor the Australian Stock Exchange have begin trade marginally weaker , despite stronger commodity price on the London Metal Exchange overnight . in 10 day the local market have drop $ 80 billion , react to weaken metal price . although many analyst say the market need a correction , Hartleys resource expert Rob Brierley say investor will start to get nervous if this bear market continue . probably another week of this and people would be extremely worried , he say . Road cut ` add to Wadeye violence ' Poor road infrastructure be say to have contribute to ongoing violence within the Northern Territory 's largest indigenous community . flooding cut off the community of Wadeye for six month of every year and with only sea or air access it be hard for police to reach . at least four home have be destroy during violence in recent day . about 100 resident have flee and be camp in tent beside the Port Keats Road in the lower Daly region . fifty people be strand at the Daly River Crossing . Mango farmer Gary Higgins say they be be force to camp at he front gate . yesterday when we come in there be about 30 or 40 people all at we front gate , he say . there be a big rock bar there and they actually use that from there to get across into the community opposite . they can only get they vehicle to we front gate . fmg consider rail access appeal a bid by the Fortescue Metals Group -lrb- FMG -rrb- to use a BHP Billiton railway in Western Australia 's Pilbara have fail . while the line be own by the mining giant , FMG have argue it should be allow access to take advantage of the resource boom , instead of have to build another railway . after year of debate , Treasurer Peter Costello be expect to make a announcement on the proposal yesterday but the deadline pass without comment . FMG 's Julian Tapp say the company be look at how it might appeal the decision , which be a blow for all small iron ore company in the region . we have be do this not just for ourselves , but for general public interest , he say . drought-hit farmer hope for transport subsidy the grip of the drought be tighten in New South Wales . the latest figure show nearly two-third of the state be drought declare , and much of the rest be marginal . only 10 per cent of the state be consider satisfactory . State primary Industries Minister Ian Macdonald have spend the morning discuss the deteriorate condition with he colleague in Cabinet . Roma saleyard replace stock id equipment Australia 's biggest saleyard be change its national livestock identification equipment but management deny that be because it be not efficient . run-through scanner be introduce at Roma in southern Queensland in July last year , to comply with the new animal traceback law . since there there have be complaint of time delay and ongoing debate over whether the equipment or the agent be to blame . Rob Loughnan , from the saleyard 's board , say delay be a issue . but he say the main reason for the change be because the system can not easily separate a individual beat from a herd . the market research be tell we that very soon the buyer will be want to know if there be a animal in a particular pen that be not lifetime traceable and that be not go to suit they requirement and that be go to have to be highlight , he say . study to consider wine industry 's future increase domestic and international competition have prompt a new study into the future direction of the wine industry . the australian wine and Brandy Corporation and the Winemakers Federation of Australia be conduct the state of the industry study , which be to be release next year . but the report will not offer short-term solution for grower unable to sell they grape . the federation 's Dominic Nolan say it be to protect the long-term future of the wine industry , and be not a knee-jerk reaction to the grape glut . the decision that we make about plant today really have a impact in five year ' time or beyond , he say . what we be look at be very much a strategic document , we be talk what be go to happen in the next 10 to 20 year . vet 's braham fertility research honour the highest accolade in veterinary science have be award to a man partly responsible for the success of brahman cattle in northern Australia . Dr Keith Entwistle have be award the Gilruth Prize at the australian veterinary Association 's annual conference in Hobart this week . he say year of research with he colleague help to solve problem with cow and bull fertility , when the brahman breed be first introduce . a lot of the research that we do over the last 30 year have certainly contribute to the wider use of the brahman , he say . awb profit rise despite scandal despite the oil-for-food inquiry and a slide share price , wheat handler AWB have deliver a strong half-year result . AWB admit it be in a difficult operating environment but its profit be up 5 per cent to $ 86 million before tax . profit have be boost by a strong performance from the national pool , as well as business outside the wheat trade . the Cole inquiry have cost almost $ 10 million so far . the final bill be expect to total $ 18 million , as long as there be no extension . while happy with the return , chairman Brendan Stewart say the company be determine to restore its reputation . I think what this demonstrate be that while we be in challenging time , that AWB be a very resilient business and we have get a good foundation for the future , Mr Stewart say . Mr Stewart have reaffirm the company 's plan to separate AWB Limited from its international export arm . this be a clear direction from the board that we be prepare to make change that deliver security and certainty to the single desk , he say . AWB 's result also divulge a payout worth more than $ 1 million to former managing director Andrew Lindberg . WA lift wheat import ban wheat variety from the eastern state will be allow back into western Australia , with the lifting of a ban on import . the restriction have be in place since December to try to prevent the introduction of wheat streak mosaic virus . storm season prediction lift oil price the price of a barrel of crude oil have go up again overnight , after the United States ' weather forecaster predict a above-average storm season in the Gulf of Mexico . twenty per cent of the gulf 's oil facility be still off-line from last season . ANZ Bank commodity analyst Andrew Harrington say it be the 11th above-average cyclone season in a row , and be raise question about the effect of climate change . another above-average season do not say much when the average be creep upward , he say . I guess it be kind of ironic when fossil fuel be drive the climate change and then you have climate change hammer fossil fuel supplies . vet push for foreign abattoir audits the australian veterinary association want a grading system for overseas abattoir , to better manage the welfare of export livestock . national president Dr Matt Makin say the treatment of australian animal once they be unloaded in overseas port be become a increasingly contentious part of the trade . cattle export to Egypt be suspend earlier this year , after mistreatment concern be raise . egg , which can be carry in soil material . wine export price drop the latest wine industry survey have find wine export price be down by a third since 2002 and 40 per cent of australian winery be run at a loss . the Deloitte Wine Industry Benchmarking Survey indicate many winery be struggle to survive , particularly in export market . deliotte partner Stephen Harvey say the big supermarket chain chain , you sainbury , Tescos , Aldis etc , he say . that of course do have a flow-on effect to the branded wine . if people be able to buy buyer ' own brand at very cheap price , it naturally add some pricing pressure to you more popular and well-known brand . meanwhile , grape grower in South Australia 's Riverland have welcome the proposal for a partial compensation package . about 600 about Snowy Hydro privatisation opposition to the privatisation of Snowy Hydro continue to build . the nation 's chief rural lobby group have , for the first time , express serious concern about the a new principle for we in Australia that do not negatively impact on the people who benefit from that water currently , he say . the three federal independent will table a motion in Parliament today , call for the sale to be block entirely . and Nationals MP Kay Hull plan to introduce a private member 's bill into Federal Parliament to permanently cap individual shareholding in Snowy Hydro to 10 per cent . the legislation would also stipulate that the majority of director be australian and that the head office remain in this country . Mrs Hull oppose the sale , but say , as a last resort , this bill would limit foreign ownership . I will continue to fight the sale , this be a safety net in the event the sale can not be cease , she say . I want to ensure that enshrine in legislation be all of the safeguard that need to take place to ensure that big company and overseas company can not come in and buy up the Snowy . it be unclear whether the private member 's bill will receive the support of the government or the Opposition . Strawberry price tip to fall Strawberry price could fall dramatically later this year . Queensland 's strawberry season be under way , with grower enjoy the best price they have see in over a decade - up to $ 8 a punnet in some supermarket . but Bill Sharpe , from the Queensland Strawberry Growers Association , say there will be a oversupply and rock-bottom price by September . somewhere along the line the middle man get certainly the benefit of it with this oversupply , but the blame be sort of twofold anyway , he say .
