Govt urge to protect local ethanol industry the ethanol industry say it will be devastate by a Federal Government proposal to allow cheap import into Australia . legislation table in Parliament call for the excise on import ethanol to be reduce by 2011 to the same rate as locally-produced biofuel . it also outline a planned increase in tax for australian-made ethanol from 2.5 cent a litre to 12.5 cent . Bob Gordon from Renewable Fuels Australia say the government should do more to protect the local industry . unlike other country we be go to be one of the first country in the world to actually tax renewable fuel , he say . now we be prepare to live with that but we want a regime for transition that stimulate new industry growth rather than undermine it . the one propose in the tax Bill will clearly undermine that goal . Resources Minister Ian Macfarlane have deny the claim . he say ethanol will still have a excise advantage over petrol and the industry have have year to prepare for the change . meanwhile the Federal Government have decide to phase in its change to the diesel fuel rebate , to give farmer and transport operator time to adjust . the plan will replace cash payment to farmer with a refund add to gst rebate and be due to be implement on July 1 . but now , during a two-year transition period , farmer will be able to claim they rebate , but will also have to report it in business activity statement . South Australian farmer Doug Hall say that will make the system more complicated . I just do not see it be any easier at all , it just do not make sense to I so why be they play around with this you know , who be the winner at the end of the day ? he say . I be certainly not sure it be the farmer , it be the damn government again . the renewable energy industry want a national incentive-based market to encourage consumer to use cleaner fuel . it have release a report look at development to 2050 , in which renewable energy will be cheaper , have high export potential and provide a clean and cheap solution to climate change and energy shortage . David Holland from Renewable Energy Generators Australia say the Federal Government should extend tax break to get the technology up and run . the technology will always be more expensive than the old process of pull coal out of the ground and set fire to it , he say . the environment be a critical issue not just for Australia but for the planet and really the government be the only people that be in the position to take that leadership but there need to be some systemic process that drive the move towards renewable . the government have reject the call , say hundred of million of dollar have already be allocate to renewable energy generation . Code of practice limit use of sow stall the pork industry have agree to limit the use of sow stall under a new code of practice for the welfare of pig . australian Pork Limited , the peak body represent producer , say it will reduce the amount of time pig spend in the stall , from the full 16 week of pregnancy to six week . Peter Robertson from the New South Wales Farmers Association say it be a proactive step to improve animal care . the industry have take the decision that we have to concede that we need to have sow with a little more exercise during gestation , he say . by the same token we need the sow stall for the first six week that they be pregnant so that they do not abort and have other problem at that stage . Foundation chief executive Daryl Smeaton say it do not make sense that $ 2 billion have be spend on campaign against illicit drug , when only 5 per cent of the population use they . he say for 85 per cent of people , alcohol be they drug of choice . we think of a drug problem , we think of cannabis and amphetamine because that be what the Federal Government keep on tell we , he say . ta cow test positive for hydatid tapeworm a tasmanian breed cow have test positive for the hydatid tapeworm , the state 's first case in a decade . Tasmania embark on a world lead hydatid eradication program 40 year ago and while hydatid have be discover since , most have be trace to import stock . the state be declare provisionally-free of hydatid disease in 1996 . Chief vet Rod Andrewartha say the infected cow be part of a mixed line of cattle . occasionally of course we will detect cyst and we can normally trace they back to sheep or cattle import from the mainland , in this particular case we find it in a animal which be bear and breed in Tasmania , he say . herpes-like virus threaten Vic abalone stock effort be under way to control a herpes-like virus which be kill abalone off the south-west victorian coast . the disease , ganglioneuritis , have be detect at four farm in south-west Victoria and at Flinders near Port Phillip Bay , with million of dollar worth of stock have to be destroy . Fisheries Victoria say the disease have now escape into the wild off Port Fairy . Fisheries executive director Peter Appleford say although a similar disease devastate the abalone industry in Taiwan in 2003 , he be hopeful control measure will stop a further spread here . what we be look at be to put some control in place along the coastline to limit the activity there , he say . Dept , fisherman warn of import prawn disease Queensland 's Department of primary Industries have issue a warning against use import raw prawn as bait , amid grow concern they could carry disease . commercial fisherman want raw prawn import stop , claim health inspection be too random . they say up to 60 consignment have recently test positive for white spot disease , the so-called foot and mouth of prawn . Dr Ian Anderson , Queensland 's principal veterinary pathologist on fish disease , agree that import do pose a threat . prawn import for human consumption can get purchase by recreational fisher and then use in they fishing activity and so that be a potential route of the spread of the virus from the import product for human consumption through to we wild fishery stock , Dr Anderson say . lobster fisherman deny flood market with snapper South Australian lobster fisherman have reject claim they be flood the market with snapper and force down price . the SA Rock Lobster Advisory Council say fisherman be entitle to fish for snapper in the lobster off-season but have only catch 10 tonne of the fish since July last year . Spokesman Daryl Spencer have deny claim that two lobster boat unloaded 10 tonne of snapper each at Port Lincoln at the weekend . there be one boat at this point in time since the end of we lobster season that be actually target snapper and in the 10 day that he have be fishing , he be take in total 3.9 tonne in total , he say . indonesian fisherman jail for poach sea cucumber eleven indonesian fisherman have be jail after be catch poach the sea cucumber , trepang , in australian water north of Broome in Western Australia last month . they be on board two boat intercept by the Navy at Scott reef . one of the captain have be sentence to seven month jail , while the other captain and nine crew member have be fine . they will spend between three and six month in jail because they could not pay the penalty . CSIRO report urge rural , urban water trading a major scientific report say city water authority should be allow to buy water from farmer to sustain the grow urban population . the CSIRO say without reform , water cost in metropolitan area could rise more than 10 time over the next 25 year . the report from the CSIRO and Monash University predict Perth , Brisbane and Sydney will be the worst affected city with the price of water jump up to 10 time unless better reform be put in place . three model have be test and CSIRO say the most successful would be a combination of urban and rural water trading , alongside more efficient water use include desalination plant . and while farmer could make a lot of money from water trading , the system would change the face of agriculture in Australia . the CSIRO 's Mike Young say urban/rural water trading be already work in South Australia and WA farmer be lead the way in save water . Agriculture 's a lot more skilful in improve water use efficiency and in 25 year time they have make a 50 per cent greater advance than urban Australia , so there be a challenge for urban Australia to catch up and show they be actually as smart as we farmer be , Mr Young say . bit some irrigator be worry about the social impact of water be divert into the capital city . although he believe some form of water trading with the city be inevitable , victorian dairy farmer max fehring say government need to make sure urban resident share the cost of water infrastructure with rural community . Aust wheat price surge on back of international season there be finally some good news for grain grower today , with international competition drive a big surge in wheat price for the 2006-07 season . AWB have release its first price estimate for wheat deliver to the national pool next harvest , with the benchmark australian Premium White Wheat sit at $ 222 a tonne , up $ 30 on last season . National Pool manager David Johnson say while price can still change , Australia be in a good position to capitalise on lower world production figure . we have a much stronger fundamental story around hard wheat in particular at the moment , with the US hard red winter crop experience some production difficulty , he say . expensive feed grain price impact on grazier grazier buy grain to feed livestock this winter be feel the pinch , with price continue to rise . Dry condition , higher petrol price and strong global grain price be all affect the cost of feed grain . Ron Storey from Australian Crop Forecasters say the success of grain-fed beef export be also put more demand on supply . we demand here for grain domestically be be underpin very , very solidly by a very strong feedlot cattle market , with grain-fed beef be in strong demand where BSE have give Australia pretty much by most of the market , he say . Aust Farm Institute urge drought policy reform the latest conclusion on drought policy reform , prepare for the Australian Farm Institute , say farmer should be encourage to be better prepare for drought and government need a major overhaul of how financial assistance be provide . several expert have prepare papers for the Institute and most agree that current drought policy be too focus on crisis management . Financial adviser Rob Brown argue the policy penalise farmer who run they business in way to cope with drought . if you have prepare , in fact if you have do the thing that be the objective of the drought policy , then you will not be eligible , he say . and while there be a belief that government policy can actually worsen the wellbeing of farmer and waste resource , other say that fewer farmer be ask for help because of better farm management . Linda Botterill from the University of NSW believe a income base loan scheme would be simpler and more effective at help farmer through drought , and be less of a knee-jerk reaction from government . suspected illegal fisherman head to Broome for question six indonesian fisherman suspect of poach the sea cucumber trepang , have be take to Broome for question by australian custom . the Navy intercept the fisherman at the weekend on a boat near Scotts reef , 250 kilometre off the north-west coast of Western Australia . Customs spokesman Peter Costantino claim they be catch with the sea cucumber on board . there be a small quantity of trepang find on board the vessel when the Navy board it and the fisherman be actively fishing at that time and diving on the reef , he say . the vessel start to be tow into Broome , but unfortunately break up . the six fisherman be transport to the HMAS Larrakia and the vessel be destroy at sea . Childers farm test for cane smut there be fear that a exotic disease discover on a sugarcane farm in south-east Queensland could be the devastating cane smut . Queensland 's Department of primary Industries have quarantine a property near Childers after suspect plant be discover late last week . Cane smut , which can stunt growth and cause production loss of between 20 and 30 per cent , be consider the highest exotic disease risk for sugarcane in Australia . while the Canegrowers Organisation say the disease have not be confirm , general manager Ian Ballantyne say the industry be prepare . Canegrowers be member of a thing call Plant Health Australia and through Plant Health Australia we bring together BSES , state and federal government , ourselves , and other party who be interested and have a affect on disease incursion , he say . we have learn a lot I think over the year from citrus canker and thing like the popia fruit fly and now we think it be better to overreact early than under-react . rain hit nsw crop area crop area in New South Wales have receive they first major rainfall for the season . condition take a turn for the better on the same day last year and while the rain be not as heavy this time , it be just as welcome . cereal crop producer across inland new South Wales be face another bleak season , with no rainfall during autumn across the majority of the state . this change on Saturday . most inland area receive between 10 and 30 millimetre , with the majority of the crop belt receive around the old inch mark . many tractor have start up this morning , to get the winter crop in . Subsoil moisture level be still very low to non-existent and so crop will again be reliant on in crop rainfall . Michael Matthews from Young say the rain do bring hope . US lower wheat production forecast the US Department of Agriculture -lrb- USDA -rrb- have again lower its 2006 and 2007 wheat production forecast , at the same time as grain price soar . production estimate now total just over 1.8 billion bushel , or more than 48 million tonne . last month 's US wheat forecast be down 11 per cent from the previous marketing year . now , USDA World Agriculture Outlook Board chairman Gerald Bange say continue dry condition have cut the 06/07 forecast by 14 per cent , and stock by nearly 25 per cent . and as a result of that , we be in fact , see a stronger price , he say . the price outlook now call for about $ 3.90 at the midpoint which be up nearly 50 cent from the 2005-06 year and would , in fact , be the highest price since the $ 4.30 that be record in 1996 , contribute to lower US wheat export , forecast off about 100 million bushel , at about 900 million bushel . the USDA report catch commodity trader in Australia offguard . Tony Smith from Plum Grove say no one be expect such significant change . well , in the first two minute , the market react as expect , he say . the future exchange open up , the market go straight up and then within two minute everyone , include myself , be catch by surprise because they just fall in a heap . no bail-out package for grape grower federal Agriculture Minister Peter McGauran have refuse to bail out the nation 's struggle grape grower , say the government be not to blame for the current oversupply . Ahead of a national wine summit hold in Melbourne on Friday , industry group be look for partial compensation from the government to help grower mothball or hibernate they vine . but Mark McKenzie from Winegrape Growers Australia say the proposal be not even put on the table , and it be a disappointing result . the Minister make it clear that it be a industry issue the industry need to sort itself out , he say . outside the framework of what be currently available there be not anything special put on the table other than additional funding to scope the nature of the issue to provide more information to grower to allow they to make those commercial decision for themselves go forward . in the west , many grape contract be come to a end , and John Griffiths from the WA Wine Industry Association say the situation be fragile . while warm climate grow area have already be hit hard , with fruit leave on the vine , the oversupply problem be expect to hit cooler area over the next two year . Mr Griffiths say the real crunch for WA be yet to come . even if the news itself be not great it be better that it be clear . you be either industry and you go to make some profit or you probably ought to get out . Desert race come to a end Australia 's most challenging off-road race be come to a end at Alice Springs . hundred of competitor in the Finke Desert Race have pitch they buggy , car and motorbike at 450 kilometre of some of the toughest terrain in the country . it be windy , freezing cold and extremely dusty at the 31st Finke Desert Race . only a third of competitor usually complete the track , which be full of bulldust , desert oak tree to dodge and about 70 kilometre of woop which be like drive over thousand of volkswagon in a row . already the winner in the buggy have make it home , first place go to father/son team Shannon and Ian Wrench from Warrnambool , Victoria . Ploughmen dig in at championship twenty of Australia 's best ploughmen battle for first place at the weekend 's National Ploughing Championships in Tasmania . pit they technical precision against the clock , farmer also have to work in dense fog while compete at Cressy , in the state 's north . two Victorians be the winner , Adrian Tilling for conventional ploughing , and David Smith for reversible ploughing , and both will represent Australia at the world title next year . Cane smut find on qld property authority have confirm the discovery of the exotic disease sugar cane smut at a farm near Childers , in south-east Queensland . at the start of another cane crush , it be a massive blow to the sector , which have be enjoy good price . the infected property have be quarantine and wider surveillance be underway . property owner Joe Russo , who be also the chairman of the Isis District Canegrowers , say it have be a horrible time . not only myself , but the whole family , be quite devastate to hear the news , he say . there be no doubt we have all understand the disasterous effect smut can bring , but to have it record not only in you district , then to have it on you own property , be of a concern . the entire cane crop on the east coast will be inspect for the disease . Queensland have be one of only a few commercial grow region in the world without cane smut , which can cause major production loss . Eoin Wallis from research group BSES Limited say the situation be extremely serious , even though only one infected plant have be find . at the moment , because we have not find anymore plant , we be not able to say whether this be a widespread infestation or simply quite local , he say . water shortage threaten lettuce supplies production of australian lettuce could drop by up to 60 per cent by septelettuce shortagember because of a lack of water in storage outside Melbourne . disease . so far they be very rare and they have only be find because of this massively increase surveillance , he say . wheat grower call for continued government assistance with a new farm bill on I have actually sight a couple of situation , very small area in paddock where the crop have actually die , he say . GM cotton row heat up debate over genetically-modified -lrb- GM -rrb- cotton in northern Australia be heat up , with two biotechnology company apply to the Commonwealth regulator for licence . the Office of the Gene Technology Regulator -lrb- OGTR -rrb- reject a similar proposal four year ago , which mean GM cotton can not be grow commercially in the australian tropics . environmental group say any new GM cotton could become establish as a tropical weed . but Ord River farmer Rob Boshammer say it be unfair that the north be miss out on the new technology . I think it be a very dangerous situation where part of the country can be allow to use technology and other part not , he say . it seem totally unfair to I if you live one side of the 26th parallel you can grow GM cotton , if you live a metre the other side of the 26th parallel you can not . it seem to put a economic impost on we . WA Govt look to Europe to toughen illegal fishing law the western australian government have look to lead from Europe for tough new law on illegal fishing . Fisheries Minister Jon Ford say those catch in state water will now face fine of up to $ 150,000 and longer jail sentence . the change also give state fishery officer new power to seize suspect illegal vessel , even if they do not have a actual catch on board . Mr Ford say international fishing law do not have enough clout . I send my officer over to Europe to talk to the OECD authority that deal with illegal fishing , he say . they tell we it be very difficult to get a conviction under international law , it be unlikely that it would change in the near future . we best chance be to strengthen we law at a domestic level . US cattlemen unhappy with japanese beef trade term the US beef industry be not impress by Japan 's agreement to re-open its market to US beef after Tokyo complete inspection of US plant in July . Trade adviser for the National Cattlemen 's beef association , Greg Doud , complain it have be two-and-a-half year and the US have trade no beef with Japan . now on the eve of a visit to the US by Prime Minister Junichiro Koizumi , Japan have agree to resume import , but keep out the vast majority of US beef with what Mr Doud say be a unscientific barrier to trade . we be not go to be happy until we be at a international guideline , and we be able to trade everything , at a minimum , under 30 month of age , he say . Japan insist on a 20-month standard to combat mad cow disease . the US cattlemen back trade sanction against Japan , introduce by several US lawmaker , until Japan finally lift its US beef ban . the Cattle Council of Australia be cautiously welcome the news . Executive director David Innal say the sooner consumer confidence about the safety of beef return , the better for all cattle producer . we welcome the US beef come back into the market , he say . since bse be detect total consumption of beef be down about 15 per cent and what we be about be see that total pie grow of beef consumption . New ` Team Dogging ' event to feature in rodeo this weekend 's annual rodeo in the small far north Queensland town of Laura feature a new event call ` Team Dogging ' . organiser believe it be the first rodeo in Australia to have a bull-dogging competition with two horseman leap off to grab a bullock - one by the head , the other by the tail . Laura rodeo secretary Karlene Shephard say the event evolve last year when the truckload of normal dog steer do not turn up , so they use larger bullock instead . -lsb- the -rsb- fella go through and draft off the one that have a little bit of horn that be there and put they in the dog box , she say . when the first fella go in he look at it and he say ` gee they be a bit big ' because they be bullock and they be flat out fitting in the dog box and anyway another fella off the committee say ` why do not two of you have a go at it ' . salvo to maintain refuge staffing level the australian Services Union say the Salvation Army have agree to maintain staffing level at its Newcastle refuge for the time be , while negotiation continue over plan staff cut . the salvo want to restructure Faith Cottage , a crisis accommodation centre for woman and child , so permanent staff would be employ on a part-time basis . a night-shift position will also be cut . the union 's Kylie Rooke say management of the centre have agree to negotiate its position . the Salvation Army have respond to we offer of work cooperatively together by say they be willing to continue discussion and they will maintain the status quo at the service in regard to it be staff 24 hour and the hour that the staff work , she say . fuel tax Bill expect to negatively impact on biofuel industry a fuel tax bill which pass through the Senate last night be expect to have a negative effect on the biofuel industry in Australia by remove tax advantage for smaller biofuel producer . last year the Federal Government commission a report into the viability of the industry , include research from the australian bureau of Agriculture and Resource Economics -lrb- ABARE -rrb- . ABARE 's study say the world oil price , feed grain price and tax arrangement all affect the industry . the report 's author , Graham Love , say any change to taxation be significant . they could have a significant effect to the extent that if tax treatment become more generous then you would presume that that would make the industry more viable or if they be to go the other way it would be less viable , he say . the Senate be also tell the Bill could severely disadvantage rural community who be look to the biofuel industry for investment . Gary Tepper , from swan Hill Council in Victoria , say the whole community be work hard to make sure a local ethanol plant go ahead . we really see the whole biofuel , renewable energy industry as some sort of hope for region , he say . bad road cost state : report a new report claim low road and transport investment be cost some state up to 12 per cent in livestock export . the australian Livestock Transporters Association be debate the report on bad road at its national conference this weekend in Canberra . while fuel price continue to plague the industry , the association 's executive director , Luke Fraser , say gain can be also make in other area . there be a limit to what the industry and perhaps even the australian government can do with world fuel price , which have force we to look more closely at thing like target road investment , he say . Farmers , service station owner not expect inquiry to lower petrol price the National Farmers Federation and fuel station owner be not expect another Senate inquiry into fuel will lower price . pricing , Ron Bowden from the Service Stations Association say it be always a useful exercise . there be always value to a inquiry because the market never stay still , Mr Bowden say . fishing cop to be base in Darwin the police of illegal fishing in australian water be be centralise in Darwin . it be part of the Federal Government 's budget allocation of $ 389 million over the next three year . fifty-three people will be base at the new Territory head office of the australian Fisheries Management Authority . the authority 's Peter Venslovas say nearly 190 illegal boat have be apprehend so far this year . and we target rate for the coming year will be about 650 vessel , he say . last calender year 281 illegal foreign fishing vessel be apprehend . most of those , or nearly all of those be from Indonesia . use of brown coal could reduce greenhouse emission , study show a research project into the use of brown or dirty coal could reduce Australia 's greenhouse emission from power generation to close to zero in the next decade . the Monash Energy and Anglo Coal project in Victoria be explore the feasibility of dry , gasify and then liquefy coal into a new synthetic low emission fuel . with 80 per cent of Australia 's power generation come from coal , Jeff Cochrane from Monash Energy say there will be important benefit for the environment Strategy tackle vegie supply plan for remote community aboriginal community should get better supplies of fresh fruit and vegetable , follow the remote indigenous store conference hold in Adelaide this week . community leader , store Organic beef producer feel drought Organic cattle producer in the outback channel country of Queensland and South Australia be find it hard to meet demand because of the continue drought . OBE beef , which supply grass-fed organic beef to the United States , Europe and Asia , be find it tough as dry condition keep cattle number low . Sharon Oldfield from Cowarie Station on the Birdsville Track , who supply organic beef , say they have have to halve they cattle herd . we would not have have a good general summer rain probably for four or five year now , in some area it be be up to six year , she say . wool trade feature in award-winning novel a former wool grower and shearer 's cook have win Australia 's richest literary prize . Roger McDonald be last night award the Miles Franklin award for he novel about the origin of Australia 's wool trade , the ballad of Desmond Kale . nt aerial medial team celebrate milestone there be another medical team celebrate 60 year in the air . the top end Aerial Medical Service average six flight a day , care for those live north of Elliott in the Northern Territory , and also serve offshore oil rig and part of South-East Asia . Europe poise to act on foreign wine threat Europe be admit it have to do something about the threat from foreign wine produce in Australia , South Africa and Chile . the european Commission have unveil plan to pull out more than 10 per cent of Europe 's vine over the next five year to reduce its wine glut . the move , which will cost of 2.4 billion euro , be a admission that Europe be worry about the threat from foreign wine producer like Australia , South Africa and Chile . the EU also admit it have make mistake in the area of marketing and subsidy . the commission 's Michael Mann say it be a radical overhaul to address a massive wine lake . we be go to get rid of a situation where we have get too much wine . we be go to use money to get people out , he say . we be go to simplify we labelling rule and you know after a five-year period once all be say and do with the re-structuring it will be the market that decide . we want to be in the situation where the european wine be the one people be choose . wheat trade with Iraq to continue : Howard Wheat Australia , which be yet to ship 350,000 tonne of wheat to Iraq , be watch event in the Middle East closely , after the iraqi Trade Minister threaten to stop all deal between the two country . Abdul Falah al-Sudany threaten to cut trade tie after the shooting of a bodyguard from he ministry by australian soldier earlier this week . but follow diplomatic talk overnight , Prime Minister John Howard have tell Channel Nine he do not expect Australia 's wheat trade to be affect . I can tell you that the iraqi Trade Minister see the australian ambassador and the iraqi Trade Minister tell we ambassador that he do not want this incident to interfere with the bilateral relationship or to affect we trade relationship , he say . meanwhile , the Western Australian Farmers Federation deny it be withdraw support for AWB 's wheat export monopoly . Federation senior vice-president , Robert Doney , yesterday suggest in a national newspaper interview that the veto power should be remove from AWB 's single desk . but grain president Ray Marshall have describe the comment as a naive indiscretion , and deny any split on the issue . always when you have 17 people sit around a table you will have differ opinion , he say . I believe at this moment whilst policy be very clear , we be at the status quo until such time that the Cole Inquiry come out and we be very clear about we view . meanwhile , Australia be not alone in suffer wheat crop loss this year from drought . the US crop continue to decline in quality , as well as quantity , amid persistent heat and drought . the US wheat crop be already forecast off 14 per cent from the last marketing year , and dry condition be also take a toll on the quality of what be leave . Brad Rippey be a US Agriculture Department meteorologist and say the winter wheat crop be rate 29 per cent which be good to excellent . but a very large 46 per cent be very poor to poor , he say . Minister push deal with Gulf state although talk to set up a free trade deal with the United Arab Emirates have stall , Trade Minister Mark Vaile say Australia should try to do a deal with all six nation of the Gulf Co-operation Council . a spokesperson for the Minister say the Gulf state be a important and grow market for Australia , with export of goods worth $ 4 billion in 2005 . the Gulf Council comprise the UAE , Bahrain , Kuwait , Oman , Qatar and Saudi Arabia . Commodity export ' earnings boom earnings from commodity export be boom even more than expect this year , largely thanks to the mineral and energy sector , accord to the latest figure . Australia 's Bureau of Agriculture and Resource Economics -lrb- ABARE -rrb- predict commodity export will rise 16 per cent this year , more than double its original forecast issue at the Outlook conference in February . the increase be thanks to a strong mineral and energy sector which be now expect to earn $ 48 billion - up $ 4 billion on the February forecast . it be a different story for farm commodity though with the February forecast of $ 29.6 billion downgrade slightly . nlis program chief defend rollout the head of the committee in charge of implement the National Livestock identification system -lrb- nlis -rrb- have defend the time it be take to roll it out . that be despite just one state so far - Victoria - have mandatory nli without any exemption . the nlis be a national program design to allow all cattle to be trace from paddock to plate . the chairman of the national nlis executive committee , John Wilde , say the rollout have exceed expectation . we be well into the implementation phase and it be perform really well , it be exceed we expectation . it will obviously be a number of year before the implementation phase be finally wash through . but we be very very pleased with the progress to date , he say . meanwhile , Linda Hewitt , the chairwoman of the australian beef Association , which be lobby against the NLIS , say cattlemen be better off without the scheme . Tas fox population confirm : report a new report have find there be definitely fox in Tasmania and they pose a multi-million dollar threat to the State 's agricultural sector . despite a number of report sighting since a state task force be set up three year ago , the existence of fox in Tasmania have remain a open question . but main author of the new report , Glenn Saunders , say there be no doubt that a small population exist . I guess we come in as a external group and look at it impartially , he say . we have nothing to gain or benefit from conclude one way or the other , but on review all of the available evidence that we could gather , and I mean all of the available evidence not just snippet of it here and there , we really could not come to any other conclusion . and if they find the Tassie fox , there be a market for they . a fox skin buyer and exporter say demand and price for australian fox skin be rise after year of disinterest from the trade . the trade decline and price plummet during the 1980 during a bitter campaign wage by animal liberation group against the use of fur in fashion . a large number of fox shooter stop take skin and the skill of skinning , and prepare the pelt , almost die out . but fox skin exporter Don McGilvray say renew chinese interest in fur be lead the trade 's recovery . I be pay from $ 25 for the top and the average be anywhere from 13 to $ 16 , he say . fishing industry set for restructure fishing industry in four region across Australia look set for major change as a result of a Federal Government buy-back . the $ 220 million scheme close last week and unofficial report from industry source suggest that up to half the fisherman in some area have accept the Government 's offer . in New South Wales , the South-East Trawl Fishing Industry Association president , Fritz Drenkharn , say eight out of 14 boat have put in tender and if they be all accept it will have a big impact on processing plant . oh well , restructure on the shore facility , the haulage contractor will also be sit on the fence wait to see what be happen in relation to they business , Mr Drenkharn say . in the on-shore facility there be a real lot ride on the line . meanwhile , there should be more prawn for Christmas this year , with news that 660,000 baby tiger prawn have survive a cold spell in the far north of Western Australia . the Kimberley Prawn Company be concern they post-larval stock have die a fortnight ago , when water temperature drop in the tank . Owner Ian Crimp say it now prove the region be suitable to harvest throughout the year . -lsb- it -rsb- now mean that we have the ability of crop all year round at Derby , whereas part of Australia they can only crop prawn during the summertime , Mr Crimp say . grain farmer ' future look bleak many victorian grain farmer be still very depressed about the outlook for the season . in western Victoria , the local water authority , Grampians Wimmera Mallee Water , say the winter channel run may even have to be cancel for rural home dam because they be only 6 per cent full , the lowest level ever record for this time of year . grain and sheep farmer Bernard Gross from Drung Drung say if winter rainfall do not return to normal , the future will be bleak . my family have be here since 1873 . but I have be tell that the early 1900 be also particularly dry , Mr Gross say . frost-tolerant crop a possibility : scientist scientist believe grain grower could one day be able to sow frost-tolerant cereal crop . the australian Centre for Plant functional genomic in Adelaide be study the gene of japanese barley , which have frost-tolerant property . Frost damage be believe to cost South Australia 's and Victoria 's barley industry more than $ 30 million per year . Professor Geoff Fincher say this research could eventually have application for other crop . dry mango head to e Timor orphanage Children in orphanage across the capital of East Timor will be chew on Northern Territory ` mango leather ' this month . AWB spokesman Peter McBride say the wheat will be ship as soon as possible , but farmer will bear the cost of the delay . forecast bring more heartache to farmer there be another gloomy weather forecast for farmer who have be hope for rain . the latest climate forecast show that the vast majority of Australia be likely to receive less than average rainfall over the next three month , with the driest outlook of all in the grainbelt of Western Australia . and in another blow to grain grower , temperature be likely to be above average , particularly in New South Wales and southern Queensland . Dr Andrew Watkins , from the National climate Centre , say warm sea temperature in the Pacific be to blame . nff announce meeting to resolve quarantine difference the National Farmers Federation -lrb- NFF -rrb- say there be a lack of confidence in Australia 's quarantine system and it have set up a meeting on July 14 to try resolve difference between farmer and government . the nff say farmer and industry have a number of concern with the way Australia 's quarantine system be work and say that communication between authority , and the farm sector , have break down . the July meeting will bring together industry and the Federal Government to try and sort out the problem , include what the nff call a loss of confidence in quarantine and biosecurity . but Kevin Cooper , from the NSW Department of primary Industries , deny the system be in trouble . experience in recent year have show that the communication have be robust and sound , he say . milk processor explore merger option one of Australia 's largest milk processor have open the door to a possible merger . victorian-based Tatura milk , which provide about 5 per cent of Australia 's dairy product , be undertake a financial review after post a $ 6 million loss before tax last year . Frost wipe out crop in WA Horticulturalists in Western Australia be suffer a unseasonal frost , wipe out a number of fruit and vegetable producer in the state 's south east . the estimate $ 4 million worth of damage will cause shortage and price rise . Manjimup avocado producer Tony Fontiani say it be he second successive year of seasonal setback . we have lose about approximately 90 per cent of we fruit we have 12,000 tray of avocado on the tree and I think we will be lucky if we pick a thousand to 1,500 tray , he say . it just mean that we will have to tighten we belt and spend less and struggle through for another year but we be only just get in to the situation where we be produce a quantity of avocado , this be go to be we big year . and frost could cut Australia 's navel orange crop this season by 20 per cent , accord to preliminary forecast . saff rejoin National Farmers Federation South Australia 's Farmers Federation -lrb- SAFF -rrb- be rejoin the national farming body . saff withdraw its membership from the National Farmers Federation -lrb- NFF -rrb- three year ago because it could not afford the fee . the nff have negotiate a discounted rate to South Australia for the next two year . SAFF 's Carol Vincent say she organisation could not continue be independent from the national body . I do not think it be affordable for the SAFF any more not to be a be a member of the nff . farming organisation can not afford for the future to be in competition with one another they have to be work together , we think the future need strong national representation as well as strong state representation , she say . nff chief executive Ben Fargher say the move will strengthen farmer ' influence in Canberra . to be frank it do hurt nff 's credibility if state farm organisation be not member , so it be great that saff be come back , he say . burning boat send strong message to illegal fisher a indonesian fishing boat be be burn in Darwin today - the 74th to be apprehend in australian water this year . earlier this year , the Navy seize the ` harapan ' , which be a indonesian type three ice boat , inside the australian fishing zone boundary . the 27 metre long boat could store up to 40 tonne of fish , but this one be only carry about 50 kilogram of fish such as snapper aid by gps navigation . the australian Fisheries Management Authority say these boat burning send a strong message to the owner in Indonesia , that illegal fishing will not be tolerate . it have be set alight in a boat burn pit at Hudson Creek , near the busy East arm Port of Darwin and will take all day to burn completely . any metal remain will be salvage for cost recovery . Dingo wee prove successful in scare off kangaroo perth-based researcher have stumble on a successful , although unusual , way to frighten kangaroo - dingo wee . a team from Curtin University believe kangaroo recognise the smell of they long-time predator , the dingo and steer clear . they hope to isolate the chemical , to create a product that keep roo away from crop . project manager Dr Michael Parsons say they first trialle the smell at a wildlife sanctuary and watch the kangaroo flee . she walk out of the bathroom with a tube of urine in a evaporative canister and as soon as she get about five metre from they , they look at she and immediately flee ... and this be a whole mob of they , he say . Wild pig may be spread sugar cane disease , say farmer Sugar cane smut have now be confirm on more than 20 farm in south-east Queensland . the fungal disease be discover for the first time in Queensland two week ago and the industry 's exotic disease plant health plan be in force . while there be now strict quarantine measure on the movement of people and plant , cane farmer Bruce Royan say wild pig may be spread the disease . it be obviously blow in with the wind or somebody else have be drive around the farm , he say . Report highlight desire for change to wheat marketing a new report on the future of wheat export from Australia have back call for change to the single desk . single Vision grain Australia , a government-funded body , survey 27 industry group from grower to exporter and grain marketer . its conclusion mirror other report about the future of wheat marketing - most want to keep the single desk , but remove AWB 's right to veto export from other trader and bolster the power of the wheat Export Authority . but the grain Council , which represent around 30,000 grower , say single Vision should not have carry out the survey in the first place . Chairman Murray Jones say the council refuse to take part when approach . for they to say that they be the peak body for the australian grain industry be absolutely incorrect , Mr Jones say . they press release come out say the australian grain industry 's call for change to single desk policy , now who be call for it , be they call for it ? he say . farm lobby group concern over biosecurity law the New South Wales Farmers Association say it have find three major flaw with Australia 's biosecurity legislation . the farm body commission barrister Tom Brennan to identify which law might be legally challenge , amid concern that communication between farmer and the australian quarantine and Inspection Service -lrb- AQIS -rrb- have break down . Chairman of the association 's quarantine committee , Peter Carter , say Mr Brennan 's advice have raise a number of concern . the first one be that the import risk analysis have no legal status , which be quite frightening and can be ignore by AQIS , Mr Carter say . secondly , he find that there need to be better definition of the way that the minister consult with aqi , or do not consult with they , but it need to be define in law because at the moment there be a big hole in the law over that . hendra virus horse death concern vet association the australian veterinary association -lrb- ava -rrb- say it be concern about the handling of the death of a horse in Queensland two week ago from the hendra virus . the virus kill horse trainer Vic Rail and 17 of he horse in the mid 1990 . McGauran back livestock id system the Federal Agriculture Minister , Peter McGauran , have defend a audit of the National Livestock identification system . the australian beef association -lrb- ABA -rrb- say the audit order by Mr McGauran in recent week , will not be independent , and will not solve problem inherent in the livestock traceback system . Mr McGauran say the audit will be both independent and comprehensive . I can only say that this will be a independent assessment by the government of the day . the ABA be quite intemperate . they claim the nlis be fundamentally flaw , not just the database , Mr McGauran say . drought force cattle evacuation from Channel Country one of the nation 's largest beef producer say it be move nearly 1,000 head of cattle out of Queensland 's drought-stricken Channel country every week . S. Kidman and Co produce beef for market in Japan , the US and South-East Asia on property on the Georgina and Diamantina Rivers and Cooper Creek . Chief executive Greg Campbell say a moderate flood earlier this year be not enough to stop destocking . throughout the Channel country at the moment we be about 50 to 60 per cent stock , he say . rain bring relief to WA farmer there have finally be some rain relief in Western Australia , with fall along the western coast overnight . only marginal fall be record inland , with some grain grower fare better than other . by 6:00 pm last night I would have 20.2 millimetre and then overnight another 7.5 ml , so for those few hour it be 27.7 and it be absolutely fantastic , John Williams from Bindoon say . just so great to see all this rain after all this time . those that have be wait for the rain will be able to put they crop in and those that have dry sown , this will help they along just great . Garth Cowald from West Canna say he have 4.5 millimetre of rain last night . we have not sow any wheat yet , get a bit late now , the ground be too dry . we have not have hardly any rain now for three month . we have sow lupin and oats but it have not come up , Mr Cowald say . so with the cost now day , I think it be better to leave the seed and fertiliser in the shed and the chemical and just take it from there . low demand reduce nt pig market Contract pig shooter in the Northern Territory be sell off they hunting dog because they do not have a export market this year . more than 20 register shooter around the town of Katherine cull hundred of feral pig during the dry season and ship the meat to Germany . but this year demand and price be so low , not a single pig will be go overseas . Grain Council agenda baffle ex-president former grain Council president Keith Perrett say the peak body be lose the confidence of grower and create division in the industry . yesterday the council slam a new survey call for change to the single desk for wheat export , say single Vision grain Australia have no authority to conduct it . Mr Perrett head the grain Council between 2001 and 2005 , but claim it be now fail to provide leadership . he say he be baffle by its current agenda , which seem to be politically-driven . certainly most grower that I speak to say ` what be go on here at the moment ' , he say . it be a bit beyond I as to why they would be take that line , you know the easy answer be to say ` well it be a bit of patch protection ' , I be not sure what the outcome be why they have come down the path they be . certainly I would be take a different approach to the one that be be take at the moment . Corporation 's decision may cost timber industry job the timber industry say up to 2,000 job be under threat from the australian Rail Track Corporation 's decision to use concrete rather than timber sleeper to upgrade the Melbourne to Brisbane rail line . the National Association of Forest Industries say saw mill operator be expect to supply up to 400,000 timber sleeper a year for the next five year . but the association 's Catherine Murphy say they have now be tell timber be no longer require . it be not just along the Murray there but it be the north coast of New South Wales and I understand sleeper be also produce in Queensland and Western Australia , she say . this be a specific market that many of these saw miller have invest $ 10 million , for example , over the past two year in upgrade they mill specifically to provide timber . farming practice blame for loom mouse plague no-till farming practice and leave over seed from last harvest be be blame for a loom mouse plague on South Australia 's upper Eyre Peninsula . survey have show more than 4,000 mouse per hectare , the highest number since 1995 . unlike conventional seeding , sowing crop with the no-till method leave one distinct furrow for mouse to follow and burrow into to eat grain . Buckleboo farmer Jim Hamlin say the mouse be just another problem when they be already face a cold , dry start to the season . where some of the crop be up , they be chew off leaf and in other place , where the crop be not up , they have dig under the ground and get the grain as well , he say . business suffer as dry condition continue Dry condition on pastoral property south-east of Alice Springs have take they toll on business which service the area . it have be four year since the region have have any decent rain and stock feed be scarce . Rodney Mingel , who run Mingel 's Heli Service , have ground one of three helicopter this season and stand down a pilot . he say muster work have be halve , due to the lack of rain and lower stock number . from now on through to September be really we busy period , he say . there be just not much happen , I mean people have do they work , work that they normally do towards the end of the year they have do at the beginning of the year . Cattle number be down , so there be not six paddock to muster anymore there be one . Murray River level drop there be concern about the state of the Murray River this winter . River Murray Water say its storage be only 40 per cent full and have reduce river flow to protect current level . with a lack of rain across the catchment as well , part of the river between Mildura and swan Hill be only waist deep . Colignan citrus grower and river boat enthusiast Robert Mansell say the river be as low as he have see it at this time of year . it be really , really interesting , he say . rain enable farmer to finish sowing crop welcome rain over the grain belt in Western Australia this week have many farmer back out in the paddock to finish sowing crop . the Western Australian Farmers Federation have survey its member and president Trevor De Landgrafft say that for many , the season be a long way behind , after one of the driest May and June period on record . forty per cent of the respondent have less than half of they crop in the ground , he say . half of those people do not have any crop in at all . sixty per cent of respondent have get more than half they crop in and two third of that number somewhere between 80 and one 100 per cent . we be say we think about half the crop that have be sow be out of the ground . soft international demand blame for drop in milk price Australia 's largest milk processor have lower the price it will offer dairy farmer this year . the move by Murray Goulburn to drop price by 2.9 per cent follow a 5 per cent cut announce by New zealand-based Fonterra . the company 's Ian MacAulay be blame softer international demand . Green light give to abalone farm the first land-based abalone farm in New South Wales have be approve on the state 's mid-north coast . native abalone be under threat from poach and aquaculture be see as a way of preserve number . but local conservation group fear the development could pollute coastal water and destroy seagrass bed . Graham Housefield from Australian Bounty Seafoods say he have do everything he can to deal with the concern . I guess what it really come down to be that the farm need to have a pristine area because we need water that be as clean as possible and therefore we can not afford to do anything to harm the water from that area , he say . these animal be absolutely and totally reliant on have clean water . Flower grower surprise at banned-seed list cut-flower grower be call for more time to comment on draft change to seed import regulation . for the past two month , Biosecurity Australia have be review the Permitted Seeds list . but tropical flower grower , like Alan Carle , say the review have catch many grower by surprise . we be in a process , a review process to dramatically restrict the number of plant and seed which may be bring into the country in the future , Mr Carle say . effectively , it slam the door shut . we should all just band together and ask for a moratorium so we have time to consider and work in a constructive way with Biosecurity Australia and Quarantine to come up with a system which we be all happy with and do not create some sort of black market . I mean that be the worst thing that can happen to this country be to get thing bring in without proper control . US cattle price not expect to increase US Agriculture Department official say it will take year to recover from Japan 's mad cow-related ban on beef and producer there should not expect to see massive price rise . US Agriculture Department livestock analyst Ron Gustafson say Japan 's expect reopen of its market to US beef after it complete audits of US plant next month , will not bring a huge upswing in US cattle price . Mr Gustafson say it will take year to sell pre-mad cow amount of US beef to Japan , which only buy certain cut anyway . we do not sell whole carcass to the japanese or south Koreans , or anyone ... we sell cut that , largely , we do not have the large demand for here in the US - short rib , plate and so-forth - the fattier item , he say . drug bust wasp still some time away wasp might be know for they bite , but they highly-tuned sense of smell could make they the sniffer dog of the future . trial be under way in the United States to train tiny wasp to detect chemical . Dr Andrew Austin from the University of Adelaide say the idea be feasible and wasp be quick learner , but he can not see they replace dog any time soon . they have be able to demonstrate that you can take these wasp and you can train they to recognise that particular chemical , he say . it be a long way from that to actually use this particular wasp in a commercial sense , where you could actually use they as drug bust sort of wasp . Hotline to help man cope with depression the impact of the drought have prompt Beyondblue to establish a national hotline specifically to help man deal with depression . Chairman Jeff Kennett say man from country area be more likely to suffer from depression , but be less likely to admit the problem . he say the helpline will provide information , treatment and where to get help . unfortunately depression be very prevalent throughout rural Australia and particularly among young man , he say . so what we hope with this beyondblue information line be to give man the capacity wherever and however isolate they environment may be for the price of a local call to seek direction and help as to what to do in overcome they depressive illness . the hotline number , which will be in operation from July 1 be 1300224636 . wa-based rural financial counsellor Sue Smith say farmer be traditionally bad at manage stress and many case be ignore . she say one of the telltale sign be a change in behaviour . it be no wonder that people be feel really stressed at the moment , she say . the first sign be in the body , somebody will start to feel tired , they will get headache , they body will start to ache . sometimes it be other people that notice that they become quiet irritable , they may withdraw from they family and friend . wea chairman 's term extend the chairman of the wheat Export Authority -lrb- WEA -rrb- , Tim Besley , will head the regulator for another six month . question have be raise about the authority 's effectiveness , in the wake of the awb scandal . Sheep chemical declare unsafe access to a chemical commonly use to treat flystrike and lice in sheep will be severely restricted after test show it be unsafe . the review of Diazinon be prompt earlier this year after farm worker complain of headache and in some case vomit when use the chemical . Joan Ashton from the Pesticides and veterinary Medicines Authority say other chemical be more costly , but human safety be the priority . there be really no way you can mitigate what we think be a unacceptable risk to worker , she say . Australia 's not the only one look at Diazinon , there be be a range of review that have be go on worldwide and it have progressively be discontinue in other country , as well , along similar line and for similar reason for concern , as we have identify here in Australia . ag pilot dispute crash statistics finding new research from the australian transport safety bureau -lrb- atsb -rrb- say agricultural pilot do not get enough training and be overly represent in crash statistics . the research , which look at wire strike accident where plane hit power line or other wire , find 65 per cent of low level fly accident happen in farming . Head of the Aerial Agricultural Association , Phil Hurst , dispute the finding and say the industry have improve its safety record . I come up and have a look at it and there be obviously a gap there , and say ` hey boy what be we go to do about this ' and they all say unprintable word and off we go . shareholder show support for dairy group shareholder have vote down a push to disband western Australia 's only representative dairy group . a resolution be put forward late last year to dissolve the organisation , amid claim it have fail to have a impact on the struggle sector . follow yesterday 's vote , director Jim Fremantle say there now need to be a overhaul of the processing sector . Mail contractor finally quit 400km mail run it be a bittersweet day for one outback mail contractor , after almost 40 year of servicing property in south-west Queensland , Cecil Russell be retire since 1968 Mr Russell have be make the 400 kilometre round trip from Augathella to Carnarvon Station twice a week and say the scenery be the best part of the job . I love the country up there and that be probably why I have be do it so long , it be a for ever change sort of thing , season change and yes there be a lot of wildflower at time , he say . every day you get to see a different mob of brumby horse , see quite a few wild dog and I enjoy just look at the cattle as I go and that sort of thing . Food safety standard need continual improvement , say scientist the safety of the food that we eat be emerge as a crucial global trade issue , which can open or block access to market . scientist at the australian Food Safety Centre say the three main concern be chemical residue , foreign item in prepared food and pathogen such as bacterium and virus . Professor Tom Ross say pathogenic outbreak occur at all level of the food chain from the paddock to the plate and grower , and processor , need to continue to improve safety standard . he say e. coli bug in the 1980s be a example of how potentially fatal contaminant continue to evolve . twenty year ago that organism have never be see before , he say . AWB vow to fight any kickback lawsuit wheat exporter awb say it will fight any legal action launch by american farmer in the wake of the oil-for-food scandal . report suggest the company could face a billion-dollar lawsuit claim US wheat grower lose trade with Iraq when AWB pay almost $ 300 million in kickback to Saddam Hussein 's regime . the ABC understand the initial case may cover just 20 or so farmer but have the potential to see thousand of US and Canadian farmer join they . if the action be successful , it could see AWB force to make a payout triple the value of the kickback . but US Wheat Associates know nothing of the proposed legal suit at this stage . awb spokesperson Peter McBride say AWB would fight any such legal suit . such action be ill-conceived and if any action be formally bring against AWB we will vigorously defend , he say . the ABC understand that it be hard to argue the case that US farmer be hurt by awb kickback , because the US have sanction against trading with Iraq . single desk challenge AWB have challenge the grow number of proposal call for change to the single desk export system . National wheat pool manager David Johnston have tell a public debate in Victoria that AWB will accept the outcome from the oil-for-food inquiry . but he say if AWB 's export monopoly or its veto over grain export application be remove , wheat grower will be the loser . the bulk veto , I think , be a core component of the single desk as we know it and if we have people want to send wheat into Indonesia or Malaysia or any of we core market you will have australian wheat compete with australian wheat , he say . Electoral boundary change bad for voter : Anderson The National Party have accuse the australian Electoral Commission of take the easy way out , by scrap the federal seat of Gwydir in northern New South Wales . with a shift in population , New South Wales be require to lose a electorate to accommodate a new seat in Queensland . the commission want to merge the seat of gwydir with parkes , which will cover almost half the state . but the retire Member for Gwydir , former deputy prime minister John Anderson , say the move be a tragedy for country voter . I think it be appallingly bad to see people face the prospect of be in a seat that be over twice the size that it be now which make it far harder for people to access the local member , he say . this mean one less country voice in Canberra and a lesser chance still of be represent around the Cabinet table . nff ` live in hope ' of trade talk breakthrough the National Farmers Federation -lrb- NFF -rrb- be confident there be still life in World Trade Organisation -lrb- WTO -rrb- talk , despite another failure to reach agreement on agriculture over the weekend . WTO be the main game , Mr Mitchell say . we live in hope that minister will go home and reflect on what be happen here this week and will realise that we do have a narrow window of opportunity to make global trading rule better for a long time . Cold start to winter cut rainfall the freezing start to winter across southern Australia could be cause the ongoing dry weather condition . in normal year , cold air from the Southern Ocean collide with warm air from central Australia result in cut-off low , which bring rainfall . but this year , the system be not as strong . Dr Peter McIntosh , from the Marine Atmospheric Research Centre , say that be because it be colder inland . we have speculate a little bit recently about what might be cause these cut-off low to decrease in intensity , he say . we think it be a decrease in the north-south temperature gradient . Coroner blame bushfire on powerline a electricity provider in New South Wales have be blame for cause a major bushfire in the state 's central west two year ago . the deputy state coroner have find the fire start near Parkes , when a tree touch a country energy powerline . the 2004 fire burnt 6,000 hectare , cause the death of 690 sheep and the destruction of thousand of hectare of unharvested crop on 28 farm . Craig Ward say he be relieve the four-day inquest quash rumour that he farming machinery spark the blaze . I just give evidence that I be not in the vicinity of where the fire start , he say . through the gps system on the harvester it plot every two seconds where the harvester have be over the period of time you harvesting . Mr Ward say he be frustrate by the approach of Country Energy to the trial , which try to prove he harvester spark the blaze . Resources Minister John Bowler say land could be available for plant as soon as 2008 . we believe we can quadruple the amount of hectare place under agriculture in irrigation , he say . this will make the Ord Valley one of the most significant agricultural area in Australia . nurse practitioner scheme upset doctor rural doctor in Tasmania claim they be be devalue by the introduction of nurse practitioner in remote area . follow the lead of other state , the Tasmanian Government will allow nurse to prescribe drug and undertake some of the traditional task of doctor to fill shortage . but the president of rural doctor Tasmania , Eric Calquoun , say nurse should remain a integral part of gp-led health care team and not be allow to practice independently . I think this be the thin edge of the wedge with this , he say . we be talk about prescribe major drug , the Poisons Acts regulation be be modify so they can prescribe morphine for palliative care nurse . manage investment scheme under review concern be emerge over the shift in manage investment scheme -lrb- mi -rrb- from forestry and vineyard to broader agriculture . planting of walnut and avocado be among those now be offer to investor . Rob Dalton , from Avocados Australia , say he be concern by the push , which could massively distort the market . review of miss have indicate that the investor be in there primarily for the tax deduction and they have much less concern with profitability at the end of the project , he say . whereas the normal farmer be in there for a profit and a long-term , sustainable profit . VegMachine give farmer eye in the sky Landholders across the northern rangeland of Australia can now use satellite monitoring to keep track of environmental change on they property . the new system , which be call VegMachine , have be trial across 80,000 square kilometre in Western Australia , the Northern Territory and Queensland . nt government researcher Luke Peel want to see the free computer software program use more widely . it give you a birdseye view of the property , he say . the idea be the mystery of satellite imagery , what it can say and do be be expose back . it still have not get to the point where we can actually work out kilogram per hectare on the ground . but , it certainly give a idea of how productivity can be relate to use of the resource or trapping of the resource available . whether it be the actual vegetation , the soil or the nutrient in the soil .
