Police say it be believe the truck driver do not take notice of stock move sign . the driver be to be issue with a infringement notice for fail to give way to stock . draft chicken meat import ruling worry industry the chicken meat industry say a decision to allow import into Australia could pose a unnecessary risk to consumer . in a draft import risk analysis , Biosecurity Australia recommend allow uncooked chicken meat into the country , as long as export country can prove they be free of disease , include bird flu . but Dr Andreas dub , from the australian Chicken Meat Federation , be question whether Australia can be certain about another country 's disease status . that be not a simple matter , he say . it really come down to the confidence that we can have with the system in place which in the past I suppose have be show to be somewhat questionable . while australian quarantine officer usually double-check disease free claim from other country , some say that be not always a guarantee . Peter Scott , from the australian veterinary Poultry Alliance , say authority rely on get accurate information from producer . regulatory authority can only go on the information provide to they and in some case that may not be accurate , Mr Scott say . we do see overseas quite a bit of product move through country . in other word , while you believe you be get product from a particular country it may be come in via another country . animal-based fertiliser threaten bse status : vet Tasmania 's chief vet say Australia 's status as be free of mad cow disease -lrb- bse -rrb- could be threaten by the indiscriminate use of animal-based pasture fertiliser . a number of cattle death from botulism in Tasmania have be attribute to the use of poultry litter as a fertiliser . Dr Rod Andrewarthur say although it be a legal product , the litter must not be use before the end of the official withholding period to ensure cattle do not ingest any linger animal protein . he say under BSE protocol , no animal protein can be feed to cattle . we sell we meat to the world as a premium because we be free of disease like mad cow disease , he say . we be under audit from other country like the European Union to make sure that we have get all the check and safeguard in place prevent the development of the disease . processing delay force saleyard 's nlis overhaul processing delay of up to 24 hour have force Australia 's biggest saleyard to overhaul its National Livestock identification system -lrb- nlis -rrb- infrastructure . with 11,000 cattle on offer today , new in-pen scanning be be put to the test at the Roma saleyard in Queensland . a year after nli become mandatory in the state , the saleyard ' board be scrap two run-through scanner worth $ 270,000 . while they read tag with 99 per cent efficiency , large volume of cattle mean even minor misread could cause huge disruption . brisbane-based company livestock link have be contract to pick up any miss tag and non-reader tag more efficiently , by pre-scanning cattle before sale in pen . ethic campaigner push for teminator gene ban gene ethic campaigner be lobby the Federal Government to ban the development of terminator technology in Australia . the process would stop seed from breed naturally , force farmer to buy new stock each year instead of grow they own . more than 10,000 people have sign a petition claim genetic engineering company will have monopoly power if the technology be introduce . the government have say it will accept development application on a case-by-case basis . however , Bob Phelps from the GeneEthics Network say that be not acceptable . there be clearly strong public sentiment that the terminator be not acceptable , he say . we be submit those petition to the federal Agriculture Minister Peter McGauran and we be say to the australian government we want you to align the australian government policy with the global view that it be unacceptable and that the global ban on terminator should remain . vff push for single wheat desk change the victorian Farmers Federation -lrb- VFF -rrb- have join grow call for change to the single desk for wheat export , in the wake of the oil-for-food Inquiry . under its plan , wheat exporter AWB Limited and AWB International would be split , with international wheat sale return to farmer control . the vff will seek endorsement for the proposal from the grain Council of Australia later this month . vff grain group president Ian Hastings say the plan address concern about governance of the system , and payment to grower from the national wheat pool . we be talk about separation of AWB International and make sure that AWB International continue to have the legislative monopoly for export of wheat , Mr Hastings say . fodder export demand raise local price a booming export fodder market be good news for grower but farmer look to feed livestock in Australia be face high price and short supply . Lucerne price have almost double since November to around $ 300 a tonne , while hay price be up between $ 30 and $ 40 a tonne . Colin Peace , from the Fodder Industry Association , say drought in the US and Canada be help to boost export , at the expense of the domestic market . those two market often clash for supply so I think you could anticipate that certainly continue , he say . there be always opportunity for stock that be destine for export to be divert for domestic demand . awga seek unify wool industry vision there be call today for a single vision for the wool industry , unite research , development and commerical operation to pull it out of the current slump . the australian Wool Growers Association -lrb- AWGA -rrb- say the industry 's four main body - australian Wool Innovation , Australian Wool Services , the wool testing authority , and wool exchange - be too inward-looking and duplicate service . awga chairman , Martin Oppenheimer , say industry leader should follow the lead of the sheepmeat industry , which turn its fortune around with a strategic plan 10 year ago . we have get many different grower-owned or funded company and they be all head off in they own direction , he say . they have get different strategy . Truck crash prompt stock movement warn police in New South Wales be warn driver to be more careful on country road , after a crash involve a cement truck and a mob of 5,000 sheep . the mob be be run along a stock route in the state 's central-west . detective senior Constable Andrew McGrath say police believe the driver ignore stock warning sign . a vehicle travel on a road about 15 kilometre from Condobolin collide with a mob of sheep that be be drive along the road , with 15 fatality , he say . the driver of the truck I believe will be issue with a infringement notice for fail to give way to stock . because the condition have be so dry there be a lot of mob move around on the road so people should be wary when they be travel on country road . nullabor pastoralist grant rent subsidy Pastoralists on the Nullarbor who be suffer through drought condition have be offer a sweetener by the West Australian Government . they have be tell they be not eligible for exceptional circumstance funding , but the government will contribute $ 80,000 towards pastoral lease rent and agriculture protection rate . Pastoralist Rod Campbell say the money be welcome but pastoralist still believe they should be eligible for EC fund . we be mystify about the criterion etc but I think the Minister 's address that very nicely , he say . Inquiry likely to recommend geosequestration : researcher researcher believe a federal Parliament inquiry will help find funding for more project to stop greenhouse gas from coal , oil and gas field enter the atmosphere . the House of Representatives Science and Innovation Committee will investigate the benefit and risk of geosequestration , which be capture carbon dioxide from mining and store it underground for million of year . trial be be carry out in Victoria 's Otway Basin and off the western australian coast . Dr Peter Cook , from the co-operative research Centre for Greenhouse Gas Technologies , say study be make progress . we be very confident that that inquiry be go to endorse the use of this technology as one of the option for decrease co2 emission , he say . wine grape ethanol trial under way a 12-month trial produce ethanol from wine grape have begin in South Australia . Tarac Technologies in the Barossa Valley currently distil alcohol from winery waste . the company will supply South Australian Farmers fuel with 100,000 litre of biofuel over the next 12 month . Spokesman Chris Zajac say it remain to be see if the process can be economically viable . the reason we have decide to run the trial be to basically see how it perform against other ethanol in the marketplace , he say . Hayes to head international wine body a australian have be name president of the peak international body represent winemaker and grapegrower from 42 nation . Peter Hayes will head up the International Organisation for Wine and Vine for the next three year . the organisation set industry standard and regulation for all member country Mr Hayes , a director and former chief executive of the grape and Wine Research Development Council , say he be take aback by he appointment . I find it a bit surprising quite frankly , but I think it be a sign of the time , he say . consumer switch to Homebrand product new figure show homebrand product like milk , sugar and butter already account for more than 50 per cent of sale through the major supermarket . frozen and can Homebrand vegetable and dry fruit be also become more popular , accord to research by accountancy firm KPMG . Food processor be start to feel the pressure , as supermarket aim to fill one-third of they shelf with they own label . KPMG 's Adrian Arundell say the processing sector will shrink , as other brand disappear . some of they be fight head on against it , some of they be actually work with it , he say . tin mill 's closure to force can import in a further blow for the manufacturing industry , tinned fruit and vegetable processor will have to import can from next year , after the closure of Australia 's only tin mill . high iron ore price have lead BlueScope Steel to shut its Port Kembla mill . that will force cannery to either import tin or look for alternative packaging . the head of the Food and Grocery Council , Dick Wells , say increase cost be put manufacturing under a lot of pressure . people need to be aware that it be tough all the way and there be no easy life here , he say . if we be not innovative in this country in look for way to take cost out of the structure and produce product that consumer see additional benefit in , then there will not be a future . Organic farmer eye overseas market the United States , Europe and South-East Asia be potential market for australian-grown organic product , accord to a report launch last night . the report by the Rural Industries and Development Corporation look at the demographic of consumer , and what drive they to buy organic food . Andre Leu , from the Organic Federation of Australia , say in the long-term , China will be a major market , although Australia will struggle to compete with its domestic production . the latest figure that we have from China show that they industry be worth $ us8 billion , which make they one of the largest organic market in the world , he say . Farmers dispute Costello 's federalism reform plan the New South Wales Farmers ' Association be back Federal Treasurer Peter Costello in he criticism of Australia 's three-tiered system of government , but do not agree with he plan to change it . Mr Costello have trigger national debate on federalism , by want to wrestle all responsibility for utility and the economy from the state government , reduce they to branch office . Mal Peters , from the association , say give more power to Canberra be not the answer , and be call for full-scale reform of Australia 's system of government . any further centralisation of power into New South Wales be not good , he say . I mean the closer the government get to the people the better the government be , and that be well recognise by all player in the state and federal sphere . ` Iron Boomerang ' plan onshore iron ore processing the resource sector be investigate a $ 55 billion proposal to process iron ore in Australia from 2011 . the ` Iron Boomerang ' would be a privately-funded 3,000 kilometre railway to link iron ore deposit in Western Australia with coal field in north Queensland 's Bowen Basin . blast furnace to be build at either end of the track would produce pig iron for the export market . a international trade delegation be tour the town of Bowen today to investigate the project . Shane Condon , from Project Iron Boomerang , say supply chain savings alone could be worth $ 2 billion per year . when train run empty and ship be come back from China , or in the Pilbarra , or in the coal field of Queensland , the return trip for these giant empty train and ship be 45 per cent of the total trip cost and that be highly inefficient and use fuel unnecessarily , he say . City vet student try country practice veterinary student in Western Australia have trade the dog and cat of city practice for a stint on a remote cattle property in the Pilbara region . about 1,600 kilometre from Perth , Warrawagine Station be a long way from home for two vet student , who have never do any work with cattle before . but student Kate Louden say six week on 1 million acre station be a unique experience . I do not realise quite how isolate the station be - 300 kilometre from the nearest shop , she say . we have be muster so we have be move the yard and draft the cattle from different block . -lsb- we have -rsb- be up in the plane and the chopper a few time so it be be great . trucking industry look to recruit foreign driver the trucking industry want to start employ migrant worker , as driver shortage and a ageing workforce continue to cause problem . current skilled migrant visa do not allow for truck driver but the australian Trucking Association -lrb- ata -rrb- be confident it can get the industry reclassify as a skilled occupation . the ata 's Damien MacFarlane say it be a worldwide problem , and Australia will face competition from other country hope to recruit driver . you will find the United States and the United Kingdom be currently face the same challenge , he say . there be many driver be poach from Australia and have go to either the United Kingdom or the United States to drive . it be fine to say let 's go and get migrant driver , where be you go to get they from ? and that be go to be the challenge . Dry condition see live sheep export jump Dry seasonal condition in Western Australia have see a massive jump in live sheep export from Fremantle . more than 330,000 sheep be ship out last month alone . John Edwards , from the WA Livestock Exporters Association , say there be a direct link between the increase and the weather . I guess farmer have sort of look ahead of themselves as to availability of feed stock on farm and very little paddock feed , he say . they have most probably make the decision to sell sheep early . possibly we have see a lot of sheep come out now rather than in the spring when they traditionally shear and sell off shears . meanwhile , ease cattle price in the east be provide northern WA producer with competition in the live export trade . Tony Cooling , from Landmark in Broome , say Queensland producer be now sell stock overseas . Queensland price have come back a bit , so live export be now compete with the domestic market over there , he say . ` beef only ' cattle grant entry to Qld Queensland have open its border to cattle from Victoria and the bjd control zone in New South Wales , as long as it be class as beef only . the state have previously ban cattle due to concern over the disease bovine Johne 's . cattle which have not be run with dairy cow for five year , or graze on land which have run dairy cattle within 12 month , will meet the classification . Michael McCormack , from the Cattle Council , say it be a successful outcome . especially for southern producer it be a good news story , he say . Canada continue mad cow test canadian authority be continue test on a suspect sixth case of mad cow disease -lrb- bse -rrb- . the cow be bear before feed ban be put in place in 1997 , and be discover under new surveillance program . final test be due next week . Frost hit Riversun 's US export a company export citrus fruit to the United States say shipment be likely to drop 20 per cent this season , due to frost damage in the Murray Valley , Riverland and Riverina . Riversun chairman Peter Walker say supermarket in the US be aware of the damage to the victorian and south australian crop , but he be confident sale will not be affect . it be one of the transparency that Riversun have , he say . it go out and tell the customer base that we have procedure and policy in place and it be adhering to they . if it be minus two for more than four hour property be put into suspension until they be assess to see if there be any damage on that property , so we have explain that to supermarket and they be all still on board . dairy farmer form collective bargaining group tasmanian dairy farmer who supply food giant National Foods have form the state 's first collective bargaining group . about 30 farmer have come together to negotiate future supply and price contract . the chairman of the group , Kem Perkins say the move be inevitable . it be the only way we could go to negotiate a price because under the rule and the law these day you can not negotiate price as a individual , he say . you can not even put in on the agenda when you have a supplier ' group meeting so the way we have set it up ... mean that we can talk to any company , negotiate with any company and we can take on board any supplier that conform to the condition . one of the first job for the bargaining group will be to negotiate extra time for next season 's price talk . renewable fuel plant near completion work on the nation 's biggest renewable fuel plant in Darwin be almost complete . natural fuel Australia will import malaysian palm oil to produce biodiesel later this year . Charles Darwin University be commission to compare traditional diesel with a 20 per cent biodiesel blend . researcher Mark Thiele say emission be reduce . Carbon dioxide emission go up slightly but primarily because of the reduction in hydro carbon and carbon monoxide , he say . we also do not actually notice very much difference in power or torque . particularly at the 20 per cent blend , which be what we be testing , be only about 1 per cent . but Mr Thiele say it be not clear how sustainable it will be to import palm oil . from a sustainability perspective it be probably a little bit more complicated , he say . we have to look at the whole cycle of biodiesel production and the feed stock . it be really outside the scope of the research work that we do . Mary River dam decision outrage farmer farmer near Gympie remain outraged with the Queensland Government , despite its decision to scale back the size of a propose new dam on the Mary River . Premier Peter Beattie initially plan a 660,000 megalitre dam , which would have consume almost 1,000 property . but he now say a smaller dam will be build , with the resumption of 500 property . under the three-stage plan , the dam wall would be raise if more water be need in 2035 . but local at a public meeting to hear the detail be furious , say they will be leave in limbo for 30 year . I have be live here 30 year and be wait to retire , one say . I would be retire one week when he drop this bombshell . another resident say : some people in stage one will get buy out there be no doubt if they proceed , and so they have divide the community even more . and they leave these people in stage two to whither on the vine . competition will cut farmer ' market share : study a new report say in the next 10 year australian farmer will lose market share to develop country like China , Brazil and India . the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development -lrb- OECD -rrb- and the United Nations have compare 15 commodity . they have find that as develop nation increase production and become more competitive , country like the US , EU and Australia will lose out in world agricultural trade . australian export of sugar , beef , rice and pigmeat will be hardest hit , with less impact on wheat and poultry . Trade analyst Peter Gallagher say although world trade rule will play a part , global export competition be on the rise . the world be not beat a path to we door look for primary product , he say . the opportunity for Australia be now go to be much more in the process food area and in the fresh food and ingredient area . it be important that we realise many develop country be become more effective producer of primary product and we need to look at the structure of we own production for the future . Apple grower look to boost productivity australian apple grower be investigate way to make they orchard more efficient , to compete with the low production cost of other country . the industry will set up 60 trial site around the country to compare different plant style . the chairman of Apple and Pear Australia , Darral Ashton , say one option be to double the number of tree per hectare , use dwarf root stock . the tree do not take the usual say four or five year to come into production - they come into production very easily , he say . because you have so many tree per hectare , each tree do not have to carry so many apple to get that high production per hectare . climate change threaten blackcurrant industry there be a warning today that Tasmania 's niche blackcurrant industry be under threat from global warming . plant pathologist Steve Wilson say there have be a progressive drop in yield over the past 15 year because of a sharp increase in extremely cold night . Mr Wilson be trial other black currant variety in a attempt to boost yield , but say he be not hopeful . this , I think , may be the canary in the coal mine , he say . it be show that climate change can impact on commercial crop . w we have often think of climate change as something that can impact on natural population , but here it be have quite a distinct impact , quite a distinct economic one , on a small industry . copper find excite stock market investor a small copper explorer have shoot out of obscurity after discover rich vein of the metal near Cloncurry , in north-west Queensland . share in australian Mining Investment shoot from 29 cent seven week ago to a top of $ 10 yesterday , turn it into a billion-dollar company . it say drilling at its Rocklands copper deposit be continue around the clock to feed the stock market more news . Hartley 's mining expert Rob Brierley say little be know so far about the Rocklands deposit . not very much at all - I think that be what capture the imagination of the market , he say . in fact it be really be a meteoric rise . there be a long way for this company to go , but it be great to see that a discovery can still capture the imagination of the investment public . share in australian Mining Investment be in a trading halt . korean missile test boost oil price the price of crude oil have hit a record high in the United States overnight after North Korea launch a series of missile into the sea of Japan . the price of crude oil settle at a $ us75 .19 a barrel . the price of gold and silver be also affect . Coles back inland rail link proposal Coles Myer have back plan for a inland rail link between Brisbane and Melbourne but supporter of the project say that be not enough to get it off the ground . the head of the australian transport and energy corridor , Everald Compton , say government will be the key to the $ 4 billion rail network . Coles Myer have lodge a submission to a Productivity Commission inquiry into the nation 's freight system , say the inland project would help to make rail more efficient . but Mr Compton say it be now in the hand of government . the Coles Myer thing will not make any difference because other people have say that before , he say . for instance , Woolworths say it some year ago and government take no notice of they . snowy inquiry head attack ` secrecy culture ' the head of a New South Wales Government inquiry into ongoing public ownership of the Snowy Hydro-Electric Scheme say he be try to break down a culture of secrecy within the authority . a propose $ 3 billion float of the state and federal-owned power and irrigation provider be scuttle in the wake of public protest last month . at a hearing in the Snowy Mountains town of cooma yesterday , inquiry chairman Gordon Moyes say he hear evidence of a systematic , long-term lack of transparency by Snowy Hydro . there be be a absolute failure in term of communication , not just recently , it be be a culture that be come to we from evidence for at least 20 year , he say . who tell they not to communicate , who actually authorise the change in nature of the company 's business ? they be very significant and important question and will determine the result of the inquiry . the final report be due on October 27 . Kulukuk farm mud crab trial breed success a Darwin Aboriginal community have succeed in grow out its first farmed mud crab , as part of a commercial trial . so far 600 crab weigh a average of 350 gram have be sell to wholesaler . the trial be part of a Commonwealth Government Shared Responsibility Agreement . the Kululuk farm employ eight people , include traditional owner Jacqueline Treves . we seem to be one of the first people in Darwin to grow we own mud crab farm , she say . now that we have get one , we just want to make it work for we and we child . it be important because we want good job for younger indigenous people and for we own child . country woman gather for field day almost 150 woman make they way to Buntine in the West Australian Wheatbelt for the annual Liebe Women 's field day yesterday . those who attend say it be a good opportunity to get away from the farm and socialise with other farm woman who be also struggle with the dry start to 2006 . these sort of day be even more important when you realise you be actually not alone and that everybody be go through the same pain , say Sally Lee from the Wubin district . US grower slam ` sham ' australian wheat deal US Wheat Associates have accuse Australia of put together a sham deal to sell wheat to Iraq . loading have begin in Geelong of the first shipment of wheat to Iraq since a ban be impose on trade with awb earlier this year . US Wheat Associates claim the wheat Australia consortium 's 350,000 tonne contract be just a way for AWB to get around the ban . it accuse AWB of sell to Iraq from its wheat pool through the consortium . Rebecca Coleman say AWB still control the pricing . we think that the wheat Australia situation be pretty much a shell game , a sham and a way that allow for AWB to continue to funnel wheat to Iraq and avoid the sanction that be currently in place , she say . Ms Coleman say Iraq be now one of the US 's top 10 wheat customer . Dry weather hit WA grain harvest western australian broadacre farmer could be confront one of they worst harvest season in history , after another month of warm and unseasonably dry condition . the state 's grain handler and marketer , co-operative Bulk Handling , have earlier predict that summer subsoil moisture would help produce a crop of around 11 million tonne , despite a historically dry start to winter . but operation manager David Fienberg say the entire state 's yield could now be as low as 7 million tonne . what we be concern about be keep farmer on farm and of course that directly relate to they profitability and of course that come from volume , he say . my gut feeling be that lupin be go to be considerably down compare to where they might have be give that early break in summer , I think canola also go to be substantially down . Poor harvest send farmer to other job as the dry spell continue in Western Australia , young farmer be already start to consider they option off-farm . many farmer be opt not to put a crop in this year . Wes Teakle , from Northampton , be go to build shed because there be no money to be make on the land this year . I know of half a dozen guy , just off the top of my head , that be do the same thing that I be do and look for alternate work , he say . unfortunately there be not enough room for all of we in a small town like Northampton or Geraldton . I think everyone know the answer would be no , so whether John stay or not be a different issue . a simple solution like that I think we be too far down the track for that . Commonwealth urge to heed environmental management survey the first survey of how farmer be manage the environment show more than 90 per cent be undertake improvement work . the australian bureau of Statistics research also show most farmer consider weed , pest and native vegetation to be they biggest concern . Farmer group say the finding should influence the Federal Government , which be decide how to fund natural resource management . Corey Watts , from the Conservation Foundation , say a range of factor influence the amount of time and money farmer spend on conservation work . a lot have to do with the ability of people to be able to receive the kind of resource that they need to plan and undertake work at different scale , he say . drought be a big one - a number of part of the country be in drought and that really do stuff up people 's ability to do what need to be do in the long-term . rural Commodity Index rise 8pc Agricultural commodity price remain strong , with the Westpac-National Farmers Federation Rural Commodity Index up nearly 8 per cent compare to this time last year . dairy be the only sector which have fall below last year 's level . in the past month , barley , canola , cotton and wool have go up , with small fall in sugar and beef . Justin Smirk , from Westpac , say while price be pretty good at the moment , next year could be a different story if the world economy slow down . however , as you move into 2007 , those positive price response will mean you will get a supply response , he say . in addition , with interest rate around the world rise , do suggest it will be a softer year . rig demand delay geosequestration trial researcher say the first australian trial of technology to try to trap greenhouse gas underground be be delay . the $ 30 million geosequestration project in south-west Victoria aim to test whether carbon dioxide from coal burning power station and gas mining can be store underground . the Federal Government have fund the project as one of its preferred way of combate climate change . the project 's leader , Dr Peter Cook , say preliminary test be be carry out but he do not expect to be able to start pump carbon dioxide underground until next year . a lot of people want to drill for oil at the moment so it be a bit hard to get rig , he say . also it be a constraint on we that cost have generally go up . we be not a major company , we be a research organisation with limited fund so we have to be rather careful the way that we use those fund . Cattle killer think highly organised police in Western Australia suspect there may be a organised network kill pastoral cattle to sell they meat . seven cow have be report butcher on Pilbara station in the past month , and police believe there may be more which have not be report . Pastoralist Richard Climas , from Mardie Station 150 kilometre west of Karratha , say cattle theft be become a regular occurrence . I have find a few carcass , generally only the leg and hide left , and they have take the whole lot , he say . it happen quite often . a good bull at the moment be probably worth $ 600 , $ 700 a beast , it add up pretty quick . what else be they do while they be out there ? if they be brazen enough to kill a beast what else be they go to be do while they be out and about ? we have have solar panel steal and all sort of stuff steal . further north in the Kimberley , the state 's stock squad say there have be significant cattle theft over the past 12 month . Cane smut find on 30 property Sugar cane smut have now be find on 30 farm in the Childers area of south-east Queensland . the disease , which can cause major crop loss , be find for the first time on the east coast less than a month ago . Chris Adriaanson , from Queensland 's Department of primary Industries , say the disease will not be eradicate . he say in the future , farmer will have to rely on resistant crop variety to eliminate the impact of the disease . it depend on what you define as eradication , he say . if eradicate means biologically extinguish the disease , then that be never be the objective , it be not part of the way we have to do this business . Abattoir closure to impact on livestock producer livestock producer in South Australia 's north say they will be hit by higher freight cost , after the closure of Conroy 's abattoir at Port Pirie . the plant close on Friday and sell to t and r pastoral , which have no plan to reopen it in the short-term . one hundred people be employ at the abattoir . Sandy Morris from Yardea Station in the Gawler range say it will cost he up to $ 5 a head more to send stock to the meatwork at Murray Bridge instead . the impact on we will be that we will not have the option to send they to Pirie which be the closest abattoir for we , he say . we would have to send they on to Murray Bridge , which would be double the amount of freight . I be not quite sure how far Murray Bridge would be from Pirie but it would have to be another 250 -lsb- kilometre -rsb- I would imagine . probably look at something like $ 2.50 - $ 5.00 . meanwhile a abattoir at Stanthorpe , in southern Queensland , say it have to temporarily shut down this morning after temperature drop to -20 . the Bureau of Meteorology have report temperature of minus six at nearby Warwick and Applethorpe . John Allan from Don Allan and Co say the abattoir 's hot water system freeze . we still have not start work because the cold outside freeze the pressure of the steam inside we steam valve , he say . it just blow from sheer pressure , so that be let all the steam out now , so we have to replace that now . Citrus grower set to export to China strict quarantine measure have finally be agree upon to send citrus fruit into China , with the first export due to leave later this month . grower have hope China would help solve some of Australia 's oversupply problem , but Judith Damiani say it be not yet know how much fruit will be export this year . Ms Damiani say price be also uncertain . the quarantine requirement make it fairly difficult to put a lot of volume of fruit into that China market , she say . so we will have to start very slowly , we will have to do some trial shipment initially and after two year we will have to look at amend the protocol and make it easier to ship there . Richie Roberts from Renmark say he fruit company will start pack fruit for China early next week . we be very keen to get several container to China just to test the market because there be so much work that the industry 's put in to get access , he say . wine export jump wine export jump 12 per cent during the last financial year but price suffer , accord to new figure from the wine and Brandy Corporation . seven hundred and thirty eight million litre be export , with winery sell a large amount of bulk wine to reduce surplus stock . cotton property fail to sell two large multi-million dollar cotton property in south west Queensland have fail to sell at auction . the Queensland Government have plan to buy the farm to return water to the Murray Darling Basin , but withdraw because it do not have the support of the New South Wales or Federal government . the property , Clyde and Ballandool , with water licence total 58,000 megalitre be expect to make about $ 60 million at auction on Friday . Ballandool be pass in at $ 20 million , while Clyde be still under negotiation at $ 27 million . Ian Cush from the New South Wales Irrigators Association say the property have little store water and grower could not afford to invest and not have a return . Code of conduct for pig welfare criticise the animal rights group Voiceless have criticise the Federal Government 's draft code of conduct for pig welfare , claim it be inaccurate and limit public consultation . voiceless say the propose code invite the public to make submission through a survey which restrict objection to thing like sow stall . Spokeswoman Katrina Sharman say the code also incorrectly claim other country have no plan to phase out sow stall , which be inhibit public debate . the regulatory impact statement which accompany the code suggest in Denmark , which be a major competitor to Australia 's pig meat market , there be no plan to phase out sow stall , she say . grain production forecast down strong global wheat price be the only bright spot for grower at the moment , with production forecast down right around the country . Queensland have all but give up on its winter wheat , it be a similar case in WA , while New South Wales and Victoria be do it tough , with weed the latest threat to young crop . it be a gloomy picture right around the country , with South Australia the only state expect to deliver a reasonable harvest . but grain analyst Lloyd George say with international stock expect to tighten , good price should continue . Dexter Davies will again chair the committee , which last operate between 2000 and 2002 , and say there be a range of area to be address . identify the worst area , thing like health service , the education service , all the basic service to make sure that we have get enough there and people have get somewhere to turn to very early in the piece , he say . I do not know how far I be out , but I think I be not go to get it . but I think I would better have a crack at it on the siren . so yeah , it be pretty funny . it be good fun . Farm quarantine after bjd find just when many farmer in Western Australia think the season could not get any worse , there have be confirmation of a fatal waste disease in a cattle herd . the Department of Agriculture and Food say a farm near Albany in the state 's great Southern , have be place under quarantine , in a bid to prevent further spread of bovine Johne 's disease -lrb- bjd -rrb- . the state 's bjd-free status be now under threat . Sam Tolley from the wine and Brandy Corporation say it will mean more freedom . we have be able to use this as a bargaining chip to get better access to the marketplace , he say . pulp mill integrate impact statement release timber company Gunns have release a integrated impact statement for its propose pulp mill at Bells Bay in northern Tasmania . the company say the $ 1.4 billion project will create 4,000 job during construction and add hundred of million of dollar to the value of export woodchip . environmental group be worry the mill could result in more log in native forest , although that have be reject by project manager Les Baker . not one tree will be cut down or one tree plant as a result of this project , he say . it simply transfer 60 per cent of Gunns export chip -lsb- that otherwise go to Asia -rsb- where its value add to a pulp mill in Tasmania . woodchip be sell for about $ 90 a tonne where as pulp be sell for approximately $ 800 a tonne so it be a terrific value add project . indigenous community urge to take better care of dog with animal number on the rise in remote community , indigenous community be be urge to take better care of they dog to help improve they own health . a national dog conference in Darwin today be try to unite indigenous family and reduce livestock loss . community leader , vet and health worker have come together to share idea , include the development of shared responsibility agreement to attract funding . NSW Farmers in the central crop belt of New South Wales have a short-term reprieve , with fall of between 20 and 30 millimetre ensure the survival of winter wheat crop . but the best fall be in the northern and far western region , with the top total of 60 millimetre record at Louth , west of Bourke . local grazier Wally Mitchell say it be great . this have be a magnificent rain change . many of we have be push scrub , feed cotton seed , keep we breeder alive and some of we have even have a big punt , and join , so the little lamb be just come on the ground here and this will really turn the job around for we , he say . part of Victoria be luckier than other , with talkback caller to the ABC reporting fall of up to 60 millimetre in the state 's north . SA in South Australia , widespread rain be expect to keep the state 's harvest on track for a bumper season . the top reading be at Maralinga in the far west with 65 millimetre , but while most farmer be say it be the most significant rain they have receive all year , other miss out . Rodney Lush from Coombe in the upper south-east be pin he hope on a good rain after suffer a dry June and heavy frost . it have not be heavy rain , it be barely be drizzle a lot of the time , it be only make thing damp , it certainly have not wet thing , barely enough to get my pasture growth go again and it be certainly not enough let we go sowing lucerne with any confidence , he say . US to scale back mad cow disease testing United States Agriculture Secretary Mike Johanns say he department will scale back its expand testing for mad cow disease due to its extremely low rate . Mr Johanns say year of expand and normal testing show the US be likely to have four to seven infected animal and reduce current testing almost ten-fold to 40,000 a year be still well above international guideline . Mr Johanns dismiss concern the move will cause a new rift with Japan , whose food safety body want continued high US testing . we have bent over backwards with the japanese , we have even agree with they to ship only beef from animal under 20-months and that be a very unique , very , very unusual agreement , he say . qld mining sector continue to boom Queensland 's mining boom continue to power ahead with the Queensland Government nominate a large parcel of land for future mineral exploration . AWB announce restructure wheat exporter AWB have announce a further restructure to improve transparency but say it be not a result of the oil-for-food scandal . under the plan AWB International , which hold the licence for the single desk for export , will be further separate from the company 's corporate division . it will have a independent board and management team , and its own governance and committee structure . awb chairman Brendan Stewart say the change be a result of feedback from grower group and grower and be not a knee-jerk reaction to the Cole inquiry . these change that we be make have absolutely nothing to do with the Cole inquiry , these be change that we have initiate 18 month ago , he say . they have be a long time come , they have be a process of detailed analysis and impact so that we deliver on the key promise that we give to grower . Mr Stewart reject any suggestion from grower group that it be too little too late . I don ' think that be the case at all , he say . grain analyst Malcolm Bartholomaeus say there be major flaw in the restructure because the wheat sale division will not be part of AWB International and still will not be accountable enough . one of the implication be that the situation we have see with the Iraq inquiry and the scandal there , and potentially the allegation of other payment be make in other market place , basically that could still happen again and put the single desk at risk with no control over the situation by AWB , he say . AWB have reject the suggestion . meanwhile AWB have cut its estimate before-tax profit by between 20 to 25 per cent . the company say the drought have lead to lower merchandise and fertiliser sale , and result have also be affect by difficult ongoing trading condition and volatile world market . profit for the year end September 30 be expect to drop from a forecast $ 184.5 million to around $ 140 million . wool company sign merger MOU Australia 's two peak wool company will press on with a merger , despite a outstanding $ 27 million debt . australian Wool Innovation -lrb- AWI -rrb- and australian Wool Services -lrb- AWS -rrb- have be in long-running talk about a merger , but the stumble block have be AWS 's outstanding debt to a uk-based superannuation fund . the two company have now sign a memorandum of understand to look at the legal and financial implication of integration with work to start immediately . the Federal Government have be approach to help pay off the debt , but the company now say they will work together to solve the issue . producer tell not to panic over japanese beef decision Japan have lift its ban on US beef but the expert say australian producer do not need to panic just yet . Japan will only accept US beef under 20 month of age and from a limited number of accredited meat plant . meat and Livestock Australia say australian export to Japan should remain steady at around 390,000 tonne a year . Malcolm Foster from the australian Lotfeeders Association do not think the US will pose any short-term threat and say other market be available anyway . the alternate market to Japan be obviously other asian market , in particular Korea , Taiwan and those market , although market in the Middle East and even market in Russia be start to open up now for australian exporter , he say . so there be other market but Japan will always be a very important one for we . US cattlemen be upset over the tough restriction impose by Tokyo . the National Cattlemen 's beef Association argue Japan 's partial reopen be just a first step toward full resumption of trade worth $ us1 .4 billion , before America lose the market to Australia follow a 2003 mad cow case . the association 's Jay Truitt say Tokyo 's limit on US cattle age and number of plant that can ship be far too restrictive . everyone of these restriction add cost to the system - that be not what we want , he say . food price hit 15-year high Australia have post its biggest increase in food price in 15 year . Rabobank say the figure , which be be blame for a big jump in inflation , show a 8.3 per cent rise in food cost . but head of food and agribusiness research Bill Cordingley say the rise be mainly drive by soar banana price , with fruit price up a stunning 52 per cent for the June quarter . price rise for citrus fruit , apple , melon and strawberry , due to consumer demand for a alternative to banana . awb restructure not enough , say US lobby group America 's peak grain lobby group claim a major restructure announce by wheat exporter awb be just for show . AWB have announce a multi-million dollar plan to separate its export arm AWB International from its corporate division . as part of a push for better corporate governance , AWB International will continue to manage the single desk for wheat export , but have its own management team and board . Rebecca Coleman from US Wheat Associates say it still want the AWB 's monopoly on export remove . US wheat do not think that it be go to make a difference , we think that it be just another show game and a shift of box , she say . US Wheat 's concern have always be the power of the monopoly board , the way that they function in distort trade and so a shift of box around do not change the monopoly structure . Australia 's peak body , the grain Council , will not comment on AWB 's restructure plan . in the wake of yesterday 's announcement , AWB share fall by 33 cent but recover to finish at $ 3.85 , just five cent below the opening price . there have be little movement on the company 's share price today , and Austock Agribusiness analyst Paul Jensz say the market have react positively . with this restructuring I think investor probably look at it as a first small step of a long road of recovery , he say . investor broadly be say that this level around $ 3.50 - $ 3.90 be the bottom of awb at this point . crop forecast Winter crop forecast in the eastern state have have a remarkable turnaround due to recent widespread rain . grain handler , Graincorp , say early prospects for this season be dismal , but after late break in June and July , it be expect receival of around 9 million tonne . manage director Tom Keene say that be on par with the past two season . Victoria around 3 million tonne and around 5 million tonne in New South Wales , Queensland we would expect to get around 1 million tonne , he say . Taiwan market remain closed to cherry grower Cherry grower lock out of they $ 7 million market to Taiwan will not be allow back in this year . most mainland region be ban from export fruit in January because grower could not prove they cherry be free of the Queensland fruit fly . I mean these people that live in country in South-East Asia and Asia , they be really concern about the loss of this material too , but they can not save it all on they own . frosty morning take they toll on wildflower industry the wildflower industry in Western Australia be the latest sector to be affect by the dry season . but it be not a lack of rain hamper production . frosty morning be damage the bud and Rhonda Tonkin of Coomberdale say it be the worst she have see in 30 year . Ms Tonkin say she will probably lose some export market this year . if you do not have enough product for the customer they tend to just cancel the container and go to India or somewhere else , she say . but we be fairly unique in Australia with we dry flower and the people be understand because they know that we have a problem . company to streamline australian operation further rationalisation be occur across the international wine industry . one of the world 's largest international beverage alcohol producer , Constellation Brands , say it will streamline its australian operation . constellation own the South australian-based Hardys Wine Company and plan to buyout some grape supply and processing contract , and sell non-strategic asset . more innovation need to overcome wine glut : expert the marketing sector have be force to use its imagination to try to shift some of the billion litre of wine in storage across Australia . one of the latest idea be a six pack of cleanskin wine in brightly colour bottle , which have stopper , so they can be reuse as water bottle . Professor of wine marketing Larry Lockshin , from the University of South Australia , say there need to be more innovation . right now when you say to somebody ` wine ' , we think 750 millilitre in a glass bottle with a stopper of some sort , in Australia it might have a screw cap , other place might have a cork or a synthetic , he say . but that be a very traditional package , it be be around for hundred of year , so we have not be all that creative . look at how you buy milk , how you buy fruit juice , how you buy even tomato paste in the store . we use to buy it in can , now you can buy it in tube like toothpaste . AWB announce new chief the head of Orica Mining Services have be name the new managing director of wheat exporter awb . Gordon Davis , 50 , will replace Andrew Lindberg , who quit at the height of the oil-for-food inquiry earlier this year . Mr Davis will be pay $ 875,000 a year , which be less than Mr Lindberg be receive . awb chairman Brendan Stewart say Mr Davis 's role will be to stabilise the company and restore its credibility in the aftermath of the Cole inquiry . I be very conscious of the fact that Gordon should not be in any way , shape or form deem to have be involve in anything that be go before we at AWB , he say . he be new to the organisation , he be a cleanskin in that sense and we look very much forward to he run the business as it go forward , and essentially the board , and myself , will be deal with any issue that come out of the Cole inquiry . Kalgoorlie lack gold treatment facility , conference tell treatment mill in Kalgoorlie in Western Australia be work overtime to turn as much ore into gold bar to take advantage of record gold price . this week the Kalgoorlie region be host the Diggers and Dealers conference , attend by some of the world 's leader in the resource sector . analyst dr Sandra Close have tell the conference that local plant can not keep up with the amount of gold be dig up to ship overseas . one of the actual problem we be actually see - I guess , in a way , it be a good problem to have - and that be there be a lack of gold treatment facility in the Kalgoorlie area , ' she say . divided view on wheat marketing four hundred delegate meet at the Agriculture Australia conference and all eye and ear be on a panel session - look at the future of the wheat industry in the face of AWB inquiry . the key question be should grower retain the single desk , and if so , should they allow AWB to continue to manage it ? the grain Council of Australia , which represent state-based grain body , say producer want to keep the system as it stand until the end of the Cole inquiry . but as pressure mount from the impending cost of the inquiry , the Grain Growers Association , which represent 17,000 producer on the Eastern seaboard , say there be little choice but to change . so what option should grower go with ? on the one side , international trader who want to get a share in the market say grower have nothing to lose . on the other hand , AWB have staunchly defend the benefit of have a single marketer as the best way to maximise return to grower . grain dispute settle out of court a legal dispute over grain warehouse by Creasy 's Grain Enterprises have be settle out of court . when Creasy 's collapse last year , the receiver Ferrier Hodgson cite a 1933 High Court to claim title to a significant tonnage of grain store under warehouse agreement . the Whillock family from the north-west , with financial and legal support from the australian Farmers fighting fund , challenge that claim in the court . a settlement of $ 97,000 have now be reach , return the full market value of the grain to the Whillock family , plus a large portion of the legal cost . the NSW Farmers Association take up the fight for the Whillock family and the president , Jock Laurie , say although a legal precedent be not set it be still a significant win for the family . meanwhile , Jackie Whillock have mix feeling about the case . she be glad that they have receive the full value of the grain , but disappoint the 1933 ruling have not be overturn . live at the Agriculture Australia 2006 conference Matt O'Sullivan bring you national Rural News today live from the Agriculture Australia conference in Sydney . MATTHEW O'SULLIVAN : hello , I be Matt O'Sullivan , bring you national Rural News today from the Agriculture Australia conference in Sydney , the peak gathering for the grain industry . as you would expect the future of the single desk for wheat export be a hot topic , and confusion seem to be the common theme . the future of GM crop be also be debate today and , of course , there be plenty of speculation about whether we will actually get a decent grain harvest this season - as the ongoing dry drag on , many part of Australia desperately need follow up rain . but everybody seem to be talk about alternative fuel , with crude oil price hit new high this week . Delegates believe it be time the Federal Government offer new incentive to make the switch to ethanol and biodiesel . delegate : I think there be such a abundance of energy in Australia , you know , they be not very worried about it . they might as well just sit on they arse and not worry about it . delegate : we be not get any result at all with the biofuel . the Government 's just not interested to mandate it , and this be not actually go to get off the ground until it be actually mandate , so it be really up to the government . delegate : this issue be now on the table , it be here . and we can not afford to be sit in here in three year ' time not really know where we will be and not pick up on the advantage that be there right now . delegate : I fully support the biofuel concept in industry . I disagree with the fact that they will be get a excise and I want a level playing field in term of acquisition of raw material . MOS : certainly , there be a feeling that the Government need to do more , and the grain industry need to do more as well to get on the front foot and make sure that grain grower have a big slice of this market for grain . there do seem to be a concern that Australia be a long way behind other country in tap into the ethanol and biodiesel market . one of the speaker here today be Terry Reinhart from Advance Trading in the US . thanks for join we , can you give we a idea of the industry in the US ? TERRY REINHART : today , it be about a 4.2 billion gallon industry , which compare to five year ago when it be about a 1 billion gallon industry , and projection be that by 2010 it will be a 10 billion gallon industry . MOS : so do a country like Australia have a long way to go to try and catch up to that ? can we catch up to that ? tr : the good news about ethanol be it be a 3000-year-old process by which you take corn and distil it into ethanol , so it be not real rocket science , and if you have the money it be fairly quick to build . you can build a 100 million gallon plant in 15 to 16 month , so it be not like it take 20 year to develop this thing . MOS : one of the big concern here be from end user of feed grain , that it will be much more expensive and it will be harder to get access to that grain . how be the corn go into ethanol in the US affect the market there ? tr : to date , there have not be any effect on the end user , because corn be still relatively cheap . today in the US we be over supply with corn , which be one of the motivator to develop ethanol as a demand for corn , but down the road , as we continue to increase they production , we be go to have to price corn as fuel as oppose to price corn as food and the livestock producer be concerned greatly in the US also . MOS : that , I think , be go to be a grow theme , be not it , that you have more and more different type of grain go into produce fuel and into produce food , when that be a big issue ? tr : yeah , it be a big issue , and you can kind of sum up the whole thing if you go back to , I think it be 1998 , one barrel of crude would buy 4.7 bushel of corn and today one barrel of crude would buy 30 bushel of corn , so the price relationship strongly favour corn as a fuel as oppose to be a food . MOS : in term of the US industry , here in Australia we have get a lot of different plant set up in small operation . there be no sort of overall structure . be that go to tell against Australia in the long run ? tr : I do not know . in the US , there be not much structure at this point either . the early people in the ethanol industry be the Cargills and the adm of the world . they have be make ethanol for quite some time , but all the new capacity or much of the new capacity be small start-up operation , group of farmer go together invest in ethanol plant and there be not much organisation today to all the ethanol plant that be out there and time will tell . my guess be some of these plant be build in the right place and some of they be not , and we will just have to see over time which one be build in the right place . MOS : I see a story quote Sir Richard Branson say he be invest in ethanol plant in the US . be they start to attract that big business investment ? tr : yes . early on , four or five year ago , capital be a problem and you just work and work and work to try and find enough money to build a ethanol plant . to put it in perspective , to build a 100 million gallon plant - which be the one they be build now - it take about $ 170 million to build that plant . whereas five or 10 year ago it be terribly difficult to raise that money , today you be hear story of people raise that kind of money in 30 and 60 day period . MOS : so there be reason for farmer get involve in this to have some hope that it will take-off ? tr : in the US , I would say it have take off , it really have . and the limit resource in the US right now be plant capacity . and if we build all the plant that be on the draw board today , the limit resource be soon go to become farmland , enough land to produce enough corn to feed the ethanol plant . MOS : thanks for you time , Terry Reinhart from Advance Trading in the US . you be listen to a special broadcast of National Rural News from the Agriculture Australia conference in Sydney . of course , alternative fuel have not be the only item on the agenda here - a entire session have be devote to the future of the single desk for wheat export in the aftermath of the oil-for-food Inquiry . reporter Alice Plate sit in on the session - and Alice , what be the feeling about the future of we wheat export system ? ALICE PLACE : well the feeling have actually change a bit . in the past , many grower , I think , have try to separate the single desk issue , that be , AWB 's right to veto other exporter ' application to sell wheat overseas , from the ongoing oil-for-food inquiry . and yesterday , at the panel , many of the grower group admit that change be now inevitable . MOS : they be unsure though about what sort of system they want for the future , be that right ? ap : that be right . look at the single desk marketing system , it be not simple , by anyone 's analysis of it . break it down , you have get on one side the trader , other major competitor - cbh , Graincorp , and the like - all try to get into that market , say that they can give grower better return . and AWB , on the other hand , be say that it can maximise return for grower and give they security . but the grain Council of Australia , which represent state-based grower body , say that the majority of grower do not want a change from what they have get . they want awb to stay there . they want the single desk . on the other hand , the Grain Growers Association , which be east coast grain grower , say grower do want to know more about they option , that they be really start to question the current system . MOS : so be they look for more leadership from the grain body ? ap : that be right . we do have a grower stand up yesterday and say , why be not you put forward option and recommend those to we ? and we have see the grain Council of Australia , they have do independent report , also they have look at the victorian Farmers Federation 's option for the single desk , but they be say they be unwilling to analyse and make those recommendation until the Cole inquiry wrap up in September . MOS : thanks Alice . speak of the inquiry , AWB have tell the Federal Court today it will cut by a third the number of document it be battle to keep away from the Cole inquiry . lawyer for the wheat exporter have tell the court that nearly 400 document will be strike from the confidential list , leave 900 still to be contest . and that hearing be continue in Melbourne . here at the conference , reporter Michael Condon have be in one of the GM session . what have be discuss ? MICHAEL CONDON : one of the contentious issue surround the grain industry always be genetically modify crop , particularly food crop . today we have hear a couple of distinct point of view express . we hear from the the director of scientific affair for Monsanto . he be actually address the conference as we speak now . bit of a coup for the conference . he be come from the United States say that he know that farmer already support GM crop . he say they get better yield . they use fewer chemical . they have higher initial seed cost , but those be easily recoup . he be say thatHe 's say that farmer be in favour . he do concede , though , that there be a bit of a way to go to convince consumer about eat the food that be make from g-m crop . Monsanto , of course , famously put they GM wheat on hold for the time be . he say there be no plan to change that . but Mr Glick say he be get a strong feeling that consumer will soon be convince . they will come to the party , he say . they will realise that g-m crop can do all sort of thing . they can put in special oils to reduce heart disease . they can have certain complex carbohydrate to combat diabetes , and g-m food also have less exposure to chemical in the grow process . so he say he think they will be convince . MOS : what about the food company ? what do they think about that ? MC : at this stage , George Weston Foods general manager be here as well . he be ask that question . he say at this stage consumer be not ready . they would prefer to see the segregation process remain . he be particularly relate to canola . keep the oilseed separate that be GM . the other , that be non-gm be use in food . but he say too that he think that eventually consumer would change they attitude , and it be up to industry and up to research to try and find way of promote health benefit in GM to consumer as well . MOS : thanks Michael , reporter Michael Condon here . New regulation restrict animal health work to vet under propose new animal welfare regulation in New South Wales , a range of routine animal health procedure will be restricted to vet . from September 1 , vet will be responsible for dehorn cattle , and mulesing sheep over a year old , and castrate cattle , sheep and goat over six month of age . the new regulation also classify most equine dentistry as veterinary science , limit equine dentist to basic tooth clean and rasp . master equine dentist and trainer Ian Wharton say the regulation will be devastate . Govt to hear farmer ' chemical access concern the Federal Government say it will listen to farmer concern before decide whether to restrict access to more agricultural chemical in the wake of the latest terrorism threat . there be currently a review of 84 herbicide , fungicide and fumigant . farmer be worry that a new licensing system be consider by the government will make the chemical too expensive . Middle East unrest hit cattle export the conflict in the Middle East be affect some sector of the live export cattle trade . Israel be a consistent buyer of large bull from the Kimberley in far north western Australia . but over the past month , inquiry have ease and price have drop 20 to 30 cent a kilogram . Elders livestock agent Kelvin Hansey say the instability between Israel and Lebanon have hurt the small bull market . I mean it be a 30 per cent drop in the price already , and have the potential though to stop for several month , he say . they be big event , these international event . Abattoir 's closure hit lamb price livestock price in New South Wales have react to the closure of the Cowra Abattoir , with lamb price fall $ 3 to $ 4 a head . a administrator be appoint and the abattoir 's operation be shut down yesterday . Management claim the meatwork have be lose between $ 30,000 and $ 50,000 a week . Chris Grove , from the New South Wales Sheep meat Council , be concern that there be one less buyer in the market . what it will probably mean will be a downturn in competition , he say . one less buyer mean less competition but it be just to be hope that there be enough competition in the market . a big problem we be face in the industry , all the meat industry and the sheep industry , be the reduction in kill capacity . of course this have be make worse by closure of Cowra Abattoir . Cattle feedlot to host ethanol plant international investment firm Babcock and Brown be plan to build a $ 120 million ethanol plant at a cattle feedlot in southern New South Wales . the propose facility at Rockdale beef at Yanco will produce up to 150 million litre of ethanol a year , and the grain by-product feed to the cattle . Rockdale 's general manager Paul Trojah say the ethanol production will complement the feedlot 's plan for a biogas plant to generate electricity from cow manure . Rockdale Feedlock will be produce about five megawatt of energy a day from all of the waste stream , he say . Farmers question fuel package benefit the Federal Government have pump $ 1.5 billion into a plan to tackle high fuel price , but there be question over whether the farm or transport sector will benefit . almost half of the package will cover the cost of convert and install LPG tank . Grants of up to $ 2,000 for the conversion be available immediately . but it be not expect to benefit farmer because it only apply to private user , and most farmer use machinery run on diesel , which can not be convert to LPG . there be also concern conversion will be delay because of a huge demand and limited resource . a three-year program to help service station adopt equipment to sell ethanol-blended fuel , have also be announce . but the biofuel industry would have prefer a mandate for ethanol-blended fuel and more pressure on oil company to buy ethanol . the Federal Government will also spend $ 123 million to encourage people to use wind and solar power over generator in remote community . there be $ 76 million to encourage more oil exploration . fishing industry the fishing industry say the fuel package be of no assistance . I do not think politician , in particular the Prime Minister , actually realise where the fishing industry be , he say . financially we be on a knife 's edge and fuel be we big cost . fine for minor breach may exacerbate driver shortage problem livestock transport operator be concern that new fatigue management measure propose by the National Transport Commission could force driver out of the industry . the commission 's proposal to improve driver fatigue suggest a demerit system for log book offence , the same system use for general traffic offence . Ross Fraser from Frasers Transport in Queensland say while road safety be paramount , the shortage of driver will get worse if they start be fine for minor breach . we be really concern about it because we be get driver who be at the moment be fine for 15 minute over in they log book - 15 minute over a driving period that may have happen three week ago , he say . accc recommendation threaten phone rental parity the cost of phone line rental in regional Australia could rise dramatically if the Federal Government accept new recommendation from the australian competition and Consumer Commission -lrb- ACCC -rrb- . Telecommunications consultant Gavin Priestley say the ACCC have recommend a wholesale line rental of $ 7.00 a month for CBD customer , but $ 34 for major regional centre . he say that mean rental cost for line in smaller community could rise much higher . what it signal be the average of the access price for telephone right across Australia be go to change and we worst fear potentially be go to be realise , he say . that be country people will not get parity and will pay more for access to they phone line . when the sale of Telstra be tout we be guarantee that we would get parity of price and future proofing of the service . this be certainly not parity . the National Farmers Federation -lrb- NFF -rrb- say it be concerned and seek more detail from the Communications Minister . Farmers urge to lobby for weed bio-control program scientist be call on farmer to lobby for more natural way to control weed . the co-operative research Centre for Weed Management say the use of bug and disease to control invasive plant over the past 100 year have provide $ 10 billion worth of environmental and agricultural protection . despite criticism that natural control method be too slow and unreliable , Dr Rachel McFadyen say the new research suggest previous effort have prevent invasive plant from wreck the environment . what we be say to farmer be if farmer have get a significant problem year after year then they should be ask they agriculture representative and they state government member , be there a bio-control program against this weed ? she say . and if there be , do it have enough fund to get it go and if there be not why be there one ? because it be one of the best return on money that they can get . meanwhile large tree crop company in Western Australia be open they gate to agist sheep from drought-stricken farm . Senate tell Govt to blame for ` environmental disaster ' in Culgoa A Senate inquiry into water have be tell that successive Queensland government have ignore the advice of expert scientist , to create what be possibly the ` worst environmental disaster in inland Australia ' on the Culgoa Balonne floodplain in northern New South Wales . nsw farmer Ed Fessey tell the Senate 's Rural and Regional Affairs Committee that over extraction of water in Queensland be destroy both the environment and the livelihood of those on the Culgoa floodplain . this be highlight by the flippant , nonchalant and at time dismissive attitude that successive Queensland Natural Resources to due process ; the complete ignorance of a very strong and detailed submission by the New South Wales Government in 2004 ; the very select use of Peter Cullen 's scientific report to endorse they plan , whilst ignore the clear warning that significant ecological problem will occur , he say . grim outlook for SA grain harvest a warm and windy day in South Australia yesterday have not help what be look set to be a decent season for grain grower . the grain harvest will now be well below average this year , unless there be significant rain in the next two week . Wave Hill walk-off celebration under way it have be 40 year since the Wave Hill walk-off , a protest which lead to the indigenous rights movement in Australia . celebration have begin in the remote northern territory of Kalkaringi , 800km south-west of Darwin . a overwhelming mood of friendship and reconciliation bind more than 1,500 people gather by the Victoria River , the site where stockman Vincent Lingiari lead he people on strike in 1966 . originally protest against the pay condition on nearby Wave Hill Station , the nine-year strike soon become a battle for land rights . among the crowd today be descendant of the original Gurindgi striker , pastoralist , politician and visitor from across the country . as part of the festival a agreement be be sign between the Northern Territory Cattlemen 's Association , the Northern Territory Government , the Land Councils and the Indigenous Land Corporation to boost Aboriginal participation in the pastoral industry . nz stone fruit grower get WA access New Zealand stone fruit grower will be allow to sell they fruit into market in Western Australia , six year after apply for access . Apple , pear industry unveil competitiveness plan the apple and pear industry have launch a ambitious research program to make australian orchard globally competitive . the million-dollar program , Future Orchards 2012 , be unveil in Hobart this morning . year of rise production cost and low price have leave australian apple and pear grower fight for survival . the industry have to reduce cost while increase the amount of fruit harvest per hectare , and Future Orchards 2012 should prove it can be do . the current yield be 20 tonne of fruit per hectare from a average of 640 tree . under the plan tonnage would more than double and high density plant would almost triple the amount of tree . the intensive orcharding would also be capital intensive , cost up to $ 60,000 a hectare . Farmers predict crop failure within week farmer in Victoria 's Wimmera Mallee grain grow region say if it do not rain within two week they crop will fail . the effect of a lack of rain have be make worse by a run of frost and strong dry wind . Neil Simpson who have plant 1,500 hectare of wheat at Berriwillock in the southern Mallee say the earlier sown crop be already die and it be look bleak for the rest . assume that there be not further rain , the late crop will also fail and they may not even produce a head in the circumstance so the outlook be certainly very dismal at this point and continue to deteriorate , he say . nickel shortage cause panic the London Metal Exchange be force to intervene in the nickel market last night for the first time since the 1980s , to curb panic buying among metal trader . analyst predict there be only enough nickel leave on the exchange to cover one day of world consumption . supplies have shrink because of a strike at the world 's largest nickel mine at Voisey 's Bay in Canada . in Australia , share in nickel mining company have skyrocket , as speculator predict the situation will not ease in the short term . Commonwealth Bank commodity strategist Tobin Gorey predict the market tightness will continue to force up price . in term of supply be tight yes it will -lsb- force price up -rsb- . whether it be actually so tight that people can not complete transaction be another matter , that be really what define the current circumstance , he say . Plan aim to tackle climate change impact on agriculture the federal , state and territory government have unveil a national action plan to tackle the affect of climate change on agriculture . it be design to help farmer adapt to a change climate , mitigate and prevent the impact of change , provide better research and development and increase awareness . while there be no funding or specific project yet , Ben Fargher from the National Farmers Federation say it be a significant step . Australia on track for driest August on record the National climate Centre say we could be shape up for another major drought year if it do not rain soon . Australia be on track for its driest August on record , with a average of just 2.6 millimetre of rain so far this month , compare to the lowest recorded total of 7.1 millimetre . Meteorologist Blair Trewin say while south-west WA be in trouble , the eastern state be in a slightly better position because of rain last month . -lsb- it -rsb- certainly have not be as dry as year like 1994 and 2002 generally speak , he aid . if we be to have a very dry september/october period then we might start get down into the kind of territory we see in 1994 and 2002 , but we outlook be not currently indicate a particularly high chance of that happen . grower fear Coles Myer takeover Fruit and vegetable grower be concern a foreign takeover of Coles Myer could squeeze they out of the market . a us-based consortium have launch a bid to buy the retail giant . Michael Badcock , from AUSVEG , fear a sale would leave producer at the whim of major international corporation . the biggest problem we have get in Australia be that we have two major supermarket chain and that be it , who control about 70 per cent of Australia 's market , he say . if one of these be take over by a big world player - and they be quite ruthless in the way they cut cost and cut staff and everything else - if one do it the other one would do it . that would be a disaster for producer in Australia . the Federal Government can reject takeover that be deem not to be in the national interest . but Griffith University 's Tony Makin say even with lobbying , farmer be unlikely to stop a takeover bid . I be talk to they . I have indicate to they that we will provide whatever information they need , he say . test kit will be supply if require and USDA will investigate .
