Goulburn Murray water diversion ` not fair ' farmer be dismay at the victorian government 's plan to divert water away from the Goulburn Murray irrigation district to supply two regional city . the State Government be build a pipeline from the Waranga Basin to Bendigo , and now want to extend it as far as Ballarat . but Simon Ramsey say it be not fair on dairy farmer and fruit grower , who will only receive 7 per cent of the water allocation this season . it be disappointing give the angst and apprehension in the rural community about the present prolonged dry condition and also obviously the very little allocation particularly in the Goulbourn system and campaspe , he say . worker relocation scheme raise social concern Social welfare group have concern about Federal Government plan to pay the unemployed to move to regional area to fill labour shortage . under a pilot scheme , the Government will offer potential worker up to $ 5,000 to move from area with above-average unemployment . the Agrifoods Industry skill Council say there need to be major infrastructure infrastructure to make the project work . Lin Hatfield-Dodds , from the australian council of Social Service , have concern about the impact of the proposal on worker . we concern be just if people do move for work what happen if that job do not work out , what support and what safety net be we go to put in place to enable people to go back to where they have come from ? she say . but there be also and probably more importantly the organisational and emotional cost of move and the relational cost . people who do move a large distance for work often find that they can feel isolate . the mining sector do not think the project will help ease the labour shortage . Reg Howard-Smith , from the WA Chamber of Minerals and Energy , say the practice of fly worker in and out of mine site could be a major stumbling block . we have not see detail on what be propose but if it be a requirement to live in a regional centre , then obviously that preclude people work on a fly-in fly-out basis , he say . Australia endure driest August since 1900 on this first day of spring there be little surprise at news Australia have endure its driest August since record begin in 1900 . preliminary figure show a national average rainfall of just 6.87 millimetre for August . overall , a average of 43.9 millimetre of rain fall across Australia during the winter . senior climatologist at the Bureau of Meteorology , Dr Andrew Watkins , say it have be decade since rain be so scarce . australia-wide we only average about 6.2 millimetre for the month , so a very dry month , he say . we previous driest august be in 1914 and unfortunately 1982 be also a comparison - it have about 7.5 millimetre . Cane grower examine damage cause by deluge Cane farmer in north Queensland say it be too early to know the extent of damage from massive , unexpected rain . while September be suppose to be the driest month in the tropics , some farmer have receive up to 665 millimetre in the Herbert River District around Ingham over the weekend . that be 26 inch on the imperial scale . while farmer further south would love even a fraction of that rainfall , plant scientist Ron Van Kerkwyk say it have halt the sugarcane harvest , and could have a disastrous impact on thousand of hectare of newly plant cane . planting be the highest single operative cost you have get on a farm and it really be a tragedy of some proportion when we get as much rain as we have have here at this time of the year which , number one be fairly unusual and number two it be impact by the fact that so much of the plant cane we have get be , relatively speak , very young , he say . in the south , where the rain be really need , the dry condition be start to hurt South Australia 's aquaculture industry . a lack of typical winter weather mean oyster be grow slower than normal , due to a lack of food . Golden spinifex could cut exploration cost Spinifex grass might be a natural signpost to untold wealth , accord to research finding in the Tanami Desert . scientist have discover that spinifex plant can carry trace of gold in they leaf , if they be grow above a mineral deposit . further research need to be do , but mining company say the discovery could lead to big savings in exploration cost . Dr Stephen Rogers from the Cooperative Research Centre for Landscape environment and Mineral Exploration , say the grass be prove to be a natural metal detector . what the plant do be because it live in very arid region it need to get its water from the ground water so it put the most of its energy into create this huge single root that penetrate very , very deeply into the regolith , into the cover of the landscape to the ground water , he say . Mine to give Tiwi be job boost a new sand mine on the Tiwi Islands north of Darwin be set to boost employment for the local aboriginal community . Matilda Minerals will produce 200,000 tonne of the heavy mineral concentrate , zircon-rutile over the next six year . manage director Bruce Maluish say he want to reduce the environmental impact of mine a island in the Torres Strait . the sand average about 4 per cent heavy mineral , he say . the process involve mine the sand , process it , extract the 5 per cent of heavy mineral and put the sand back in the hole where it come from . so it be a pretty benign impact and we can be mine through area quite quickly at low impact , and come back and rehabilitate the land quite smartly as well . season 's first mango sell for $ 25,000 hundred of greengrocer pack the Sydney produce market this morning for the annual charity auction of the season 's first box of mango . the 12 mango , from Pine Creek Plantation in the northern territory , sell for $ 25,000 , with the money to be donate to the Westmead Children 's Hospital . the buyer , Fred Piscuineri , say the hospital will also need to get the kid ' cutlery out for a surprise dessert today . I think we be go to go to the Westmead Hospital like we do two year ago and give they to those poor kid that be in the hospital , he say . online date on the rise in region yesterday we hear about a boom in online shopping in regional Australia , and it now seem that more country man and woman be find love on the web as well . Fiona Thomas run the online date site rural romeo , and say in the past 12 month there have be a 50 per cent increase in online date . she say access to the internet have reduce isolation , which in the past have cause loneliness and depression . they be pretty fair dinkum about it , she say . mainly in the marriage age bracket sort of from 25 but right up to 40 - 45 , that may have be marry and this be second time around . song play for Makybe Diva to make beautiful music there be more than a touch of romance in the multi-million dollar thoroughbred breeding season this year in the Hunter Valley . it be one of the region 's biggest season , with booking for nearly 100 proven stallion . among they , have be the highly anticipate join of Melbourne Cup champion Makybe Diva and the emerge stallion Gallileo . and , to add that special touch , stud manager Peter O'Brien say owner Tony Santic ask for the Diva 's favourite song to get she in the mood . we have candle outside she stable , and we have Deborah Conway 's it be only the beginning , be the song choose to bring the romantic side on . that be seemingly she song they use to play to she in the stable . and we have all she colour around she stable . I think the October rain 's go to be the most important for the district , he say . river pump allow in Bourke the New South Wales Government have allow horticultural irrigator in the outback community of Bourke to pump emergency water supply out of the dwindle Darling River . the Bourke region have be suffer drought condition for more than five year , and irrigator be battle to keep citrus tree , grape vine and hojoba plant alive . Phil Mansell from Back of Bourke Fruits say tough decision be be make about whether to let crop die , with no guarantee of future water flow . we have a grape crop there that we have to now make the decision , will we have the water to take that crop through into a harvest ? he say . it be a further million dollar investment to do the work to grow that crop , and the easiest thing to do be just to turn the water off a significantly large area of vine . but the financier be face a terrible dilemma , they be consider what do that do to the community , what do it do to job in town et cetera ? feed grain user move to import the australian quarantine and Inspection Service -lrb- AQIS -rrb- have confirm that some feed grain user be look to import stock for the first time since 2002 . Mine company order to pay former exec compo a western australian mining company have be order to pay more than $ 1.8 million to a former senior executive , after fail to disclose a nickel discovery . the Supreme Court of Western Australia yesterday award the money to Kim Riley , a former managing director and shareholder of Jubilee Mines . in late 1994 , rival company Western Mining Corporation tell Jubilee Mines it have inadvertently find the nickel deposit on Jubilee 's tenement in the northern goldfield . however Jubilee Mines do not publicly provide information of the find until two year later . in that time , Mr Riley sell he entire holding in the company . he say he would have be in a different position about sell the share if he have know about the discovery . I have get mixed emotion , I be very relieved , he say . it be a stressful period for myself , also for my wife and child , I be glad that it be over . human error ` probable cause ' of GM canola mix-up human error have be identify as the most likely cause of the genetically-modified contamination of conventional canola two year ago . low level contamination of the commercially-grown ` grace ' variety be discover in 2005 during routine sampling of canola export . a trial of GM canola be conduct in Tasmania in 1998 , and a year later grace canola be grow on a separate site three kilometre away , but a investigation by the Office of the Gene Technology Regulator have find that be not how the contamination occur . Alex Schaap from Tasmania 's Department of primary industry say there be not enough evidence to provide a definite answer . the mystery still remain as to what the source of the contamination be , he say . the only hypothesis leave standing be some form of human error , perhaps something as simple as somebody not label seed bag correctly , and seed hence be mix . the peak grain research body say it be continue negotiation to try to secure the commercial release of genetically modify crop . the grain Research and Development Corporation be fund research into GM canola , which can not be release to farmer because of state-imposed ban on the technology . Chairman Terry Enright say the benefit of GM crop , such as disease tolerant wheat and barley , need to be prove . we be positively work with industry and with government in a dialogue to make sure that we overcome these issue that be there , he say . and we be hopeful in the long term that if crop become available and can be assess on a crop by crop basis , if they demonstrate benefit to the industry , that ultimately we will be able to grow they , if that be what be require . meanwhile , Nufarm have buy the licence to develop and commercialise genetically-modified canola . the agribusiness company have pay $ 10 million for Monsanto 's Roundup Ready canola licence and germ plasm . Inland rail link inch forward the Federal Government say a new inland rail network link Brisbane and Melbourne will need to be build , to cope with grow freight demand on road and exist rail network . Transport Minister Warren Truss have release a 15-month study into the project , and say the far western sub-corridor be the top contender from four route name in the report . the project will cost more than $ 3 billion , and taxpayer will need to contribute two third . the Federal Government want the line to be in operation by 2019 . Minister Truss say there will be consultation on the best route , but one be a particular stand-out . now that particular corridor would cost about 3.1 billion dollar to build and achieve a transit time of just under 21 hour , he say . dairy industry pledge $ 15m to fight fund a new national Dairy Innovation Centre have be task with finding way to compete with the grow soy milk market . seven milk company have pledge $ 15 million to the centre , which will be base on Melbourne 's outskirts . dairy farmer have also contribute , through the levy they pay to Dairy Australia . Chairman Andrew Donovan say the research into new milk product will help farmer . we will be look at protect they price , they milk price , we live in a very competitive environment both as a dairy industry but also dairy industry compete with other food product such as soy , and so this be really a protection strategy , he say . US beef export get green light to South Korea South Korea have agree to readmit beef export from the US . Australia 's share of the market have grow by 120 per cent since US beef be ban in 2004 , and be now worth $ 600 million . meat and Livestock Australia -lrb- MLA -rrb- say the resumption of the american beef trade could cut the value of we export by more than 20 per cent . South Korea 's Agriculture Ministry have just announce that 36 US slaughterhouse designate to handle meat for export to South Korea meet require safety measure , clear the last hurdle to the resumption of import . MLA korean manager , Glen Feist say the Americans have have a tough time convince the Koreans to accept meat with bone chip fragment . the protocol be no bone , but everybody know in we industry that from time to time you do get bone chip on the primal cut of beef through bone problem , especially in the biggest US plant , he say . I think the PM have put the matter to rest for now , but I think what we do see from this be that politician of all shape , size and colour understand that this be a vital issue for Tasmania 's industry and it be a issue that we have to keep certainly we finger on , he say . Committee chair , Greens Senator Rachel Siewert , say submission to the inquiry show alarming trend . it appear to we that the impact of climate change on rainfall and subsequent water supplies have not be adequately account for , she say . beef industry worry at US ` grain-fed ' labelling plan meat and Livestock Australia -lrb- MLA -rrb- be worry at US plan to allow beef from cattle that have spend time in feedlot and eat grain , to be label grass-fed . mla regional manager Michelle Gorman say Australia pride itself on be a leader in grass-fed beef . Ms Gorman say USDA must remember the consumer when it rewrite the rule on grass-fed labelling . there be people that be interested in how the animal have be raise ... and we have many other product category here , whether it be natural , organic , grain-fed , she say . it be just another product in the range and there need to be some accuracy in the type , how the product be and then , how it be label . Ms Gorman say sale of australian beef cut in North America be grow month on month , and the grass-fed label be work . commodity boom ` go strong ' despite price the price of oil have hit a five-month low , and gold have tumble below $ us600 a ounce , but one market analyst reject claim the commodity boom be almost over . Rob Brierly from broke firm Hartleys say commodity price have experience month of volatility , and the current dramatic drop in price be be drive by speculator . the lower price have drag down the australian sharemarket by 46 point , but Mr Brierly be confident that a correction be just around the corner . we might see a couple more day of weakness , or even a week of weakness but I be sure it will turn around because the fundamental be still very strong , he say . inventory be very low for most commodity , there be not a lot of new project come on stream in the near term and demand from place like China be still very , very strong . Coalition party at odds on fruit , veg code the Federal Liberal and National party appear to be on a collision course over the propose code of conduct for the fruit and vegetable industry . design to give grower more transparency when sell they produce , Industry Minister Ian Macfarlane say the code will not be mandatory . but Nationals Senator Ron Boswell have tell reporter Shelley Lloyd that a mandatory version remain on the table , as originally promise before the 2004 election . it be a election commitment that I campaign on , it be a election commitment that be in a official policy document , he say . I be say , a mandatory code be a commitment that we give at the election and that be a commitment they expect to be honour . a spokeswoman for Minister Macfarlane say the code will be enforceable , and deliver the same benefit , without cost million of dollar require to implement a mandatory system . she say a mandatory code be not Coalition policy at the last election . the National Farmers Federation -lrb- NFF -rrb- say it will walk away from this week 's talk on develop the new code , if its requirement be not meet . grower and wholesaler will meet in Canberra on Thursday to thrash out the detail . nff vice-president Charles Burke say the code need to force wholesaler to provide more information to grower during price negotiation , improve contract , and include a dispute resolution process . what guarantee do we have as producer that this process be go to lead to a outcome ? he say . because we have just participate in the one that do not . hi-tech quarantine lab set up in Darwin Suspect plant disease and insect gather across northern Australia and Asia will now be check in new secure hi-tech laboratory in Darwin . more than $ 3 million have be spend create the australian quarantine and Inspection Service 's new headquarters . plant pathologist Jane Ray say the upgrade include filter system to ensure that no material escape or hitchhike on staff . this facility be specifically design to handle pathogen of quarantine concern like citrus canker for example , she say . citrus canker could be work on in the bio-hazard cabinet , which would enable the pathogen to be contain within the cabinet . the negative pressure and the procedure and protocol in place would prevent the escape of this pathogen . we could actually diagnose it here , rapidly and move for eradication , rather than actually delay diagnosis as well . another hi-tech quarantine lab be due to be construct in Cairns , North Queensland . Dorper sheep sale set record price Sheep that can produce both wool and meat be become increasingly popular , with a south australian dorper ram fetch the top price of $ 41,000 at the breed 's national sale yesterday . that be a long way above the top price of $ 18,000 pay for a merino ram at a major sale just week ago . buyer and seller from WA , South Australia and Queensland attend the sale at Dubbo , in central western New South Wales , and Paul Jamieson from Elders say there be a almost 100 per cent clearance rate for the 120 ram offer . lindeman to include foreign wine the Foster 's Group say it will sell south african and chilean wine under its Lindemans brand , which have traditionally be exclusively australian . the beverage giant say it be a result of research in key export market , which show shopper buy wine because it be good value for money , rather than its origin . but some in the local industry say the Foster 's research undermine effort be make to market wine under the Wine Australia banner . Mike Stone from Murray Valley Winegrowers say the move should serve as a warning for wine grape producer . how long before we have major australian wine company simply buy grape from the cheapest source ? he say . do it mean that even in a few year ' time that australian wine grape grower will be in competition with grower from other country ? Mr Johanns say Australia have the ` high ground ' when it come to free trade . they be free trader , they be very , very supportive of market access and so , during the negotiation over the last couple of year , they have be right there with we , do everything they can to push the idea that tariff need to come down , that we need better market access , really , on a worldwide basis , he say . and Mr Johanns say non-subsidisers Australia and New Zealand be push to reduce farm subsidy as well . Dry winter impact on grain crop the forecast for this year 's grain crop have take another big hit . the australian bureau of Agriculture and Resource Economics say record low winter rainfall will lead to a 36 per cent drop in production to 26 million tonne . Queensland , Western Australia and South Australia be expect to be hardest hit , with the canola crop tip to be the worst in 10 year . barley will be down 40 per cent and Profarmer analyst Richard Koch say current warm weather across south-eastern Australia could slice another 4 million tonne off the already low wheat crop . there be crop from about Narrabri down through Victoria that be in the balance at the moment and would need further rain to guarantee yield , he say . hay export under cloud a 200,000 to 300,000 tonne shortfall be put export order for hay in jeopardy this year . with dry condition , forecast for the oaten hay crop have fall by half , leave farmer unable to fill contract order . one of the country 's largest export company , Balco Australia , say it will take hay make from fail wheat crop to make up the shortfall . Marketing director Murray Smith say farmer will not make as much money , but at least they will receive a return for they crop . it be probably only about $ 10 a tonne , mainly because a lot of the wheat be beard and be not exactly what they want , but hopefully for the grower they can get a bit of a yield from they crop , he say . drastic drop in cotton plant expect the australian cotton season have begin in central Queensland , although only a quarter of the normal area be expect to be plant . a small band of farmer have start plant crop , rely on unused irrigation water from last season , since there be no new water available this season because of the drought . grower Hamish Miller say he be hope for better price , because of the lower crop estimate . I could sit here for hour and talk about the price but I think fundamentally from information that I work with and receive I think the market do look like it will move higher in the short to medium term , he say . irrigator wary about Govt 's water licence plan the New South Wales Government plan to buy water licence off irrigator to help meet its target for environmental flow in the Murray and Snowy Rivers . until now the focus have be on finding water savings , but the government have now call for tender to sell water on a permanent basis . conservationist have welcome the move but irrigator in inland new South Wales be wary . general manager of Murray Irrigation George Warne be worry that if the Government buy the water it will push up price or reduce access to water for irrigator . the State Government have move straightaway from water savings and its now just fully try to get into the water market , he say . the government may have give up , I think they might be come under some pressure to find the water savings and they have decide that a more direct approach work . River flow reach low level river flow in Tasmania have reach they lowest level since record begin 40 year ago . Terry Leary from the Department of primary Industries say record low winter rainfall across most of the state have also mean that many farmer have not be able to fill farm dam . he say it be also unusual that the dry condition be affect the entire state , even the usually high rainfall region of the state 's north-west . rain help Kangaroo be farmer there be one part of southern Australia that seem to be fare better than most . farmer on Kangaroo Island off the coast of South Australia say early winter rain have pull they through . even though the island have its driest winter on record , Kingscote farmer Rodney Bell say he crop be still on track and he have never see he livestock look so good . livestock transport industry slam proposal to combat driver fatigue the livestock transport industry be continue its campaign against a draft proposal to crack down on driver fatigue . submission have now close on the recommendation by the National Transport Commission , to regulate the amount of hour driver be allow to work within specific time frame . George Johnston , from the Queensland Livestock Transporters Association , say the current proposal be unacceptable . we think it be too strenuous for starter for truck driver to understand and come to grip with , we think it be just too complex , we think there be economical repercussion down the track , he say . worker worry about redundancy entitlement worker at the Toowoomba processing plant of kr Castlemaine be worried they will miss out on full entitlement if they look for new job before the plant close . the company be plan to move its small goods process operation to Victoria , leave 350 worker in limbo . the company have offer to help worker wish to relocate , but Tom Schulz from the Bacon Factory Workers Union say until it formally notify staff that the plant be close , worker who leave will not receive full redundancy entitlement . the employee have not be technically advise they be go to be terminate , there be no actual termination notice be give , therefore if a employee be to leave now they would be entitle only to they accrual in the unused leave , he say . International College aim to reduce skill shortage farmer in Victoria 's Sunraysia region be hope that a influx of overseas student will help to solve the region 's skill shortage . when it open next month , the Mildura International College will provide horticulture training to 100 student from different country , with a mixture of classroom and on-farm experience . campus manager Bruce Hunter say there be already plenty of support from district farmer . we have have people quite interested in have student to learn the profession , he say . Dohne merino to be sell over web the internet be help grazier in remote rangeland area buy sheep that can cope with harsh , dry condition . with the grow popularity of the dohne merino breed , producer be about to begin sell livestock over the web , with 5,000 lamb from Queensland list for the first sale in November . Graham Coddington from the eastern state Dohne Breeders Association say the web be particularly useful for farmer who be a long way from the major saleyard . see there be a lot of dohne breed a long way from the market right up in Queensland and western NSW , he say . that give they competition for they product on they property before they -lrb- the sheep -rrb- leave there , without spend a cent on trucking they somewhere and stress they all . where they just go straight to where they be destine for , whether it be feedlot , meatwork or breeder . meanwhile woolbuyer from around the world will be able to bid for australian fibre on the internet . Elders be set to move its global wool auction onto the web for the first time in November to allow more buyer , exporter and mill to compete . fundraise group receive environmental award a western australian fundraising group have be award a Golden Gecko for environmental excellence after devise a method to recycle black pvc pipe from mine site . it be estimate there be ten of thousand of tonne of discard black poly pipe lie around outback mining site in WA . Tony Fitz-Gibbon from Ruggies Recycling say the success of the project hinge on transport company give they service for free . the key to the actual process be the machine that go out there can be take out on site and can chop the pipe up into a shredded size , and then we put it in bulker bag and then it be bring back by the transport company on free backload , he say . in Perth , the actual material be then wash and reprocess , and granulated , and be then make into either new poly pipe . also we can coat the cca treat pine log and make post for vineyard and that sort of thing with the recycled poly . mandatory horticultural code of conduct announce the Federal Government have announce it will implement a mandatory code of conduct for the horticulture sector after grower group reject a voluntary proposal . Agriculture Minister Peter McGauran make the announcement in the wake of a meeting last week where the National Farmers Federation and grower group AUSVEG reject a government proposal for a voluntary but legally enforceable code of conduct . design to provide more transparency for grower when it come to sell they produce , wholesaler have already warn they will take legal action to prevent a mandatory code be implement . the government have flag grower may have to foot the bill for the cost of implement the code . Govts urge not to give up world trade fight world farm leader be urge government not to give up the fight to free up world trade . Delegates from the 18 member nation of the Cairns Group be meet in far north Queensland this week to mark the organisation 's 20th anniversary . they will attempt to find a way to revive the deadlocked Doha world trade talk , with the European Union and the US refusing to offer more concession to cut tariff and farm subsidy . David Crombie from the National Farmers Federation say break down market barrier be critical for australian farmer . what we be look at be a more level base where we can compete more openly , he say . we think the EU need to open up its market more , we think the Americans need to take away some of they home support and the develop country need to have less exclusion . Federal Trade Minister Mark Vaile have put forward a proposal to try to revive the trade talk this week , but it have be dismiss by the head of America 's biggest farm group . American Farm Bureau president Bob Stallman say despite he high regard for Mr Vaile , he feel Mr Vaile 's proposal for a 5 per cent EU tariff cut , side by side with a $ us5 billion subsidy cut be unfair . the 5 per cent be not much , in and of itself but if you add in the potential effect of sensitive product and the percent of product there , not count special product for develop country , that be not go to compensate we for give up $ 5 billion . Mr Stallman say Mr Vaile 's plan sound good , five and five , but that be about the best that could be say for it - it do not meet US WTO goal . visit Irish Trade Minister Michael Ahern hope the world trade talk can be put back on track . Mr Ahern say improve market access be a key issue because 90 per cent of Ireland 's production be export . he say there be room to negotiate the reduction of agricultural tariff and subsidy , but the United States need to come to the party too . awb chief push for end to oil-for-food inquiry with talk of another extension , the head of AWB say the oil-for-food inquiry need to be conclude as soon as possible , to give certainty to grower already experience one of the worst season on record . company chairman Brendan Stewart say wheat farmer have a tough harvest ahead and believe the current crop estimate could fall further . he say most grower have have enough of the inquiry and , like the AWB board , would like to see it end as soon as possible . it have not be a pleasant experience for any of we and it obviously build on the level of uncertainty in the industry , he say . we want to move as quickly as possible to give the grower the certainty and assurance they be seek in relation to the 06-07 pool and go forward . hot wind add to farmer ' woe hot north-westerly wind which fan a rash of small fire across Victoria yesterday have also further reduce the outlook for the state 's grain crop . temperature have top 32 degree in some region over the past few day , dry out already stressed wheat , barley and canola . agronomist say all of the 1.5 million hectare of crop plant in the Mallee region have be affect , with farmer now look at harvest only a third of average yield . despite a few millimetre of rain overnight , ouyen farmer Alan Crook say there be now almost nothing leave in he paddock worth harvesting . we be probably look at a desperate situation , he say . we have a bit of rain two week ago and I guess everyone have a bit of hope of get some crop . Dry weather impact on store sheep sale the number of spring sale of store sheep in Western Australia have halve due to the dry season . while the number of sheep be sell for the meat trade have soar in recent month , the amount of sheep be offer to other grazier have drop off . in the next 10 day just 28,000 store sheep will be on offer in WA , compare to nearly 170,000 for the same period last year . recent rain have boost some region , but Ian White from Elders say there be still a lack of both store sheep and buyer . some sheep that look like be sell a month ago , I think the rain 's certainly buy a lot of farmer a bit of breathing space , he say . New machinery sale down farmer be spend less money on new machinery , with sale last financial year down by 9 per cent to $ 1.6 billion . the Tractor and Machinery Association be blame the drought for a $ 150 million fall in the sale of broadacre farming equipment . with the Henty Machinery Field day under way in southern New South Wales , TMA executive director Vin Delahunty expect business to be slow . what we have get be a situation where farmer stop spend late last year and really have not start spend again and that be because they be concern about they cash flow , he say . Head of the Horticulture Australia Council Kris Newton say she can not believe it . that certainly have not be convey to we . we would be bitterly disappoint if that be the outcome and it be certainly not what we be look for , she say . I be probably a little bit disappointed . it be go to add cost to we business and how we do business , it be hard to quantify exactly how much , Grant Nicholl , wholesaler business manager with flavorite tomato marketing say . Cairns Group fear time run out for reform the 18 member nation of the Cairns Group be concern the window of opportunity be close to secure a deal to reform world farm trade . at the end of its three day summit in far north Queensland , the group have call on member of the World Trade Organisation to resume talk by no later than November . the Cairns Group represent country that rely heavily on agricultural export , from Latin America to Asia , and include Australia , New Zealand , South Africa and Canada . for the last few day , the group have be try to get the Doha round of trade talk back up and run . the group 's chairman , Australian Trade Minister Mark Vaile , say the level of ambition have not change and no-one , not even the US , European Union -lrb- EU -rrb- or Japan , have hint they might abort future discussion . but the group be say the major player need to be prepare to give more and expect less . Victoria have over 200 fire last week and New South Wales have 30 or 40 fire today . it be almost unheard of to have fire of that number and indeed that size in part of Victoria as we be experience at the moment . Frost devastate Goulburn Valley fruit Fruit price could be set to rise , with one of Australia 's main stone fruit grow region devastate by a severe frost . Victoria 's Goulburn Valley , which be home to the nation 's largest fruit processor SPC Ardmona , will lose a estimate $ 70 million this harvest . Ian Bolitho from Fruit Growers Victoria say up to half of the 300,000 tonne of fruit grow in the region have be wipe out . all the apricot have go , they show sign of start to shrivel and drop off now , at least 50 per cent of the plum crop be go and probably most of the nectarine crop , and probably 50 per cent of the peach crop , he say . we be just assess on the fresh pear at the moment but they be not look all that flash either . grower be now ask why the weather bureau do not give they any warning of the Sunday night frost . a internet-based forecasting service be set up in 2003 after a similar frost cause widespread damage . but there be no warning issue on Sunday night . Kevin Parkyn from the bureau say that be a mistake . I think the system be a good one . I think it be exceptional , he say . unfortunately we miss this case which do not look good on we track record . as I say it sometimes can be a very fine line particularly with such intense vigorous windy condition on the Sunday to have it drop out so rapidly be very unusual . elsewhere , grower say they do not expect to see major increase in the price of fruit , but believe the market will be affect . sympathetic Queensland grower Pat Wibaux say it be not the first time the weather have cause a disaster . it be not something that someone like to see happen , but it occasionally do , he say . cotton grower offer refund if crop plough for the first time in history , cotton grower have be offer a full refund on they seed cost if they be force to plough in they crop due to a lack of rain . cotton seed Distributors have develop the drought package to entice farmer to plant over the coming month , know they can recoup they cost if the season do not improve . Company spokesman Adam Kay say the industry need help . one of the thing we could do be assist those grower that be want to have a little bit of a punt on thing this season , put some cotton in where they have not get enough water at this stage or maybe when the price be not that good , he say . water protection effort do not go far enough : farmer the Federal Government 's new effort to protect water resource be be criticise for not go far enough . a Office of Water Resources will be establish within the Prime Minister 's department to provide and coordinate national water policy . but victorian farmer Mark Wootton , whose family have donate $ 10 million for a new climate Institute that be be launch today , say the broader issue of climate change need to be address . scientist push for more research into nt coral reef there have be a call for more research into coral reef off the northern territory coastline . Marine scientist Dr Victor Gomelyuk say climate change and cyclone have decimate some reef in the Gulf of Carpenteria . he say coral should be use as a early warning of destructive change . the main threat be actually global temperature rise , he say . when sea temperature be raise above about 32 degree it be almost lethal . lot of other marine component of biota will be affect by these elevated temperature and -lsb- there will be -rsb- other consequence of this elevated temperature you know . awb lawyer quiz about secret document a awb in house lawyer have be reduce to tear at the resumption of public hearing of the Cole inquiry in Sydney . Witness Jessica Lyons have be quiz about two previously secret document release to the inquiry by the Federal Court . the document from January 2003 show exchange between Blake Dawson and Waldren 's solicitor Hazel Brassington and Ms Lyons . they discuss change to the freight arrangement of two wheat contract for the iraqi grain Board . when senior counsel assist John Agius ask Ms Lyons who authorise the change , she tell the inquiry she believe it be AWB marketing executive Chris Whitwell . earlier , Mr Whitwell and former AWB employee Michael Long make a application to keep secret , name of two legal advice document , claim they publication would prejudice they and affect the conduct of any possible future jury trial . Commissioner Cole reject they application . meanwhile AWB have increase estimate pool return for this season 's wheat crop . grower can expect to receive between four and $ 10 a tonne more . feed grain have see the biggest lift , due to strong local demand . british company to takeover Perth oil exploration company perth-based oil exploration company Hardman Resources have agree to a takeover by british-based Tullow Oil . Citrus grower hope for better orange price Citrus grower be hope a fall in the production of valencia orange will result in better price . the national crop be expect to fall by 25 per cent to under 200,000 tonne due to frost damage earlier this year in South Australia and the Murray Valley . in the Riverina region of New South Wales , production be tip to be 90,000 tonne , down from more than 120,000 last season . Peter Morrish from Riverina Citrus say record price of more than $ 2,500 a tonne be be pay for import orange juice concentrate , so local grower be in a good bargaining position . there be discussion go on at the present time in term of future contract and that be look positive on the grower ' side at this stage , but unfortunately it be a wait and see , he say . miniature greenhouse trial prove effective in retain water Broad acre farmer in the future could find themselves use hundred of miniature greenhouse to save soil moisture and improve growth rate in they crop . Bronwyn Laycock from the Cooperative Research Centre for Polymers say by stretch clear plastic over seed-bed , grower can create a entire paddock of tiny greenhouse . she say so far trial have show the technique be effective at retain water in dry crop district . what we be try to do be put it down over the seed as it be sow and it trap moisture , and trap the heat under the film like a greenhouse , she say . -lsb- it -rsb- give it a better grow environment and also it mean that as it be grow , we be capture all the water that be transpire , we be capture the water in the soil so we get a moister soil environment . I think people who be put they water rights on the market now , some of they be very unwilling seller but they have no choice . wool production drop blame on drought the drought be be blame for a estimate 6 per cent drop in wool production across Australia this season . australian Wool Innovation -lrb- AWI -rrb- say the forecast have fall 27 million kilogram to 434 million , because of a lack of rain , pasture growth , and the fact that there be no end to the drought in sight . Chairman of AWI 's production forecasting committee Dr David James agree it will be a tough season for grower . partly it be due to the fact that feed production will be down , he say . for example abare be forecast that cereal production level will be down by about 30 per cent and another concern be in fact the capacity of farmer to provide water to they stock , and on top of that of course there be cash flow factor which will make it difficult . the dry condition be force many sheep farmer to begin they shear earlier than normal . and the bigger supply be hurt wool price , with the market suffer its biggest drop since April . Tony Kidman from Quality Wool say many farmer can not afford to store wool until price rise . we appear to be have less people hold onto wool at this moment , people look for more of a cash flow with they wool , he say . I think the drought condition be force people to shear a bit earlier and sell they sheep a bit earlier than they have in the past . international factor be also affect wool price . Bill Cowley from the australian Wool Network say the market drop be disappointing , especially when the australian dollar be weaker . China do most of they business in US dollar and when we see the US currency fall , we would normally see a firm to slightly dearer market here in Australia , but the bid that be come from the chinese at this particular time be get lower and lower , and there be some resistance to the higher price that they be have to pay in the US , he say . General secretary John Morgan say member have be issue with common law agreement detail the new rate and hope wool grower will be prepare to sign they . it be not a great impost on the employer , he say . some people have suggest that it be not enough , but at the same time we recognise wool grower be not get a fair deal in relation to they wool price and we understand that . but they seem to forget that we people have get to travel large distance to get to they place of employment at great cost and we have get to be remunerate for we labour and we cost . the industry be refuse to comment on the change . meanwhile shearer across Australia be benefit from a price war for they tool of the trade . the price of comb and cutter have be cut by up to a third and the price of some new handpiece on the market be half that of established brand Queensland shear contractor Ian Bateman say he be happy about competition come from China . I think it be a good thing , for the simple fact be , it be like anything else , if anybody get a monopoly , they just seem to charge or do whatever they want to do and I reckon the third company into the business will definitely make the other company brighten they foot work up , he say . Australia 's highway below standard : survey the first independent audit of the nation 's highway show half be below standard and may be unsafe to drive on . the australian Automobile Association survey 18,000 kilometre of the national highway in all state except New South Wales and give each one a star rating . worst on the list be the Bruce Highway on Queensland 's Sunshine Coast and the Calder Highway in Victoria between Bendigo and Kyneton . the association 's executive director , Lachlan Macintosh , say half of the highway be rate three star and more likely to cause death . in a three star road there be still some deficiency in the road feature ; poor median protection , perhaps too many intersection per kilometre of road , poorly design curve , not enough marking on the road , he say . so those three star road could be better , we could see some pretty inexpensive treatment to make they better and that be fairly important . Kosciuszko bushfire contain a 5,000 hectare bushfire in the Kosciuszko National Park have be contain by weekend rain but it be still a complex operation to put it out . no property be lose in the blaze but searing temperature and hot westerly wind sweep the flame through new grassland that have grow where the tree be burn in the 2003 summer fire . incident controller Ian Stewart say firefighter will be winch into hot spot to put out any fire still burn in the rugged country near the snow line . yesterday we have a flir -lsb- forward look infra red sensor/laser range -rsb- machine come down , that be a helicopter with a forward look infrared device which pick up hot spot , he say . Durum wheat production cut the dry weather and crown rot disease have force South Australia 's durum wheat production to be cut dramatically this season . Durum be use be make pasta . estimate be down from last year 's 180,000 tonne to just 40,000 tonne . Michael Jaeschke , president of the SA Durum Growers Association , say the crop estimate will continue to decline as harvesting begin . unfortunately durum seem to be the first one to go out in a dry season like this , he say . there be a lot of durum on the ground now that be be cut down for hay and what be leave there be really struggle to form any sort of grain . Frost hit Tas orchard Tasmania 's fruit grower be brace for heavy loss after frost hit orchard around the State overnight . the full extent of the damage will not be know until later in the week , but early report suggest severe loss of cherry , apricot and apple . Steve Wilson from the University of Tasmania say orchardist in the State 's south have be hit hardest . most grower will not be aware of whether they have suffer any damage until probably late this afternoon or in the next couple of day , he say . exercise test pandemic influenza response Brisbane be host a national exercise respond to a suspect case of pandemic influenza . the exercise follow a simulated outbreak of foot and mouth disease a couple of year ago . Queensland chief veterinary officer Ian Douglas say Exercise Consumption be the first of its size and scope anywhere in the world but be not directly link to bird flu . Health authority have be concern since about 2003 that the h5n1 type of influenza of bird , because there be so much of it about , that it may be the candidate to mutate or change , that it can go in human and therefore I guess , in the back of everyone 's mind , yes that be probably a scenario , he say . company may have to look overseas to fill labour demand Australia 's resource sector say it will be difficult to find a extra 70,000 worker over the next decade , estimate to meet its demand for labour . a new report by a nationwide skill shortage work group show that Western Australia will struggle the most , with the mineral industry there demand a extra 42,000 job . I think one of the thing that we will have to do be continually look at immigration , he say . Immigration 's not go to be the sole solution by any means , it be across the board and as I say , work with the people that be here . but immigration be go to be a important element , I think , if we be to meet these target . meanwhile Australia 's coal industry have be tell it need to properly coordinate its infrastructure need if it i to reap the benefit of future export . a report release by the australian bureau of Agriculture and Resource Economics -lrb- ABARE -rrb- warn against interstate rivalry over new port and rail facility . abare expect coal export to rise to 435 million tonne within 20 year , but say it be critical that new mine and infrastructure development do come on stream . Jeff Ironside own 12 Oaks Poultry , Townsville and manage 200,000 chook to supply egg to a number of business . he be see a huge increase in grain price , as he buy over 5000 tonne of grain annually and be look at a rather dramatic increase in he own price to maintain a profit margin . normally we be look to stock up , but there be not a lot of grain on the ground and what there be , be as dear as poison . Senate committee back guest worker scheme rejection a Senate inquiry have reject farmer ' argument that Pacific island guest worker should be allow in to ease a national shortage of harvest labour . the Senate committee 's report support the Federal Government 's view that a new visa be not need for seasonal farm worker . Inquiry chairwoman Judith Troeth say extensive hearing suggest farmer could find australian harvest labour if they pay better wages and offer adequate working condition and accommodation . the guarantee that we be give that there would be suitable accommodation and enough work for labourer come in Australia - the confidence there be probably misplace , the victorian liberal Senator say . experienced picker who be australian tell we that it be often quite difficult to get a good wage on the present piece rate that exist . the body represent fruit and vegetable grower in north-west Australia be furious about the inquiry 's finding . David McKerrell from the Kimberley primary Industries Association say it be not pay and condition that be put worker off in Kununurra in north-west western Australia , it be the heat . he say many farmer in the district already pay above award wages but it be not help . Mr McKerrell want the Federal Government to make exception to allow Pacific Islanders to work in hotter climate like the Kimberley . up in Kununurra at present , when it be 38 degree everyday , it be not pleasant working , he say . and if these people be around that Senator Troth say there be , surely they would be here . there be mango here drop on the ground . there be no one available and they be not here , and the reason they be not here be because it be too hot . they be not acclimatise to it and that be the end of the story . Isis Shire Mayor Bill Trevor give evidence to the Senate Committee when it visit Queensland 's fruit and vegetable grow Bundaberg and Childers region early this year . he say the inquiry have hardly look at the many barrier that farmer face in get worker . there be a need within the farm community to be able to access labour and it be very , very difficult at time , especially in peak production period , for farmer to pick up that extra labour , he say . meat and Livestock Australia -lrb- MLA -rrb- have launch a national advertising campaign to lift domestic beef sale by $ 300 million over the next three year . the $ 2.8 million promotion will involve television , radio , newspaper and magazine advertisement start from this Sunday . MLA spokesman David Palmer say it have be seven year since beef have be promote and it be important to keep consumer think about it . the ambition over a lengthy period through until 2009/2010 be to to increase the frequency of beef consumption from 2.3 meal to 2.6 meal per week , he say . there be a tv advertisement which be a bit quirky , a little bit of humour , that take up back to the beginning of Australia , the beginning of white settlement in Australia . you know it be just a good story about beef and summer , and barbeque . and as part of a new marketing plan for King Island beef , the product be now be use in gourmet meat pie sell at the supermarket . traditionally , only cut such as eye fillet and porter house have attract a premium price for the King Island brand . Tasman Group marketing manager Lydia Horsburgh say the pie will open up the product to a wider group of shopper . Young cattle price slip young cattle value in eastern Australia have slip to they lowest level in three year . the eastern young cattle indicator fall 29.5 cent in the past week to finish yesterday on 267 cent per kilogram carcase weight . that mean the indicator have fall 28 per cent since January . Southern Queensland livestock agent Noel Grant say he be not surprise as beef producer run out of feed and water . it be something we expect to happen , he say . the confidence have go out of the store market generally . drought relief package change expect the Deputy Prime Minister , Mark Vaile , be expect to announce another major drought relief package next week , extend assistance to more farmer , they family and rural business . the package be expect to bring Federal Government drought spending to more than $ 2 billion . the Federal Government say further change to its drought relief package will mean thousand more farmer in more region will become eligible for exceptional circumstance drought assistance . it be already encourage the South and Western Australian state government to apply for EC status . it have also listen to call from Coalition backbencher for help for farm-related business , extra measure to combat rural depression and more emergency assistance for rural family . locust threaten Nullarbor crop it have appear that crop near the Nullarbor in South Australia 's far west look like be some of the best in the nation because they have receive reasonable rain . but now they be under threat from locust and local farmer say they be not get the help they need from the State Government . Brian Smith from Coorabie , west of Ceduna , say newly hatch locust be wreak havoc on crop . for the last week at least we have be flat out try to keep they out the crop as they ripen , he say . a lot of the crop in the district now have sort of ripened , but any crop that be a bit later have take a fair old hammering . one farmer I think be probably go to give up on a 400 or 500 acre paddock of barley . south-west nsw resident pray for rain resident of south-west New South Wales have turn to prayer to break the drought . Farmers and town folk have be unite at ecumenical church service . more than 100 people come together in Wagga to call for rain , while another inter-faith prayer service take place in Leeton . pastor Michael Skewes say aside from the spiritual value of prayer , it be a strong show of support for those on the land . I think for the farmer that be here - we see a number of hand go up and say ` yeah , we be farmer ' - for they to know that the Wagga community , we in the city really do care for what they be go through I think that be get enormous value as well , he say . in complete contrast , land clearing fire rage across Kalimantan and Sumatra could be prompt increased rain across the top end . over the past 50 year , some station rainfall have increase by up to 300 millimetre . Climatologist Sam Cleland say rainfall in part of the Victoria River district and kimberley be increase by 50 millimetre per decade it be potentially that it be not a direct result of greenhouse gas , he say . it might even be due to increase pollution over South East Asia change the temperature structure of the atmosphere and the temperature gradient between northern Australia and South East Asia in we summer season . grain president resign after single desk comment wrangle over the single desk 's future in the nation 's largest grain grow state have claim a scalp . earlier this week , the Western Australian Farmers Federation 's grain president , Ray Marshall , release a new and alternative policy position , urge the single desk be maintain . but , at least for this season , he urge that the power of veto be remove from AWB and transfer to the wheat Export Authority . the statement have divide group member . call for Biosecurity Aust to be independent authority ` out of line ' a war have break out over change to the controversial import risk assessment process . the federal Agriculture Minister , Peter McGaruan , announce this week that from next year there will be greater scientific scrutiny of the import risk assessment , a regulated time frame and more regular consultation with farmer . while the National Farmers Federation say the bulk of its member support the new protocol , chief executive Ben Fargher say call by nsw farmer for Biosecurity Australia to be make into a independent statutory authority be totally out of line . it be always so important to have unity when talk to government , he say . disunity when deal with government be death . grape grower welcome trade act change farmer and small business have welcome the passing of amendment to the Trade Practices Act , which simplify collective bargaining . Murray Valley Winegrowers have be call for the change for the past three year . I think we have to look at thing differently , whether you collect water in off farm dam during the wet season , to pump out in the dry , Mr Wood say . there be certainly potential on the Daly to increase the amount of food . drought fail to deter bank from lend despite the drought , the bank be still keen to lend to farmer . Cattle be still the flavour of the month and they be still offer very big term , Mr Herron say . we have hear instance of up to 30 year interest only payment , certainly 10 and 15 year interest only be common . climate Institute urge more action on greenhouse emission the farmer-funded climate Institute have launch a national advertising campaign , call on the Federal Government to do more to reduce Australia 's greenhouse gas emission . the organisation say the drought have be intensify by climate change and a national carbon trading scheme and increase mandatory renewable energy use target be need . in he weekly online radio message the Prime Minister , John Howard , say the government be spend $ 2 billion on reduce climate change . but the climate Institute 's founder , beef and sheep farmer Mark Wootton , say these measure be not work because greenhouse emission be increase . under what be put forward at the moment we greenhouse , the australian government 's current policy , increase emission by 10 per cent over the last decade and it will increase they by a further 17 per cent by 2020 unless we change what we be do , Mr Wootton say . analyst promote forest as answer to energy supplies a australian analyst have dismiss the push for more ethanol and biodiesel production , say Australia 's energy future lie in wood . Barney Foran , a visit fellow at the australian National University , say plant 60 million hectare of forest could provide up to 90 per cent of future transport fuel , and 20 per cent of future electricity need . he say many different species of wood could be use , include native tree , and this could provide another source of income for farmer in tough time . Mr Foran say fuel processing plant should be build in regional area . the key here be that we do not cart wood long distance or else we lose both the economic advantage or more importantly the energy advantage , he say . Farm Institute report urge rethink on marketing a independent farm think tank say the australian farmer 's share of world agriculture export have fall by almost $ 3 billion in a decade . a Australian Farm Institute report , release today , show Chile and Brazil 's agriculture export double in the 10 year to 2004 , while Australia 's export grow by only half that amount . Report author Selwyn Helibron say farmer must focus on how to market they product to they customer , or continue to lose market share . crew battle fire near Bathurst Fire authority in New South Wales be still try to control a bushfire north-west of Bathurst . the fire have burn 1,400 hectare of grazing and scrub country , threaten a number of house . the fire jump containment line over the weekend , but be quickly bring back within the line , by ground crew . suspension of WTO talk hamper US effort to fight AWB the suspension of World Trade Organisation -lrb- WTO -rrb- talk be make it harder for US farmer and trade official to take action to try to end AWB 's monopoly for export australian wheat . the last Doha round draft call for ban or phase out single-desk monopoly , like AWB , by 2013 . but with WTO talk suspend since July , American Farm Bureau trade adviser Dave Salonsen say there be no way for the US to fight AWB . if they be operate accord to WTO rule , as they exist now and you can not see that they be somehow not follow they , there be not much opportunity , potentially , to go through a dispute settlement , Mr Salonsen say . Australia agree in its bilateral free trade deal with the US to address single desk trading in the WTO round . 30,000 cattle import to Indonesia for Ramadan at least 30,000 import cattle have be sell across Indonesia for the islamic festival of Ramadan . the last fast will be break this evening and the food festivity begin with prayer tomorrow morning . Greg Pankhurst from Agrogiri Perkasa , the largest importer of australian cattle , say he expect 20,000 cattle will be sell in the coming day . but he say feedlot sale have still be slower this year . we have not be run off we foot in any way , Mr Pankhurst say . we have go from we traditional 100 a day to 200 a day , which be normal . so I have 100 per cent increase in sale but the next three or four day we will not sell anything because most people have they meat stock in hand . traditionally after Labaran , which be tomorrow and Wednesday we will see a little bit of a increase over and above we normal sale . so we will probably sell about 120 to 140 a day . livestock price slump Sheep and cattle price have slump across the nation , as farmer offload stock they can not feed . Sheep have lose nearly 75 per cent of they value in the past four week . yarding in all state have increase substantially , with the southern state hit hardest . Travis Parsci , from the National Livestock Reporting Service , say the fall be drastic . in the last fortnight we have probably see 20 to 30 cent shave off a lot of average price . we have see a lot of the plainer grade suffer even larger fall , he say . it be be cause by the large number of cattle come onto the market , as everyone 's aware , by the dry condtion , the lack of water in particular and also a lack of feed that a lot of producer be face with at the moment . the drought be also push wool price up . news of Australia 's plight be prompt wool buyer to stock up for fear that supplies will run out . the southern market indicator rise by up to 18 cent at last week 's national sale , the biggest weekly rise since January . Tony Kidman from Quality Wool in south Australia , say buyer also want to avoid buy drought-effected wool , which be less strong than other wool . Murray Irrigation to introduce cost cut measure the country 's largest private irrigation company , Murray Irrigation , expect to lose several million dollar this financial year because of the drought . the company will introduce a four day week from mid-November , reduce its weed control program and defer maintenance in a bid to cut cost . general manager George Warne say director ' fee will also be reduce by 20 per cent . Justin Walawski from the association of mining and exploration company say it be time for industry and the government to take the issue seriously . captive breeding set to boost tuna stock a south australian company say it could duplicate Australia 's entire wild catch of more than 5,000 tonne of tuna within a decade through captive breeding . this follow the successful airlift of nine southern bluefin tuna from offshore sea cage into a $ 6 million tank build by clean sea tuna at Arno Bay . the fish will be use to spawn million of egg for harvest in the world 's first captive breeding program for the species . Chairman Hagen Stehr say he could not put a price on the brood stock . hobby farmer work on solve sheep shearing problem it be hard to find a shearer if you be a hobby farmer and perhaps have just half a dozen pet sheep . but the grow number of hobby farmer in Western Australia 's south-west be work on the problem . the local community of Manjimup have its sheep shear , drench and de-louse for a small fee , with all proceeds to be donate back into the community . local shearer Ron Nivon say it be the best way to handle the region 's increase number of pet sheep . this be the best thing that ever happen . I think we have be do it for over 20 year . it be a great cause , he say . you do not have that phone ringing and nuisance phone call ask for five or six sheep shear when you should be out do three or 4,000 sheep . cbh set to launch wheat export pool Australia 's troubled wheat exporter AWB have another force to deal with today with western Australia 's largest grain bulk handler , cbh , attempt to launch a wheat export pool of its own this harvest . as western australian grower consider how they will sell they wheat crop this season , the company today have launch a export licence to test the power of veto that AWB have over its single desk licence . a previous attempt and subsequent appeal by CBH last December be lose . cbh chief executive Imre Mencshelyi say the new move will not undermine the single desk and will put more money into grower pocket this season . we have agonise over that decision for sometime and today we be launch the cbh wheat pool for 2 million tonne volume for West Australian grain grower , he say . at the end of the day we recognise there will be divide opinion on what we will be put out in the market place but the grower will have this opportunity to deliver and they will vote by they action . AWB 's Ian Donges say that the export application be a attack on the single desk , and will not necessarily result in grower be pay a higher price over the life of the propose CBH pool . meanwhile , AWB have increase its new season pool return for premium wheat to $ 245 a tonne , up $ 5 . Victoria have have several frost in the past month , with cherry , grape , stone fruit and apple crop be damage . scientist believe the liquid fertiliser work by harden the plant cell , so the frost can not pull the moisture out of the fruit . consultant dr Colin Young , a former Melbourne University chemistry professor , say there be limitation to the seaweed 's effect . it take 12 hour to kick in and then give you reasonable protection for two week then it start to decrease , he say . Daylight save bill introduce to WA Parliament after year of resistance , western Australians could have daylight saving in place by this summer . a bill will be introduce into State Parliament today to set-up a daylight save trial from the start of December . if the bill be pass , a referendum will take place after three summer , in 2009 . pm to hear farmer ' drought concern farmer will put they concern about the Federal Government 's drought assistance package to the Prime Minister today . Mr Howard be particularly critical of the NSW Government because he say some of the Federal Government 's drought assistance be go straight into they coffer for water charge . drought stricken area to receive extra funding the South Australian Government will provide a further $ 4 million to help drought stricken farming family and community . some of the new measure include $ 1.3 million for stamp-duty relief , $ 330,000 for more rural financial counselling service and fund to help the SA Farmers Federation -lrb- SAFF -rrb- coordinate exceptional circumstance application .
