Govt urge to acquire Snowy Hydro A New South Wales parliamentary inquiry have call on the Federal Government to acquire Snowy Hydro , but to guarantee the electricity generator remain in public hand . Inquiry chairman the Reverend Gordon Moyes say Snowy Hydro need a capital injection of $ 800 million to remain viable in the national electricity market , but that share hold government be reluctant to fund it . banana not to blame for inflation rise : wholesaler the Queensland fruit and vegetable industry say it be ridiculous to blame inflation on the price of banana . the latest consumer price figure rise 0.9 per cent in the three month to September , with the federal Treasurer single out banana price as a factor . and on the basis of the CPI , the Reserve Bank be expect to increase interest rate next month . but Brisbane wholesaler Tony Joseph say while banana price have go through the roof , there have only be 10 per cent of normal supplies on the market . banana have be as high as 130 , $ 140 a case , which be way above they normal price , most probably around the mid-20s when we have get a full supply of banana , he say . clone animal product may reach US shelf consumer in the US may see meat and dairy product from clone animal on they supermarket shelf next year . the US Food and Drug Administration have submit draft recommendation to Washington , which appear to support the sale of product from clone animal , quote research that say the food will be as safe as that from conventionally-bred animal . the sale of clone animal product be currently prohibit in the US . but Scott Kinnear , from the biological farmer of Australia , say organic farmer be watch the issue with concern . we do not think that clone food be necessarily safe for the long-term , he say . nsw cherry grower to push for southern market New South Wales cherry grower will renew a push today to get they fruit into southern australian market by raise the issue when the Prime Minister visit Goulburn . the producer have be stop from get fruit into these market because of concern over fruit fly . National Cherry Growers president , Ian Hay , say despite international market accept fruit fly management protocol , southern state will not accept they . if we can do protocol to get fruit safely overseas , surely we have get to be able to move it across the country as well , he say . if we do not make sure we have tidy up that homework here in Australia , those country to protect they border and decide they will not need a tariff , they will just turn around and say , ` hey you can not even get cherry out of nsw into Victoria . ' Mine to reopen due to surge gold price the bronzewing gold mine in central western Australia be set to reopen on the back of climb gold price . the mine and its extraction plant and accommodation village have be mothbal for the past three year after be buy for $ 9 million by View Resources . manage director Tim Gooch say the company have secure debt financing and say strong investor support and current market condition could see the open cut and underground mine operating again within month . we have be model on around $ a800 a ounce , he say . vet to audit captive devil after tumour discovery vet in Tasmania be conduct a audit of a wildlife park in the north of the state after the discovery this week of two devil with the devastating facial tumour disease . it be the first time the disease have be find within a captive population . it have already wipe out half the wild devil population . veterinary pathologist Stephen Pyecroft say as yet there be no screening test available for the disease , so it be a wait game for the rest of the devil at the wildlife park . one of the area that we have be look at reasonably closely since the start of the program be to try to get a indicator test or the thing that we be sort of call a clinical test for the cancer , he say . northern pastoralist not convince about daylight saving the debate about introduce a three-year trial for daylight saving in Western Australia have leave pastoralist in the tropics feel exclude . the daylight save Bill be introduce to Parliament this week and be expect to receive support from most mp . if it pass , clock will be put forward a hour in December . but one pastoralist in the Kimberley , where it be already 39 degree Celsius each day , say it will not advantage he . we normally start very early , he say . trading hour row close Palace Hotel one of the country 's most famous outback hotel have call last drink for the last time after fail to win a bid to trade for 24 hour . the palace hotel in Broken Hill open in the 1880 and achieve worldwide fame by appear in the film Priscilla , Queen of the desert . but last night , owner Marat Celotto shut the door , say he business be doom follow the council 's refusal to extend he trading hour . it be a very hard decision at the moment , he say . rural income predict to slump a major bank be forecast rural income will fall by 60 per cent this financial year . the National Australia Bank predict income will drop by $ 4.6 billion from last year to just $ 3 billion . but the bank 's Jeff Oughton do not believe it will push farmer off the land . I do not think a lot of farmer will be leave the industry , go into this drought we have see farm property value rise very strongly over the past five year , he say . ABARE farm production estimate lower again there be another gloomy forecast from the australian bureau of Agriculture and Resource Economics -lrb- ABARE -rrb- today . it have further lower its estimate for this year 's drought-hit wheat harvest to 9.5 million tonne , the smallest crop since 1995 . it say the national barley crop could drop 64 per cent on last year , with canola yield down 69 per cent . abare also say beef earnings be expect to fall 13 per cent . PM 's drought tour focus on irrigation the Prime Minister be continue he tour of drought-affected area of New South Wales and today the focus be on the irrigation industry . Tonight at Finley , in the Riverina , the local will gather to pray for rain . but today , they be ask the John Howard for help . on a visit to a dairy farm , Mr Howard hear that with zero water allocation , producer have be force to pay high price for temporary water . that , couple with rise cost of feed grain , be put the squeeze on farm finances . Mr Howard be also expect to meet with local community leader later this afternoon . meanwhile , young farmer , harvester and other farm contractor say the drought assistance package probably will not be enough to keep many of they on the land . western nsw crop spray contractor , Andrew Oliver , who speak to Mr Howard yesterday , say he and he friend be sick of watch they business run down . Frost devastate Clare Valley vineyard another of South Australia 's premium wine region have be devastate by frost . the Barossa Valley , Coonawarra and Padthway have experience crop loss range from 20 and 90 per cent . now the Clare Valley , north of Adelaide , have also be hit . Trelawney Vineyard manager Tracey Sandow estimate last weekend 's big freeze ruin hundred of tonne of grape . the frost come in Saturday morning and anything on the low lie area of the vineyard be basically blacken off completely , she say . storm bring good and bad to mid-west farmer it have be a mix of pain and good fortune for Western Australia 's farmer and pastoralist , after wild storm tear through the Gascoyne , Murchison and part of the mid-west and northern wheatbelt . strong wind and rainfall of 60 to 90 millimetre destroy some farm crop and damage fence . but further north , pastoralist have welcome the rain after such a dry winter . Geoff Pilkington from Kirkalocka Station , south of Mt Magnet , say strong wind and hail create a fierce storm . dark sky and threaten for most of the morning and then the heaven just open and it be just amazing , he say . at the mine site and in Mt Magnet town site , there be huge hail stone and apparently they be the size of golf ball and two or three inch thick on the ground , so it be just a amazing event . tobacco grower vote to accept exit package Australia no longer have a legal tobacco grow industry . tobacco be grow in Queensland and Victoria , but british american tobacco and Phillip Morris have now announce they will be withdraw from Australia by 2008 because overseas crop be cheaper . grower in both state yesterday vote to accept a exit package make up of $ 15 million from the tobacco company and $ 17 million from the Federal Government . that amount to a maximum payment of $ 150,000 per grower , which producer say be a offer too good to refuse . Queensland Nationals Senator Ron Boswell say the government hope the tobacco farmer will be able to find alternative crop , but admit it will be difficult . in the case of Merribra it be a long way from the market so it be difficult to find something they can grow commercially , but some of the farm may go over to sugar which be do okay at the moment , he say . GM cotton get green light in northern Australia the Office of the Gene Technology Regulator have approve the commercial release of genetically modify -lrb- GM -rrb- cotton for northern Australia . it be satisfied that five variety of GM cotton design to be herbicide and insect resistant will have minimum impact on tropical environment . the decision be unlikely to benefit western Australia 's Kimberley region , since the State Government have a moratorium on all GM crop until 2008 . but Cotton Australia 's Philip Russell say there be now nothing stop farmer in north Queensland grow it commercially when price pick up . in Queensland there be no moratorium and we certainly have some interested people up in the Burdekin area of north Queensland who potentially could grow cotton , he say . Bega Cheese chalk up $ 10.5 m profit it be a record profit year , despite the drought , for New South Wales base dairy business Bega Cheese . it post a $ 10.5 million profit on a $ 280 million turnover . the Bega Dairy co-op employ more than 500 people , export to 50 country and produce Australia 's top-selling domestic cheese brand . Chairman Barry Irvin say all the co-op profit be return to the 100 farmer owner , to help see they through the worst drought in a century . nickel mining reveal promising result underground miner at Australia 's newest nickel mine have intersect the first of a number of a high grade nickel sulphide ore body . the Flying Fox mine at Forestania , 400 kilometre east of Perth , host one of the highest grade nickel deposit in the world . the price of nickel be currently at a record high . western area NL manage director Julian Hanna say it be just the beginning of a long-term nickel operation . initially that ore will be toll treat at a nearby treatment plant to produce a nickel concentrate which will end up be export to Canada , he say . Tamworth regional water augmentation manager Nigel Thompson say the project have environmental bonus for the city . wage increase cause concern Agricultural employer be voice they concern about the australian fair pay Commission 's wage increase to low-paid worker . the commission yesterday grant worker on less than $ 700 a week a extra $ 27.36 in they pay packet . the National Farmers Federation say it be disappoint with the decision . and Michael Badcock , from grower group AUSVEG , say the increase will make it harder for Australia to compete with import fruit and vegetable . it be go to put vegetable farmer in Australia in a very bad position , he say . we have get a lot of pressure with cheaper import come into Australia and now all of a sudden we have get to pay this extra increase in wages . it be go to make it very difficult for we to compete in the global market . the australian Workers Union , which represent many low-paid employee in agriculture , say the increase be good but could have be better . Organiser Terry O'Connor admit he be pleasantly surprise by the decision . I think there be a real perception or a realisation from the trade that supply will be tight , he say . the number of stock that be be sell . you have only get to look at Wagga - 250,000 sheep roughly in a month down there . a hell of a big dent in the number of sheep that will supply wool to the trade . work visa crackdown will not stop exploitation , say union the Meat Industry Union say a new crack down on temporary work visa will not stop migrant exploitation . the Federal Government will set up a investigative strike force to make sure employer be comply with the condition of the 457 visa , which allow skilled overseas worker into Australia . ABB 's Lyndon Asser say the move will benefit grower as the company try to secure more supply . organised crime target by fishing Bill organised crime in the fishing industry will be target by tough new penalty if the State Government 's Fisheries Management Bill become law . a recent study by the Australian Institute of Criminology have reveal organised criminal activity in the industry with syndicate operate across state boundary . South Australia 's director of Fisheries will Zacharin say this be one of the reason why tougher penalty for illegal fishing have be include in the Bill which be introduce to Parliament last week . Mr Zacharin say it also include a demerit point system for commercial licence holder . locust take department by surprise the director of agriculture Don Plowman say there be little he department could have do to stop the damage cause by locust to crop grow in the Coorabie district of the far west . and he say the explosion of locust hatching take both primary Industries SA and local grower by by surprise . Mr Rodda say the best increase be in the medium to broad wool . nineteen micron wool jump 27cents/kilogram to finish at 953c/kg clean ; 21m be up 51c to 815c/kg ; 22m increase by 57c to 787c and the 23m rise 49c to 756c . farmer to bear higher feed cost the drought be expect to push up food price with fewer crop and more expensive water . but consumer will not be the only one bear the increase cost . market vegetable price to consumer be expect to rise by at least 30 per cent but many grower be lock into fixed contract with processor . in some state dairy farmer have contract price or be pay base on world price and so will have to bear some of the the higher cost of cattle feed themselves . Chicken meat be expect to rise by about 15 per cent , but although red meat price will rise in the long term , initially price fluctuation be expect to be absorb by retailer . breakfast cereal will rise . US company test south korean import protocol a shipment of US beef have arrive in South Korea for the first time in nearly three year but exporter appear nervous about the future of the market . the US Agriculture Department say the consignment be from a company test new import protocol design to minimise the risk of mad cow disease . but other company be wait to see how it be receive in a market now dominate by Australia . US Department of Agriculture Deputy Undersecretary Chuck Lambert say despite Korea 's market reopen to US boneless beef on September 11 after a 2003 mad cow case , the US industry remain reluctant to ship , even though one US firm ship nine tonne this week . the reluctance to ship have be by the US industry , related to concern about how Korea might handle finding of small piece of bone , or bone chip . we have have one company who have elect to test the system , he say . Mr Lambert be still wait on Seoul for a response to he letter , ask the Koreans for more flexibility in how they deal with bone chip , cartilage and muscle membrane . Korea 's major retailer be not place order for the u-s beef . Quarantine authority will take the next 10 day to inspect the first shipment for bone fragment . but Meat and Livestock Australia 's regional manager in Korea Glen Feist say korean retail chain be not yet ready to welcome back US product . obviously over the last nearly three year now we have make very strong relationship with these guy and they be all indicate to we that they will take a wait and see attitude as well , he say . natural gas sector push for role in greenhouse gas fight Australia 's natural gas sector want to know why it be not play a greater role in the push to reduce greenhouse gas emission . the Federal Government be fund two research project in Queensland to extract methane from coal , with any carbon dioxide emission to be bury underground . but the australian Pipeline Industry Association have question the continued reliance on coal while renewable energy source come on line . Chief executive Cheryl Cartwright say there be enough know natural gas reserve in Australia to last 100 year and it would make better environmental sense to start use it . instead of rely on coal fire generation in the immediate term and the medium term , we can start to reduce greenhouse gas emission , she say . certainly not to the level that renewable energy provide , which be almost zero but natural gas greenhouse emission in energy generation be far lower than coal . Federal Resources Minister Ian Macfarlane say coal will remain a feature of global energy generation for the next century . Mr Macfarlane say Australia be lead the research into cleaner burning and emission technology , and the natural gas sector should see itself as a part of that . they be promote they side of the industry , the government be promote a broad mix , we need to make sure as we announce that mix we get it right , he say . Peter Cook from the crc for Greenhouse Gas Technologies be help to design Australia 's first project to store carbon dioxide in Victoria 's Otway Basin . he say the funding be not enough . almost half of Australia 's total emission come from what we call stationary source , in other word from power station , he say . irrigation pump on unregulated stream stop the drought have force a early halt to irrigation pump on unregulated stream and river in New South Wales . the Department of Natural Resources say it be unprecedented to see water level fall so low in so many river system this early in the season . water level have reach precarious level in southern , northern and far western region , while in the central west pump be expect to be halt within day . Spokesman David Harris say he have never see so many creek and river dry up so early . this year be just horrendous , we have just have no winter flow , we have have no spring flow and as a consequence most of the unregulated stream have just stop flow , he say . drought aid assistance increase the New South Wales Government have announce further drought assistance for farmer and irrigator . the extra assistance will see drought aid increase to $ 30 million this financial year . irrigator in the Lachlan Valley will be the biggest winner from the announcement , with they fixed water charge waive this season , save they around $ 5 million . the State Government have also extend its drought support worker program until June next year . the Premier have waive the wild dog destruction board fee for farmer in the western division and defer the pest insect levy for this financial year . I think price be a big factor , plus there be buffalo operator who be really well organised , they can get much bigger number on a regular basis and put they in yard and quieten they down prior to go on the ship , he say . quarantine US beef release in Japan Customs official in Japan have finally release 910 tonne of US beef which have be in quarantine since January . the shipment be delay when Japan reimpose a ban on US import . meat and Livestock Australia 's Glen Feist say the problem now be that the beef only have a eight week shelf life . the japanese consumer be extremely discerning when it come to quality and freshness of any meat , he say . if consumer sentiment obviously be down over there against US beef a food service operator might buy this product and not be able to push it through either . Sawmillers worry about long-term viability tasmanian sawmiller be concern that a downturn in the wood chip market could undermine they long-term viability . forestry Tasmania 's annual report have reveal a 24 per cent fall in wood chip sale , and a 9 per cent reduction in sawlog . Fred Ralph from the country Sawmillers Federation blame the drop in saw log sale to the slow down in the construction of new home . but he be concern that when the industry recover , mill will not be able to sell they wood chip residue . SA and NSW govt reach water trading agreement the South Australian and New South Wales government have sign a agreement to allow cross-border trading of water entitlement from the Murray and Murrumbidgee Rivers . earlier this year the Federal Government threaten to fine the two state $ 17 million if they do not reach a agreement by January . South Australian Minister for the river Murray Karlene Maywald be hopeful this deal will avoid any penalty . we have come a long way since earlier this year in relation to the negotiation and the discussion , she say . Commission propose increase semi-trailer load load limit for semi-trailer could be increase by five tonne under a draft proposal from the National Transport Commission . Trucks with twin-steer axle would be able to carry a maximum gross weight of 47.5 tonne . the commission say any additional damage to road would be offset by higher registration charge . spokesman Paul Sullivan say the plan would result in productivity and safety gain for the log , mining and construction industry . it originally come from request from industry in the log , mining and construction industry that need to carry a little bit of extra mass , he say . aboriginal land subdivide for farm in a first for the northern territory , aboriginal land have be subdivide for horticulture development . it have take more than 10 year to develop the new lease due to a lack of funding . five block of between 100 to 1,000 hectare at Ti-Tree , north of Alice Springs , will be lease to farmer for development . Allan Cooney from Centrefarm say the plan will increase the productivity of unimproved land , with plan to grow olive , mango , tablegrape and bush tucker . we would expect there to be fruit plant here next year , albeit on a relatively small scale but within a couple of year we will see extensive planting in these area , he say . we have get people that have be line up for year ready to go onto these site . Farm hope for canker-free future orchardist at Emerald in central Queensland be in the final stage of prepare for what be be call the most complex tree plant operation in Australia 's history . a total of 193,000 citrus tree have to be destroy at 2ph farm after canker be discover in the region in 2004 . under a replacement project 5,000 tree will be plant every day for four month . Manager Craig Pressler be hope for a canker-free future . Eco City Farm win invention of year award a urban food production system design to reduce carbon emission have win a invention of the year award in northern New South Wales . the Eco City Farm , which be on a standard house block , produce enough fish and vegetable to feed 300 family . the farm be design to cut the emission create by transport food from rural area to city consumer . Spokesman Andrew Bodlovich say it produce no effluent , recycle its own water and be economically viable even at current city land value . we really start out with the specific goal of achieve a triple bottom line with a agriculture system , so it really need to work for profit but we also want it to be very ecological and it have to work for people as well , he say . muster slow cane toad ' progress more than 48,000 cane toad have be catch in the timber Creek region of the northern territory . a month-long campaign have be run in a attempt to stop the poisonous pest cross the western australian border . coordinator Graeme Sawyer originally expect to catch around 10,000 but he be hopeful the great Toad Muster have slow the toad 's progress . rebound in wool price expect to continue wool price be tip to rise even further as competition for Australia 's drought-depleted wool stock grow between Europe and Asia . wool in the medium 21 to 23 micron range be at a five year high after jump up to 44 cent a kilogram at yesterday 's sale . over the past three week the benchmark eastern market indicator have rise to a two-year-high . I think I have a problem in one of the block , he say . the fruit be not see to be grow , but it be not because it be not grow , it be because it be frost . I have never see frost that way , in that condition and that bad in my time which be not very old but I can assure you that I do not think my father would have see it like that either . Govt play catch-up on water policy , say Labor Labor have attack the Federal Government for not do enough to prepare the country for drought . the Prime Minister will hold a water crisis meeting with four state government tomorrow to look at critical storage level in the Murray Darling River system and the implication for irrigator . the Murray Darling Basin receive just 3.2 millimetre of rain last month , the lowest rainfall since record begin . opposition agriculture and fishery spokesman Gavan O'Connor say the Coalition be play catch-up on policy . Labor propose a summit on climate change and water some two year ago and that suggestion be meet with derision by the government , he say . now with the Murray Darling Basin in a state of stress , system not have enough water to meet farmer need and some farmer allocation down to 30 per cent some not at all , the government have decide to act . it be simply not good enough . Federal Agriculture Minister Peter McGuaran say the current dry condition be no-one 's fault and step have be take to manage low water level . irrigator from the Murray Darling Basin say environmental flow should be use to boost city water shortage . the lobby group , Irrigators Australia Limited , have put forward a five point plan to the Federal Government look at how to deal with the water crisis . Chairman Barry Croke say government should reduce water flow for the environment , instead of buy water off farmer . irrigator ' water be need to feed people and we think that be very , very important but urban use when it start compete with irrigation water in this time of real scarcity , it be create a enormous problem to produce food , he say . so environmental water be there and normally the gum tree would not be get environmental water in this situation and we just believe urban ought to be supplement by environmental water . pump water call to pump water from northern Australia to the south have receive support from a US scientist , who say similar project have solve water shortage there . Professor Scott Bassett from the Desert Research Institute in Nevada say water in river and underground basin be worth big money . he say in the US water be be pipe from farm area to city because population growth be outstrip water supplies . water move uphill and it move uphill to money . big city will pay for they water supply in such a way as $ 3 billion canal from Phoenix to the Colorado River so they will ship the water from the Colorado river to city like Phoenix which have the base to supply the economic drive to get the water up there , he say . but former californian farmer Spike Dessert , who now live in the Kimberley , say the distance water be pipe in the US do not compare with Australia . he say some pump scheme be just 300 kilometre long , nothing compare to the thousand of kilometre of pipeline that would be need here . expert want dingo control relax there have be a call to relax control on dingo and even reintroduce they in some part of Australia . in a new book , Professor Chris Johnson of James Cook University say it be important to conserve the pure-bred dingo . he say he understand the damage wild dog cause to livestock but argue the dingo be a natural predator of other feral . WA export hold yard breach standard : RSPCA The RSPCA say most live export hold yard in Western Australia breach new national quarantine standard . the animal welfare body be investigate what it say be a lack of shelter at one of the state 's biggest port at Wyndham . it say cattle , goat and pig be force to stand in temperature of more than 40 degree for up to three day without shade . since the australian quarantine and Inspection Service -lrb- AQIS -rrb- standard be not enforceable , the RSPCA want the owner of the yard , the Ord River District co-operative , to provide shelter . but spokesman Jim Hughes say that be unlikely to happen . Mr Hughes say the facility be not part of they core business and they do not receive enough rent to warrant upgrade the 80-year-old yard . what we get for those cattle yard be no more than a donation , he say . in those circumstance why on earth would we want to spend a lot of money on facility at the yard ? the new AQIS export standard state register premise must provide animal with protection from extreme climatic condition . but RSPCA prosecutor Robin Moore say he be tell the standard be not enforceable . the drought will break but if it do not then there be go to be difficult decision and people need to be reassure that all government be work together on this . we be go to take action on contingency Dr Dean Metcalf say field trial have reduce the amount of grape lose to the disease by 80 per cent . he say the biological fungicide work with the help of a micro-organism that be native to Tasmania . good rain benefit Kangaroo be beekeeper Beekeepers on South Australia 's Kangaroo Island be have one of the best honey season they have experience in year . local apiarist Peter Davis say the large volume of honey be the result of good rain in autumn and early winter which help set the flower bud . he also say the dry mild winter keep the bee healthy and active . Muswellbrook race cancel because of heavy track racegoer in the heart of thoroughbred breeding industry , the Hunter Valley of New South Wales , do not know whether to laugh or cry today . despite be drought-stricken , the local track be soak by rain earlier this week , cause the traditional cup day race meeting to be cancel . it be normally the biggest event of the year . the Muswellbrook races be as well know to the racing industry as the Melbourne Cup and attract some of the best race horse from across New South Wales . condition be so dry in September and October however , that the club fertilise and water the track to soften it up but recent heavy fall have now make it too heavy for racing . drought hit horse racing stud horse racing stud in Victoria say they be be hard hit by the drought . a lack of spring rain have mean stud owner be buy in feed early this year instead of usually hold off until summer . Fiona Smith from Nagambie , in central Victoria , say stud be be force to pass the cost on to customer . we have have a increase in feed , feed price be astronomical at the moment and be affect we quite badly in regard to the cost of everything , she say . unfortunately we have have to increase a drought levy fee onto we agistment so therefore owner be incur extra cost . meanwhile country race club in New South Wales be concerned about they future viability . orange-based trainer Brian Cornish say low prizemoney , increase feed cost and high fuel price be hurt . we be try to get more money here . everyone be work hard to try and get it for we , he say . that be the only way we will survive on the cost of live here today and training horse . the expense of it be get astronomical now . the thing of it be they want all the money to go to Sydney . that be where they want the money for they down there , they be not worry about we very much here . calicivirus have a impact around Alice Research be show that a re-release of the rabbit killing calicivirus be have a effect near Alice Springs . rabbit number have increase dramatically in recent year , amid fear the disease be lose its effectiveness . Kym Schwartzkopff from Parks and Wildlife say a number of rabbit have die since the re-release , but the disease have not spread as far as hope . the main stop of the spread be usually cause through weather , it do seem to work a lot better within a mild climate where it be a lot cooler and a bit more humidity around and a bit more moisture around and the high temperature that we have in the centre of Australia and also through the desert region make it go dormant . giant qld dam fall to record low one of Queensland 's largest dam have now fall to its lowest level yet . Fairbairn dam at emerald supplies 200,000 megalitre of water each year for irrigation , industrial and urban need . when full the dam hold 1.3 million megalitre , but today it be at just 14 per cent of capacity . Nev Wogand from Sunwater say it would take a exceptional wet season to fill the dam . drought prompt call for seed law change a south australian farmer want the rule on plant Breeders Rights -lrb- pbr -rrb- to be relax , so grower can donate seed to struggle colleague . New grain variety be subject to the rule , which prohibit grower from sell or even give away the seed . Chris Lawrie from Tumby Bay say the seed company should waive the ban this year , give the magnitude of the drought . why can not they come out publicly and say well okay , if we either give or sell seed to somebody that we notify they of the amount of tonne we have sell , who we have sell it to , then they have get a record of it all , he say . grain-fed cattle number down the number of grain-fed cattle in Australia fall by nearly 60,000 head in the last quarter , due to skyrocket grain price and the worsen drought . figure from the australian lot Feeders association show a drop in total number from 940,000 to just over 880,000 , with the biggest drop in Queensland . Association president Malcolm Foster say South Australia be the only state to buck the trend , with number jump 10,000 to 27,000 . there be a lot of cattle that have come out of feedlot that have go to profitable market . not all of they have be replace , he say . if feedlot can not make the sum work between the price they can get for the cattle when they be turn off , and the price they have get to pay for the cattle come in with the current grain price , then they will just slow up they purchase of cattle and so you will see reduce demand and the ultimate outcome of that be fall cattle price . meanwhile , Tasmania 's only feedlot be look to import two third of its grain this year due to the poor grow season . the Powranna feedlot usually buy more than 20,000 tonne of grain from tasmanian grower , but after frost and a dry season less than half that amount be available . manage director Andrew Thompson say the company be look to the mainland to make up the shortfall . Supply shortage feel in pig meat industry competition between pig meat processor be heat up in the lead up to Christmas because of supply shortage . as a result the market have rise to record high this week , with liveweight price as high as $ 3.20 per kilogram . Greg Richter from Primo meat at Port Wakefield , in South Australia , say the shortage have be cause by hot condition last summer . there be be a bit of a general infertility problem that happen earlier in the year and that be just start to come through now , it always show up about nine month after they have the problem , he say . US wheat industry face export problem despite a boost from Australia 's drought , the US wheat industry be face widespread export problem due to quality and disease issue . India be buy wheat again for the first time in seven year , but mostly from Australia and the Black Sea region , not the US . it be because they phytosanitary requirement just can not be meet . it just create a impossible barrier to trade , say US Agriculture Secretary Mike Johanns , USDA be work with US wheat associaty to reduce these barrier . but the group 's Rebecca Coleman say quality and disease issue be crop up elsewhere . we be have trouble in the EU , we be have trouble in Japan , I be sure we be go to have trouble in Korea . we be have trouble right now in Kenya , she say . Ms Coleman say sanitary barrier be now threaten to become more of a problem for US wheat in some place than tariff . meanwhile , the grain Council of Australia say a national survey of grain quality show it be almost 100 per cent clean . the National Residue survey of australian grain , a joint government and industry project , reveal that 99.9 per cent of grain for export comply with australian Food Standards . Funding shortage kill weed research centre the co-operative research Centre for weed will close by 2008 , after fail to win further Federal Government funding . the national research and development body have seek a additional $ 30 million funding over seven year , but fail to meet three out of the four necessary criterion . Chief executive Rachel Mcfadyen say it be a disastrous result because climate change will bring on fresh weed invasion . some of the northern weed will move south , as the temperature heat up so in particular for example prickly acacia , mesquite in the grazing land will extend they range southwards to western New South Wales and possibly even in Western Australia , she say . thing like lantana along the coast will extend its range southward and we do offer advice as to how best manage those weed and how to limit they spread . Sheep genome mapping nearly complete science be one step closer to provide farmer with a complete genetic map of the sheep . the ` virtual sheep genome ' project have map 98 per cent of the sheep 's genetic make-up . that be enough to fast track the identification of the crucial gene for wool and meat quality , and even parasite resistance . Dr Robert Forage , who be lead the joint australian wool innovation/meat and Livestock Australia project , say the sheep 's genetic jigsaw be still not quite complete . it be put together use bit and piece of information not only from the sheep but also from the cow and from the human as well , he say . so we do not have all the information we need from the sheep . we have put some piece of the jigsaw puzzle together but there be still hole in it - we think we know where everything fit but we do not have the complete sequence yet . US Democrats tip to push for animal id system Tthe new-look US Congress be expect to push for mandatory country of origin meat labelling and a animal identification system next year . Democrats newly-elected to the majority will take the lead in write the next US farm Bill . and Colin Woodall with the National Cattlemen 's beef association say livestock issue will be key . include country of origin labelling -lsb- and -rsb- a ban on packer ownership , he say . as far as animal id , we think that also be go to come up . meat and Livestock Australia have consistently oppose mandatory labelling for ground beef , which could burden US processor and retailer with cost so high they would reject import product . workchoices change leave rural worker ` vulnerable ' the High Court have dismiss the state ' challenge to the Federal Government 's new WorkChoices legislation . the state have argue the Commonwealth 's use of the corporation Act to underpin its new workplace reform be not constitutionally valid . the High Court 's ruling today say it be . Tim Kennedy from the National Union of Workers say the decision crush the award system and leave low pay rural worker in a vulnerable position . essentially for many many year a lot of rural and regional worker who work for small employer have rely on a state award system and arbitration system to set minimum term and condition , he say . they basically have ensure the public interest of people get pay that can support a family if you like . chicken death blame on chemical in feed the death of almost 50,000 chicken on two farm near Brisbane have be attribute to a accident involve a load of feed . the food contain high level of nicarbazin which be use to control parasite . the farm and the feed supplier have not be identify by Queensland Health or food safety authority . Dr Andreas dub from the australian Chicken Meat Federation say the 150,000 chicken that recover from last week 's overdose have be clear for human consumption . the chemical be one which be use as medication quite frequently , he say . but in this instance it should not have be there and it be present in the feed at a much higher dose than it would normally be use . wheat price fall as panic buy ease after a bullish run , wheat price have fall around $ 50 a tonne on the domestic market . widespread panic buy by miller and feedlotter have ease , with the market fall heavily as more of the nation 's crop be harvest . Chairman of AWB International Ian Donges say there have be a reduction in tender activity and the cash price . I notice back when the harvest start in southern Queensland the market be roughly between $ 300 and $ 330 - $ 340 a tonne , he say . bank struggle to meet country demand for manager the big bank say they be find it hard to attract branch manager to country town . most of the bank say they have double and triple staff number in rural area after the closure of hundred of branch during the 1990s . Rabobank have double its rural presence to 46 regional office and employ a extra 140 staff . Westpac have employ a extra 80 people nationally this year and double the size of its graduate program . the National Australia Bank -lrb- NAB -rrb- have employ a extra 120 people in its agribusiness unit over last two year . NAB spokesman Wayne Carlson say the company have have to offer ` sweetener ' to lure more bank manager . AWI meeting discuss challenge the major challenge face the wool industry be be debate today at the annual general meeting of peak body , australian Wool Innovation -lrb- AWI -rrb- . around 200 wool grower have converge on the RSL club in Armidale , in the heart of north-western New South Wales , to hear about the report card on australian Wool Innovation for the past year . on the agenda , the progress of the propose merger with australian Wool Services despite a estimate $ 27 million UK super debt , also the court case with animal rights group PETA and the last minute jockeying , hand shake and electioneer by the new candidate be well under way . the result of the election to finalise the new AWI board will be announce later on today . dairy farmer to vote on r&d contribution Australia 's 6,000 dairy farmer will go to the poll early next March to vote on how much they be willing to contribute to research and development . Farmers pay 0.32 cent per litre of milk sell which , couple with Federal Government support , generate around $ 50 million a year . Pat Rowley from Dairy Australia say it be hard to ask farmer to step up they financial support during the drought but it be critical for the industry 's future . long range forecaster look to autumn rainfall the Bureau of Meteorology and other long range weather forecaster be predict a better outlook for drought-hit area by autumn next year . but there be still some debate about how much better . most long range forecaster agree it be not yet a exact science and they be use different system . but David Stephens from the WA Department of Agriculture be predict a 80 per cent chance of a good autumn break . in Victoria , independent forecaster John Moore say there be 90 per cent chance of a average year start with heavy fall in February or March . Queensland Sunspot observer Owen Beneict expect the dry to continue . uranium action plan endorse the Federal Government have endorse a two-year action plan to remove impediment to the growth of Australia 's uranium industry . the Uranium Industry Framework Steering Group have release a report which outline recommendation for better public information and suggest involve indigenous community in uranium mining . Michael Angwin from the australian Uranium Association say global demand for uranium be grow quickly . the report be go to help Australians think about the industry on its merit , he say . it be a factual and dispassionate review of the prospects for the industry and of the impediment to its development . cbh await board approval for Broken Hill mine a new zinc , lead and silver mine have be give the go-ahead at Broken Hill , in outback New South Wales , that should lead to 90 new job . sydney-based CBH Resources plan to start work in January open up a unmined ore body within the famous line of lode . but general manager of the rasp mine , Visko Suluchich , say the company board still need to approve the project . Murchison resident Louise Sellenger say the game be design to show how the area be unique . I suppose it be more -lsb- about -rsb- open people 's eye to pastoralism itself -lsb- and -rsb- how different it be to everyday living , she say . you have get various bit and piece to do that be not normal farming . Woolgrowers back AWI director Woolgrowers have show support for the direction of they peak body , vote to retain the current board director of australian Wool Innovation -lrb- AWI -rrb- . grower have also vote to keep a wool tax of 2 per cent to fund AWI 's marketing and research . five candidate have nominate for the three available position on the board , and AWI chairman Ian McLachlan be happy that grower have back the status quo . the board 's do the best it can , he say . I do not want to get into a discussion about about people who do not get onto the board and so forth , all I would say be that I would like to see these election conduct in a , for want of a better term , in a gentlemanly fashion , because this industry be far too important to have individual badmouthe not only at election time but through the whole year , so in the future I would just hope we would march on together because there be some prosperity out there if we get it right , he say . healthier oil may lie in canadian canola work be under way to try to develop a healthier oil for commercial cooking . Canola oil be not suitable for bake , fry food and margarine because it do not have a long shelf life . the victorian Department of primary Industries be part of a attempt to breed a canadian canola variety that be resistant to the disease blackleg , so it can be grow in Australia . Breeder Laura Maher hope the new oil will be put to the test next year . grape grower , orchardist prepare for nsw cold snap grape grower and orchardist in the central New South Wales range be prepare for a predict cold snap over the next two day . sub-zero temperature be be tip , which could bring further frost , which cause damage to apple , cherry and grapevine two week ago . angullong grapegrower James Crossing have buy a spray which he hope can limit frost damage . well currently we be just map out low-lying area of the vineyard to determine the area that be likely to be damage by frost , then we will be spray with a polymer spray to protect those vine from the cold weather , he say . we be look at about $ 400 a hectare for the chemical and application and we be look at do ten to fifteen hectare . author predict new direction for wheat export the author of a new book look at AWB 's governance , say there be mount pressure from grain grower to completely deregulate Australia 's wheat export market . under the present system , AWB operate the single desk and have the right to veto bulk export application from any other company . but director of Australia 's National Institute for Governance Stephen Bartos believe that will have to change . and for the first time , the east coast producer group , the grain Growers Association , have outline its vision for the future of wheat export . Murray Irrigation slash farm water supply irrigation water to hundred of farm in southern New South Wales will be cut off next month as Murray Irrigation concentrate on maintain supplies for stock and domestic use . the company say irrigation will be restricted to area close to the main channel , with consideration for contract crop , feedlot and dairy farm . Murray Irrigation chairman Stuart Ellis say the restriction be necessary to prevent the whole system run dry by Christmas . RSPCA prosecutor Robin Moore say all producer have a responsibility to livestock and the drought be not a excuse for mistreatment . frost may halve crop production unseasonal frost in Queensland 's crop region could halve production for some broadacre farmer . below average temperature on Friday bring frost and even snow to some part of the Granite Belt in the state 's south . crop specialist Paul McIntosh say while they be still assess the damage , it already appear significant . there be sorghum , grain sorghum , corn , forage sorghum and even the feed value like Dolichos lablab , and some of those softer crop they be absolutely black , and the Eastern Downs be definitely the big area that be be hit , Mr McIntosh say . grain audit under consideration the Federal Agriculture Minister say he will consider a annual national audit of grain stock . the grain Council have call for the audit to address uncertainty about the level of grain hold in storage . the australian bureau of Statistics be currently investigate this year 's dramatically drought-reduced stock . Peter McGauran say with ongoing uncertainty over how much grain will be available for export or domestic livestock feed this year , the government be continue to process 40 application to import grain . Watchdog call for accurate labelling of GM import Australia 's consumer watchdog have call for any genetically modify -lrb- GM -rrb- import to be label accurately . choice , formerly know as the australian consumer Association , have raise the concern amid speculation that a major grain handler be expect a consignment of GM canola from Canada within the next month . domestic canola supplies be tight this season due to the drought . choice spokeswoman Claire Hughes say consumer will not know they be eat GM canola oil . if we do start to see a large amount of genetically modify canola come into Australia , if it be go to be process and use as oil , consumer would not necessarily know if a product they be purchase have be genetically modify or do contain genetically modify canola oil , she say . because we GM labelling law do not require a product that have be highly refine , those product do not have to be label and canola oil be a good example of that . Federal Minister for Agriculture Peter McGauran say he be aware of the import , which be intend for use in oil for human consumption and meal for stockfeed . he say the consignment have be independently sample and test before load to confirm that only GM line approve by the Office of the Gene Technology Regulator be allow in . doctor call for rural health community service obligation the rural doctor Association -lrb- RDA -rrb- claim the Federal Government be more concerned with ensure people have a phone rather than a doctor or hospital . it be call for a community service obligation for rural health , much like the one which force Telstra to provide service . new president Dr Peter Rischbieth from Murray Bridge in South Australia say million of taxpayer ' dollar pour out of rural community to subsidise metropolitan health service . they have the ethos that everyone should have a telephone and access to telephone repair , he say . -lsb- the -rsb- Rural doctor Association believe they should have access to timely medical service . Sugar cane smut find on third cane farm a third Mackay cane farm have be find to have sugar cane smut , confirm fear that the fungal disease be widespread . the disease have be find on a property , 20 kilometre from the original find near Mackay , which have be discover on Melbourne Cup day . Mackay Area Productivity Service spokesman Alan Royal say smut now look to be well-established in central Queensland . it be very , very sad but it be right across the other side of town and the whip be reasonably advanced but they be certainly not big whip like we have be see , he say . what do frighten I be on the weekend in one row at the initial farm , you know we be see whip that be four , five foot long , so it be get a hold there but let 's hope we can get on top of it . meanwhile sugar cane farmer in Western Australia 's Ord Valley be look for new variety , because some which be once resistant to cane smut be not any more . the disease be first find in WA 's north-west in 1998 . I have never seem they before and everybody in the district be have the same problem . they be not eat the cherry , they be just chop they off . they go to taste they and then they be sour . they pull it off the tree and then they go to another one hope it be a bit sweeter . company offer incentive to encourage trucky to stay a major trucking company be plan to pay incentive to its driver to encourage they to stay in the industry . New tree planting fail to secure farm biodiversity : research New research say offset the clearing of native vegetation with new tree planting be not a effective way to maintain biodiversity on farm . the australian National University research suggest it take up to 300 year for newly-planted vegetation to provide the same food and shelter to animal and bird . Ecology Professor David Lindenmayer say the finding show a need to preserve remnant vegetation . we have find this from we datum on the south-west slope of New South Wales and it be for reptile , it be for possum and gilder , arboreal marsupial and also for bird , he say . scientist claim new water filter halve purification cost scientist in Italy say they have develop new way of filter water that should halve the cost of purification . the water membrane technology be already be use in other country to recycle waste , make bear water palatable and desalinate salty water . Professor Enrico Drioli from the University of Calabria say the membrane , which look like plastic wrap , mirror the natural filter membrane in we body . just a film that the one you can use for packaging you sandwich sometimes , so this film be able to be selective , he say . AWB have be pursue a strategy of diversify its income away from pool management . we have get strong and grow business in we international trading in Geneva , Brazil and India , Mr Davis say . grain grower will not oppose removal of AWB 's wheat veto the grain Council say it would not oppose any move by the Federal Government to remove AWB 's veto on wheat export application . there be a push from within the government to take away the veto to allow other grain company to export wheat . but chairman of the peak body , Murray Jones , say grower must be consult before any major structural change be make to the single desk . we do not know what the Government 's reaction will be and I be leave it open to they to make they reaction , Mr Jones say . we have consult regularly and continuously during the course of the last few month and we will continue to do so , and continue to put forward the grower ' position , which be they wish to retain a single desk and they want to be consult if there be to be any change . the grain Council say it want grower to have control of the export system . but the australian Grain Exporters Association be push the Federal Government to remove the single desk . the association of bulk grain handler want a interim licensing system put in place to smooth the way for deregulation . Prospect for rain improve the National climate Centre say a duel between sea temperature in the Pacific and Indian ocean could bring slightly higher rainfall to much of Australia . indian Ocean temperature be rise off Western Australia and up to Indonesia , cancel out a worsen El Nino effect in the Pacific Ocean . there be now a 50 per cent chance of average rainfall across most of Australia in the next three month , although north Queensland could be drier . senior climatologist lyn Bettio say the prospect of rain certainly have not get any worse . it be actually look better than what it be last month , she say . merino price plummet price for top merino sheep have plummet at the annual Yass circuit sale , in New South Wales , once a stronghold for fine and superfine wool . with a larger offering than last year , merino sheep and cross breed lamb be be offload as the drought bite deeper , with ewe be pass in for $ 1.50 each . the average price for Roseville ewe of the Merryville line be $ 10 , down from a height of $ 70 in previous year . Richard Buckmaster say the low price will hurt farmer . it be very disappointing . I know we have get bad season and everything but I think this be the worst we have have in 17 year of circuit sale , Mr Buckmaster say . in general , the wool market have ease this week , fall 2 per cent at sale in Sydney , Fremantle and Melbourne . the eastern market indicator -lrb- emi -rrb- fall 18 cent , to finish the week at 826 cent a kilogram . stronger quarantine condition for import prawn recommend Biosecurity Australia have recommend tougher quarantine restriction on prawn import , which could effectively end the trade . the domestic industry have call for a end to import due to disease concern , although importer oppose any tougher restriction . Commissioner John Martin say producer and processor of everything from egg to fruit juice be increasingly flout the law but will not be able to get away with it for long . legislation block grassland clear after three year of wrangle , Tasmania have pass legislation to protect remnant grassland from land clearing . the controversial legislation be only pass yesterday in Tasmania 's Upper House after a number of modification be make to the Bill . Tasmania be oblige under a federal agreement sign in 2003 to protect non-forest native vegetation . Govt contribute to WA carbon trial the Federal Government will contribute $ 60 million towards the world 's biggest carbon capture and storage trial in Western Australia . the money will go to the Gorgon natural gas project off the Pilbara coast , which be still wait for the final go ahead . if it proceed , 125 million tonne of excess carbon dioxide will be liquefy and bury 2.5 kilometre under the sea bed in saline aquifer . Environment Minister Ian Campbell say it be imperative the project get off the ground . the Gorgon project , be the biggest one of its type anywhere in the world , in fact bigger than all of the other project in the rest of the world put together , will help we demonstrate that it can be do safely , that you can put in place a regulatory environment around it , put the risk management technique around it , Senator Campbell say . irrigator discuss compensation with Premier New South Wales farmer have meet with Premier Morris Iemma to ask for compensation for they cut water allocation . the government have slash carry over water allocation for Murray River irrigator by half . what water be available will only be give to customer near the major supply channel to reduce evaporation . Chairman of Southern Riverina Irrigators Ted Hatty say the government have not offer any immediate help . the Premier have say that he will look at what he can do , he say we be talk week not month , so I suppose that be a positive , he say . dairy Aust will not ask farmer to increase service levy Dairy Australia say it will not ask farmer to support a increase service levy next year . a poll on the levy will be hold in February and March , with farmer to be offer three option . better livestock management may prevent rattle disease spread the thoroughbred horse industry say new research could protect hundred of foal from the disease know as rattle . the debilitating bacterial infection be believe to be bring on by dry and dusty weather , and cost the industry million of dollar a year . researcher David Hodgson say better livestock management could prevent the disease spreading . new president elect to Sheepmeat Council Australia 's peak sheepmeat body have appoint a new president . New South Wales prime lamb producer Chris Groves will head up the Sheepmeat Council of Australia , replace outgoing president Ian Feldtmann . top drop go down well with National Wine Show judge the 2004 and 2005 vintage have prove popular with the judge at this week 's National Wine Show in Canberra . only premium wine that have win other award can enter , with the main award go to wine from Margaret River , the Hunter Valley and the Yarra Valley . Chairman of judge James Halliday say top drop be cheap because of the wine glut . 2004 , 2005 , 2006 which be the three vintage which have bring the oversupply issue right onto the front page , happen to have be three very good vintage , he say . so if you be go to have too much wine it be rather a good thing to have too much good wine , or very good wine , rather than too much bad wine . meanwhile drought , frost damage and lower water allocation be draw down Australia 's wine stock glut faster than anticipate . the wine industry have revise down its estimate for next season from 900-million litre to 460-million litre . prediction for another extreme drought season next year be expect to bring yield down by 20 per cent . Lawrie Stanford from the australian wine and Brandy Corporation say the excess stock be certainly drop and that be good news . the latest estimate that the industry have be that stock above a desirable level would rate at something like 460 million litre , he say . far north qld fruit wine in demand the maker of tropical fruit wine in far north Queensland say they be struggle to keep up with demand . the wine be make from fruit include passionfruit , native tropical berry , banana , lychee , rambutan and black sapote . Tony Woodall from the tropical North Queensland Wineries Association say the region have become the world 's lead commercial fruit wine producer . some of the fruit be quite bland like grape and do not make a particularly nice wine , he say . not say grape do not , they do of course . Cole inquiry report finalise after nearly a year of public hearing , 7,500 page of court transcript and more than 70 witness , the final report of the Cole inquiry be finish . Commissioner Terence Cole be today hand the document to Australia 's Governor-General Michael Jeffery in a brief ceremony at Admiralty House , the official Sydney residence of the Governor-General , it will advise the Federal Government on the action it should take against monopoly wheat exporter awb and two other australian company for kickback payment they make to the iraqi regime in breach of UN sanction . awb be by far the largest contributor , pay more than $ 290 million . huge secrecy surround the contents of the report , which will be table in Federal Parliament next week . it be widely predict Commissioner Cole will recommend the lay of criminal charge against some awb executive . the report 's contents will also have a bearing on the future of the single desk . meanwhile the author of a awb commission report into wheat export say change to the single desk be inevitable . but the report say any change should take place gradually , to minimise the impact on wheat grower . former world trade commissioner and report author , Alan Oxley , have warn that any immediate change could hurt 12,000 grain grower from marginal area . these tend to be farmer who be not in upper income group who be solely dependent on grain in area where there be variability , Mr Oxley say . so as far as we be concern they be concentrate in the eastern wheatbelt of Western Australia , and on the Eyre Peninsula -lrb- in SA -rrb- , and in western NSW . they be the one who tend to rely on the collective marketing of they crop . but independent grain analyst Malcolm Bartholomaeus disagree . he say most farmer would take advantage of a open market . I be not sure that we hold back the entire industry for a smaller group who may have a little more trouble adjust . farmer be not silly , you change the rule and they rapidly adapt , Mr Bartholomaeus say . Dry condition to blame for slump in farmer ' confidence the confidence of australian farmer have slump to its lowest level in six year . the state of mind in rural Australia be reveal in the latest Rabobank Rural Confidence Survey . just 15 per cent of farmer expect the rural economy to pick up over the come 12 month compare with 19 per cent last quarter . the state hardest hit be Victoria , New South Wales and South Australia . Rabobank 's head of rural banking , Neil Dobbin , say ongoing dry condition be largely to blame . this be the lowest confidence farmer have have since the survey start , which be six year ago . sixty-five per cent of the farmer think that income would worsen over the next 12 month , Mr Dobbin say . El Nino may be benefit fishing , aquaculture El Nino weather system may have a bad name for bring drought to Australia but they might bring benefit for fishing and aquaculture . the interaction between weather system and the ocean will soon be track more closely , with the installation of high-tech monitoring equipment along the australian coast . South Australian base oceanographer Dr John Middleton say the equipment will give a more accurate picture of the impact of El Nino system on marine life . the research I have do to date suggest they can actually lead to more nutrient available to the food web and thus more productivity , he say . Dr Graham Mills be investigate the phenomenon in relation to the fatal bushfire on South Australia 's Eyre Peninsula in 2005 and the Canberra fire of 2003 . he say satellite imagery have reveal a dry slot move towards Canberra on the day the blaze hit the city . my hope would be that we would have some hour of warn for at least some of these event , he say . australian cattle trade campaign under way in Indonesia A big push be under way to step up the live cattle trade between northern Australia and Asia . meat and Livestock Australia -lrb- MLA -rrb- be run a major campaign in the indonesian capital of Jakarta this month , fund by the cattle transaction levy . spokesman Mike Hayward say 30 supermarket will feature cooking demonstration , recipe card and giveaway . overall , sale will increase from around about the 650 mark -lrb- 650,000 cattle -rrb- up to over 750,000-800 ,000 head , he say . probably in the five year period , back up towards 1 million -lrb- cattle export -rrb- . I think it be ten of year , you know there be 200 odd million people up here , it be a grow economy , people be aspire to get out of the wet market into the modern retailer , into the mall . wheat export change may compromise national pool : AWB Wheat exporter AWB say a lack of clarity in the Federal Government 's change to the wheat export system could compromise the national pool . in the wake of the Cole inquiry , the Government will take control of AWB 's veto power over wheat export for six month while it discuss the future of the single desk . AWB say the change will prevent the company from forecasting future earnings . manage director Gordon Davis say he will meet with Agriculture Minister Peter McGauran to discuss the impact on grower who have already deliver wheat to the national pool . under the previous obligation , AWBI have the ability to veto export if it consider they be not in the interest of the national pool , he say . in these transitional arrangement , the Minister will have a obligation to make decision in the public interest . the arrangement be very complex as they currently be and there be a range of interest that need to be satisfy in any discussion . I think that at a point in this process the best thing that we can do as a government be communicate directly with grower . Committee chairman Associate Professor Bob Beeton say thing will get worse before they get better . some of the heritage property may decline , some biodiversity may decline , river health may continue at a very low level and the co2 level obviously continue to increase , he say . the amount of energy use in Australia be still increase and we need to figure out what we be go to do about that . meanwhile , the energy sector say manage climate change will be its greatest challenge for the next few decade . the Energy Futures Forum have release a report which say future investment will hinge of the industry 's response to climate change . but forum member Tony Wood say develop country will have to make a effort as well . no-one would suggest that Australia should act unilaterally forever , he say . -lrb- a -rrb- we would just damage we own economy and -lrb- b -rrb- , we would not solve the problem of climate change anyway , so there be no doubt we require a global solution . NASA see evidence suggest liquid water on Mars Images take by NASA 's Mars Global Surveyor spacecraft suggest the presence of liquid water on the Martian surface . it be a tantalising find for scientist wonder if the Red planet ever have harbour life . the orbit US spacecraft allow scientist to detect change in the wall of two Martian crater that may have be cause by the recent flow of water , a team of researcher say in a paper appear in the journal Science . scientist previously have establish that two form of water - ice at the pole and water vapour - exist on Mars , but liquid water be crucial to nurture life . the scientist compare image of the Martian surface take seven year apart and find the existence of 20 newly form crater cause by impact from space debris as well as the evidence suggest liquid water trickle down crater wall . these observation give the strongest evidence to date that water still flow occasionally on the surface of Mars , Michael Meyer , lead scientist for NASA 's Mars Exploration Program , say in a statement . the paper say water seem to have flow down two gully in the past few year , even though liquid water can not remain long on the planet 's frigid , nearly airless surface because it would rapidly freeze or evaporate . this seem to support the notion that liquid water may exist close enough to the planet 's surface in some place that it can seep out from time to time . the scientist propose that water could remain in liquid form long enough on the surface to transport debris before freezing . the two bright new deposit be each several hundred metre long . they cite a possible alternative explanation that these feature be cause by movement of dry dust down a slope . Life on Mars ? scientist long have wonder whether life ever exist on Mars . liquid water be a important part of the equation . on Earth , all form of life require water to survive . among the planet in we solar system , only Earth have a more hospitable climate than Mars , and some scientist suspect Mars once sheltered primitive , bacteria-like organism . previous mission find evidence the Red planet at one time boast ample quantity of water , and the question be whether liquid water be still present . as with many discovery , the possibility that liquid water may be come to the surface of Mars today pose many question , the scientist say . where be the water come from ? how be it be maintain in liquid form give the present and most likely past environment ? how widespread be the water ? they also wonder whether the water could be use as a resource for future mission to explore Mars . the two site be inside crater in the Terra Sirenum and the Centauri Montes region of southern Mars . the shape of these deposit be what you would expect to see if the material be carry by flow water , Michael Malin , lead author of the paper , say . they have finger-like branch at the downhill end and easily divert around small obstacle . the researcher first report the discovery of the gully in 2000 , but this be the first time they have reveal the presence of newly deposit material seemingly carry by liquid water . last month , NASA say the Mars Global Surveyor mission appear to be at a end , say it have lose contact after a decade-long mission in which it map the surface of Mars , track its climate and search for evidence of water . WA fisher welcome new illegal fishing law the fishing industry in Western Australia have welcome new law to toughen the nation 's defence against illegal fishing . the Royal Australian Navy have be give permission to shoot at uncooperative illegal fishing vessel to disable engine or rudder but not sink they . Kimberley Professional Fishing Association spokesman Alan Fraser believe it will be a better deterrent . there be be a lot of talk of action be take and money and resource be expend on try to solve this problem , but really up until now we effort have be pretty dismal , he say . core cattle breed stock number fall the New South Wales Opposition say core cattle breed stock level have fall by 65 per cent due to the drought . opposition primary industry spokesman Duncan gay claim it could take five year to rebuild stock level . north-west stock agent Dick Cameron say some producer have already lose all of they breed stock and may never recover . some people have run out of heart , some have run out of money and some have run out of both , he say . Cargill Australia importer Robert Green say crop level in the eastern state have be dramatically reduce . the current industry estimate that the crop 's only be a odd 160,000 tonne in the eastern state , versus a east coast demand of over 500,000 tonne of seed , he say . milk production expect to drop the dairy industry be expect a big drop in milk production next year as farmer struggle to meet high feed price , particularly in non drought-declared area . although milk processor be negotiate better farm gate price and offer interest free loan , farmer be have major problem secure reliable feed delivery . dairy consultant Bill Naughtin say some farmer be not milk as much . I have hear on the grapevine that some people have decide to go once a day in a effort to reduce water use , but most people I have speak to have a plan in place to feed they animal , he say . the principal concern at the moment be where be they go to get the money to pay for the feed and how be they go to access feed that be reasonable quality and reliable . pressure Dry condition in Tasmania be put pressure on farmer who have be agisting dairy cow for they victorian colleague . worsening seasonal condition be make it harder for farmer to help , but farmer Greg Hall say they be do they best . when we agree to take a extra 100 or so heifer that be some six week ago because there be quite a bit of rough weather on Bass Strait it take some time to get they over , he say . drought to impact on farm income the australian Bureau of Statistics -lrb- abs -rrb- say farm income be predict to fall this financial year because of the drought . it say farm gdp be to drop by 16 per cent and agricultural export be likely to fall 14 per cent . the ABS figure be confirm what farmer be see in the paddock as they income be drop , while the cost of they input be stay the same or rise if they be feed expensive grain to animal . meanwhile peak farm group in the eastern state have form a Recovery Alliance to look at how the agriculture sector will rebuild after the drought . the group will chase further funding from the Federal Government to help farmer buy seed , fertiliser and maintain core breed stock . New South Wales Farmers president Jock Laurie say the situation be dire for all rural community , not just farmer . if we get into a situation where people out there actually reduce they crop by half , then obviously that be the income halve for a lot of those small business , he say . in circumstance like these , what we be aim to do be to try to make sure we get as much money flow through agriculture , which then flow straight back in through those small community - that will keep those small community go , business go . the thing about this be that it be a way to help the whole region , the whole community , not just individual farmer . local community lose out the economic impact of the drought be hit home in one small community in southern New South Wales . the Temora Shire Council say many local grain grower have not harvest a crop this year , cost the region about $ 100 million in lost income . Mayor Peter Speirs say when farmer stop spend , the whole town suffer . it will be very hard for some of we business , there will probably be rationalisation of staff in some area , he say . fire begin to merge as wind shift fire authority in Victoria be warn that 600,000 hectare of alpine country in the state 's north and south-east could be on fire by the weekend . fire spark by lightning strike earlier this week be merge as wind shift . temperature be set to climb into the high 30 on Saturday , along with predict hot northerly wind . GM canola shipment contaminate : aqi the australian quarantine and Inspection Service -lrb- AQIS -rrb- have confirm a 57,000 tonne shipment of import genetically-modified -lrb- GM -rrb- canola be contaminate with canadian barley and weed . the shipment arrive at the Port of Newcastle this week . it will be process in Newcastle into protein meal and vegetable oil , and sell to the food and biodiesel industry . national manager for Plant Programs at AQIS Peter Liehne say it be common for bulk commodity to contain other material . in this case we find that there be some seed present in the shipment which have sufficient concern for we to look at the management of the product to ensure there be no risk to the environment result from these weed seed , he say . abs revise grain storage figure the australian Bureau of Statistics -lrb- abs -rrb- have be force to re-release figure on the amount of grain in storage after the industry question the statistics . earlier this week , the ABS say bulk grain handle company have more than 13 million tonne of grain in stock , include 10 million tonne of wheat . the revise figure show a drop to 10 million tonne in storage overall , with wheat make up around 7 million . the bureau 's Karen Connaughton say there be a number of reason for the change . we have not undertake this collection since December 2004 so it be quite difficult for we to verify the benchmark figure , she say . we do make some effort to verify the figure and we get some broad parameter from people , and it appear that the estimate we provide be too high .
