Wholesaler Andrew Young , from the Central Markets Association of Australia , say the code he have see will be a cost burden for everyone . it add significant administration cost . there be legal requirement that have be introduce , which grower must obtain legal advice prior to execute a agreement with a wholesaler . there be much more prescription in term of how wholesaler can and can not act and virtually require in excess 90 per cent of the industry to totally change how they have do business for many many year , he say . Zinifex and Umicore link for zinc Australia 's largest lead and zinc miner will combine its smelting asset with a belgian company to become the world 's biggest producer of zinc alloy . Zinifex have sign a memorandum of understand with umicore to form a global company to produce 1.2 million tonne of zinc and alloy a year . Zinifex say it want to concentrate on mining , but spokesman Martin MacFarlane say exist smelter operation in Hobart and Port Pirie will not be affect . those business tomorrow will continue on much as they have today , there be no change to any of the employee term and condition for the short to medium term future - we see the business will be very much as it be today , he say . longer term , however , it may create and open opportunity that may not have be otherwise available just from the fact that Zinifex do not wish to develop that side of the business . Trade Minister Warren Truss say Japan might push for more opportunity to sell niche product to Australia , but farmer here should receive the biggest gain . we be export a lot of beef into Japan at the present time , but all of it be pay 40 per cent or more tariff , he say . deadline for potential wheat exporter loom the Federal Government want potential wheat exporter to submit they application by Friday , to give certainty to grain grower during the harvest . Mr McGauran say application will be assess on public interest grounds to maximise return to the industry . Professor Young say there be widespread concern that the current system be hamstring by politics . people be very frustrated with what be happen , there be a lot of frustration around the rule over water trading and thing like exit fee , he say . every state be take subtly different approach , if you have a structure like this it would all be resolve in a unified way , so there would be no opportunity for arbitrage from one state to another . but there be concern from irrigator that the proposal would leave agriculture out of the water reform process . I be a little bit concerned at the moment that expertise within agriculture for example , within we irrigation company , be a bit remote from the decision-making process . work together meanwhile , peak farm , water , environment and business organisation have agree to work together to push for improvement in water security for farmer and urban user . the National Water Commission -lrb- NWC -rrb- stakeholder group have agree on priority , include better water accounting and reporting , and address over-allocation of river . Federal Immigration Minister Amanda Vanstone say they will be transport out of Australia as soon as possible . recycled water blame for lettuce damage lettuce grower in Victoria fear they crop be be damage by recycled effluent water from the Werribee Sewage Farm , near Melbourne . more than half of Australia 's iceberg lettuce be grow at Werribee . the farmer have be use the recycled water since last year , when the State Government ban the use of underground water due to the drought . Southern Rural Water spokesman Clinton Rodda say a investigation be under way to find out what have cause stunt growth and discolouration of lettuce . certainly the salinity be higher than ideal and this be a interim scheme until , hopefully , the salt reduction program will move to lower salt in the long-term , he say . but I think these farmer in Werribee south be very effective in the way they manage they crop , they be aware of the higher salinity . some of they have deal with higher salinity bore for many , many year in the past , so they learn how to deal with those high salinity level . grower face pressure over wholesaler contract a Queensland horticulture group say grower have be pressure into sign contract by wholesaler try to avoid the industry 's new code of conduct . all contract sign on or after last Friday be subject to the code , which be design to improve transparency . Aust vegetable import outweigh export , grower say vegetable grower say Australia be import far more produce than it export . most of the surge have be for frozen and process vegetable , particularly potato . peak grower body Ausveg say import have jump by almost 35 per cent in the last four year , to $ 375 million . Ausveg spokesman Ian James say the trend be concern , especially when vegetable export have drop back because of a loss of market . some of these frozen vegetable reflect renew or different source policy of the food processor in Australia , in particular , over the last 12 month anyway , a switch from australian-sourced product to New zealand-sourced product , he say . but there have also be some substantial increase in import come from the European Union as well . emergency service fail to tackle fire : report a investigation into the 2003 Canberra bushfire have highlight a failure to attack fire early and a failure to warn the public of impend danger . four people be kill and 500 home destroy in the blaze , which start in the mountain , west of Canberra . the coronial report make more than 70 recommendation , but there be concern over how the ACT Government will respond . act coroner Maria Doogan have hand down 15 finding on the cause of the fire . among they , the ACT Emergency Services Bureau have fail to aggressively attack the fire . they withdraw crew on the night they start , fire trail be overgrown , and there be heavy fuel load . she also find that in the face of drought and extreme fire condition , the bureau have inadequate map , planning , bulldozer and other support for fire crew . the coroner have acknowledge that the ACT Government have already give more statutory power to emergency service , but have since return the fire control to answer to bureaucrat with no special emergency management knowledge . CSIRO spokesman Murray Cameron say a shortage of math graduate have already delay some of its research program . a lot of Australia 's history in agriculture , for example , have be in we ability to use genetics to breed better animal , better plant species , a lot of that in the future be about use mathematics effectively , he say . Fortescue gain access to BHP Billiton rail line the Federal Court have give Fortescue Metals Group open access to BHP Billiton 's iron ore rail line in Western Australia 's Pilbara region . the decision mean BHP Billiton can no longer stop other company from use the Mount Newman and Goldsworthy rail line , despite claim they as part of its own production process . Foretescue have successfully argue that the line be a ` service ' , under the Trade Practices Act and should be available to all company who need they . Fortescue spokesman Graeme Rowley say the court have uphold a right to fair competition . we not only now have achieve success for ourselves , but we have also achieve success for Australia , he say . we now go to the australian competition Tribunal to ask they to approve effectively we access to that infrastructure . that overturn the Treasurer 's decision that we could not have that access . Cattle ID scheme issue be resolve : nlis chairman the chairman of the National Livestock identification scheme -lrb- nlis -rrb- for cattle say problem with the scheme be be address . a leak copy of a audit of the scheme , commission by the federal Agriculture Minister , have highlight problem with farmer cooperation , scrutiny of the system and different level of state compliance . Chairman John Wyld say the nlis be work well overall , but admit there be weakness , include the lack of a back-up plan if Telstra 's system support the database go down . we contract with Telstra require a full disaster recovery plan , he say . now I be aware there be a ongoing issue between MLA and Telstra , but it be really a matter that Telstra 's not be able to comply with but it be part of we contract . drought blame for lucerne crop failure dryland lucerne production in the upper south-east of South Australia have be hit hard by the drought with virtually no hay cut this year . the area between Tintinara and Naracoorte be generally regard as one of the nation 's biggest lucerne hay-producing region but have record its lowest rainfall total in a century . Charlie Hilton from Lucerne Australia say if there be no rain in the next three month , it be possible some long-established lucerne stand will be lose . if stand have thin out to be not economic to leave , they be go to have to be re-establish , he say . once you do that , you virtually lose production off those dryland paddock for a year . turf grass producer bite the dust tighten water restriction in many part of Australia be take they toll on the turf-laying industry . the industry have lose $ 15 million this year , as home owner become reluctant to lay grass they can not water . Ray Moir from Turf Producers Australia say South Australia have be hardest hit by the drought . it be have vary effect from state to state , he say . darling river weir may prolong water period two temporary weir have be build on the lower portion of the Darling River in far western New South Wales to shore up water supplies . the weir , about 50 kilometre north of Wentworth , be build from compacted clay bank contain large pipe and regulator . Alan Whyte from Jamesville Station say it will not drought-proof the darling , but it will give landholder a more reliable water supply . we know the river be go to cease to flow within two or three month ' time , he say . there be a opportunity to put some bank in to hold up a bit of water particularly for a few people who be below the exist Tulney Weir . Canberra bushfire report damn Landholders west of Canberra who warn authority about the impending fire danger in early 2003 say they have be vindicate by a investigation into the subsequent bushfire . the act coroner have release a damning report on poor preparation and fire management for the blaze , which kill four people and injured 400 other . one of the report 's major recommendation be that the Emergency Services Agency be reinstate as a independent body that be not answerable to bureaucrat . val Jeffery , a long-term firefighter who be credit with save he village of Tharwa , say someone should be hold responsible for the disaster . there be a stark lesson here for the rest of Australia , he say . Community ` weary ' from bushfire with temperature set to rise in Victoria in come day , landholder in the state 's east be once again gear up to fight fire that be threatening private property . the fire have be burn for almost two week , destroy more than 700 hectare . Gippsland farmer Julie duffy say many landholder , family and volunteer be become exhaust by the ongoing blaze . the whole community be weary , she say . the CFA have work tirelessly . fuel theft cause concern Aviation fuel be be steal from some remote top end airport and there be concern the theft could pose a major safety risk . charity charter company Mission Aviation Fellowship say up to 60-litre batch of fuel be be take from aircraft in the small community of Milingimbi and Raminging in Arnhem Land . general manager Ian McBride say people be steal the $ 2 per litre fuel on a fortnightly basis to use in they own vehicle . we main concern really , over and above the loss of the fuel , be the safety aspect , he say . where aircraft get tamper with and fuel cap get leave off and possibly fuel tank contaminate . CWA distribute Xmas cheer to drought-stricken family the country Women 's Association -lrb- CWA -rrb- have distribute some Christmas cheer to 680 family and 40 community in drought-stricken New South Wales . the state branch of the CWA have be allocate emergency fund as part of a Federal Government aid program in October . up to $ 2,000 have be available to family to meet food and utility cost , while grant of $ 3,000 have help town to hold community event . Vice president Colleen Wills say the money have go where it be need most . to keep the phone go , car , for petrol , to get to town to do the shopping , to doctor - it be all the basics , she say . ` Santa ' drop in on remote station plane fly to remote station be be load with hundred of kilogram of present in the lead-up to Christmas . Alice springs-based Chart Air have fly to up to 60 property across the northern territory this week to deliver mail . pilot John Zonaras say he have be re-name Santa because half he mailbag contain gift . the mail and that sort of stuff have definitely increase in volume , he say . like today I have a mail run with 42 mailbag and about 350 kilogram so probably a good 150 kilogram of it be present . AWB payment to Saddam regime not bribe : ATO there have be a strong surge in AWB 's share price today after the australian Taxation Office -lrb- ATO -rrb- clear the company of any wrongdoing in a investigation of payment make under the oil-for-food program . finding from the Cole inquiry say AWB write off payment under the oil-for-food program as tax deduction , include those to trucking company Alia . it have be think the company may have be liable for up to $ 450 million in penalty and unpaid tax . but in a statement to the stock exchange , AWB say the tax office have find the payment do not constitute bribe to foreign public official under the income tax Assessment Act . the stock market have react favourably , with AWB share gain more than 7 per cent this morning , trading at $ 2.81 shortly before 10:00 be AEDT . meanwhile AWB 's rival be be ask for detail on they price , return to grower and the effect they application might have on the national pool . the condition be set out in a letter from the Department of Agriculture send this week to all the company that want to export wheat . the letter say the government want more information as it try to establish the ` public interest ' value of each application . exporter Peter Howard from Ozepulse say some of condition be surprising . I think it be unusual - we have always think and argue in the past that any application approve would not really have any effect to the detriment of the pool , he say . but I guess it be a point in question look at what the cost might be to those pool participant , would they increase if these application be grant . perhaps they would , but we answer be that surely AWB should be reduce those fee to those pool participant . NSW , WA support single desk in another development , New South Wales grain grower have step up the battle to save the single desk wheat export system at a rally in the Riverina . farmer in southern New South Wales have precious little wheat to sell this year , but about 350 be in Narrandera to show they support for the single desk . local farmer Hugh Hart say it maximise return to grower in a corrupt world market . give the power of veto back to the company , he say . let they get on with the job and let 's all look forward , so when it start to rain we can make a quid again and cut all this rubbish out . we have have enough - no more inquiry , no more consultation , just get on with the job . national mp Kay Hull say farmer need to voice they support for the single desk to silence a noisy minority in the Federal Government . National Party Senators Ron Boswell and Barnaby Joyce be expect to address the crowd . in Western Australia , 200 grower have also back the single desk at a public meeting in the Wheatbelt town of Mingenew . Farmer Peter Hord say the meeting will probably come to nothing . it seem to be typical of all of the meeting that have take place , he say . US take ACTION AGAINST AWB US Agriculture Secretary Mike Johanns have temporarily ban wheat exporter awb from use he department 's program , in the wake of the Cole Inquiry . Johanns act follow he directive last month that USDA resume debarment proceedings against AWB . he say he be suspend AWB , several individual and a Minnesota commodity firm from USDA program or purchase . the extent of we ability to act here be debarment . now , Congress may look at this and say there be a need for a legislative approach . they certainly have a right to do that . the suspension do not prevent australian wheat from be sell in the US or affect AWB 's ability to trade on commodity exchange . AWB spokesman Peter McBride say the program have only ever be a small part of the business . they include US government subsidy and loan guarantee for sell US crop overseas . he say the company voluntarily withdraw from the program , when the UN inquiry into the oil for Food program begin . we have not use this export subsidy program since early 2004 and we inform the USDA earlier this year that we would voluntarily stand aside from use the program in the foreseeable future . so we will continue discussion with the USDA go forward , but we have not use the program in a long time and we do not envisage use it  . AWB 's share continue to trade strongly after yesterday 's clearance by the australian tax Office . the ATO have accept that payment make under the Oil-for-Food program do not constitute bribe to foreign public official , under the income tax Assessment Act . Austock analyst Paul Jensz say the ruling be worth around 50 cent to the share price . it be one of the first bit of positive news to come out of what have be a fairly devastating year . this do help the momentum inside the company and the renewal and the change that they be do on a cultural level and a cost level  . not enough full-time doctor while rural Australia continue to cry out for doctor , there be now alarm over the fall number of doctor willing to work full time . the Australian Institute of Health and Welfare say the number of full-time gp fall more than 30 per cent between 2000 and 2004 . it say some country resident be now wait up to three week for a appointment . Dr Peter Rischbieth , from the rural doctor Association , say the holiday season will put extra pressure on rural community . there be some town that have massive influx of population through the tourist and holiday season , and some of these town do struggle to provide appointment for both they resident and the tourist who be arrive , as well as some doctor understandably want to have leave during this time with they families  Wool grower advise to keep sheep with the best demand condition for wool in five year analyst be urge farmer to hang onto they sheep , with strong price expect to continue into 2007 . although the cost of hand feeding be prove difficult to meet for many wool producer , some analyst think price could reach ten year high in the New year . Chief economist at Woolmark Chris Wilcox say the lower forecast in production be also keep demand strong . the question that I be be ask in China revolve largely about supply concern . that , I think , will without doubt help support demand , certainly in the first quarter of 2007 . it be worth persist particularly into the first quarter and maybe a bit beyond  . bank back victorian farmer it be be a pretty grim season for grain grower in western Victoria , but the major bank be confident that there be still a future for farm in the region . senior staff from seven lead bank have attend forum this week to reassure farmer that they be not plan to foreclose on property . Bill Dean from the NAB say bank have work hard over the past decade to improve they relationship with farmer . I think the most important thing for farm customer be to keep the line of communication open , to sit down with they banker , explore the option and work out where they be go to go . in the majority of case , we be see customer that , whilst they be concern about what have happen in the last 12 month , they be very confident about the long term future , as the bank is  . confidence about gm wheat trial Victoria 's first crop of genetically modify wheat could be in the ground as early as next year , despite a state moratorium on commercial crop of GM canola . the government have apply for a permit and hope to have trial of the drought resistant wheat approve by June next year . Dr Bruce Kefford from the Department of primary Industries be confident of the trial 's success . this be work we have do in collaboration with the crc for molecular plant breeding , some colleague in South Australia , and other party . there be actually a number of line which have a number of potential treatment for drought resistance in they and we have get about thirty line that will be trialle in quite small trial if it be approved  . dairy farmer fear feed price rise the dairy industry be worry that a high level of wheat export could affect local feed grain price . the Federal Government be expect to announce tomorrow , whether it will allow company other than awb to ship wheat overseas . Head of Australian Dairy Farmers John McQueen say any further increase in grain price would hurt the industry . as far as domestic price go , it should make no impact whatsoever , and we would be very disappointed if export do anything to domestic price . domestic price should not at any time go above import parity and we preference would be lower than import parity . Export licence should not give a green light to anybody increase domestic price for grain  . local fish costly for CHRISTMAS the Sydney fish market be prepare for the Christmas rush , with 80,000 customer expect through the door this weekend . but they will be face with a expensive decision about whether to pay higher price for local produce , or buy cheaper frozen import . the price contrast be expect to be even greater this Christmas , with the market ' biggest supplier face its worst year in four decade . Russell Creighton from the Clarence River Fisherman 's co-operative say drought have claim another casualty . the seafood catch have probably be one of the lowest I have experience and I have be here for forty year . and the contributing factor play a big part be the drought , because there be no nutrient run into the river , and the river be the nursery for both inshore and offshore species of prawn and crustacean . so we be really feel the pinch this christmas  . bee industry buzz beekeeper in eastern Australia be have mix fortune . the eucalypt be burst with flower and nectar in southern New South Wales , but low world price , bushfire and drought be hurt . seventy per cent of australian honey come from eucalypt , and right now the gum in the Southern Tablelands be full of flower . Doug Sommerville with the NSW Department of primary Industries say it be in response to a break after the last drought and the intensity of this one : the fella be make good honey right now , off snow gum , yellow box , red gum , all in the nice quality honey . but he say disaster be imminent with the drought continue and beekeeper Greg Roberts say the fire of 2001 and now be devastate . it take many , many year for species such as stringybark to come back after fire . with low world honey price , australian beekeeper be switch from export honey to export live bee to the US , under the free trade agreement . remote BUT EFFECTIVE A new survey suggest that landholder in isolate area should be use remote monitoring technology to save more time and money . the Kondinin farm research group travel Australia look into technology , such as virtual fencing , walkover weigh and remote controlled helicopter mustering . and Research and Development Manager Ben White say they find remote water monitoring have the most potential to improve efficiency on property . the report , fund by meat and Livestock Australia , will be release in February . kiwi WOMEN CHIP in to help in BUSHFIRE BATTLE New Zealand farm woman be offer help to australian family affect by the bushfire . rural woman New Zealand be try to find out what help be need , so member can raise money , or send food parcel . Poor harvest disappoint nt grape grower there be financial pressure on Northern Territory table grape grower after another disappointing harvest in the major production area . nematode and termite have mean that most of the vine in the Ti-Tree region have have to be replant in recent year . the president of the northern Territory grape Producers Association , Greg Kahl , say producer expect higher yield from the young vine in the next few year . we have be battle on for a number of year , we production still have not get back to the level , 2000/2001 harvest , he say . basically on expectation across the board -lsb- we be -rsb- about 60 per cent down . New owner for Cowra abattoir a abattoir in central western New South Wales , at the centre of a row over the Federal Government 's workplace reform , have a new owner . the previous owner of the Cowra abattoir sack 28 staff under the WorkChoices legislation and then offer to reinstate they at a lower rate . the plant be hand over to adminstrator in August this year and then close . New owner Chris Cummins say major change will have to be make to make the abattoir viable . obviously we will have a reduction in staff , he say . the place fail before because it be over-manned . for a start there will be work a eight hour day , which be not the case before . all the chain will be wind back . we will have a pretty good product come out of there , probably as good a product as anywhere on New South Wales will come out of there . it be a good plant and need a little bit of money spend on it , it be in a great position . Mayor Charles Arnold say he hope the move will also send a clear message to the Federal Government , which be refuse to ratify the protocol . we politician think by they hip pocket and if they see that the people in the community want to stand up and be hear , I think that be what should happen , he say . US consider farm spending cut the US administration be openly discuss the need to cut US farm spending , even before a possible resumption of world trade talk . US Agriculture Secretary Mike Johanns tell a reporter recently that the US farm support system may be sit in quick sand , under challenge abroad in the WTO -lrb- World Trade Organisation -rrb- and under fire at home with a budget strain by war in Iraq and Afghanistan . we be do all we can to get the federal budget under control , he say . the leadership now of the House and the Senate have talk very , very publicly about this notion that you have to pay for thing as you go . those be strong message that the budget be go to have a impact on policy . Woolworths CEO detail drought relief strategy sustainable agriculture , drought relief and climate change be the three issue dominate the agenda for the new boss of Woolworths . Chief executive Michael Luscombe say the supermarket chain have plan to create ` green supermarket ' , improve the company 's waste management and reward producer whose farm be environmentally friendly . Mr Luscombe say in the short-term , the company be work with the country Women 's Association on a special drought relief project . we have decide that we be go to have a national drought relief action day on the 23rd of January , he say . and on that particular day in 760 supermarket we be go to donate the profit from that entire day 's sale to drought relief . early Christmas gift for central nsw farmer Christmas have arrive early for at least one lucky farmer in central New South Wales . with water supplies so critically low , many landholder will not be spend the festive season with family who live far away because they can not risk leave the farm for even a day in case stock run out of feed and water . but Paul Stewart from Mudgee be lucky enough to be under a isolate thunderstorm yesterday that have revitalise he Christmas spirit . almost every dam be empty and almost every dam be full to overflow , he say . it be beautiful to watch because we have absolutely no chance of get away at all with worry about trough and pump water from here to the stock , but we will not have to worry about that now . the weather bureau be forecast possible isolate shower and storm late today and tomorrow over most of New South Wales . a rain band be move in from the south-west and rain be forecast this weekend right across the state . thunderstorm bring welcome rain to Eyre Peninsula there have be a wide range of rainfall total record in South Australia , as a result of large thunderstorm which cross the state overnight . while the rain barely settle the dust in some area , dam be fill on the eastern Eyre Peninsula and through the state 's mid-north . Jan Girdham , who farm between Kimba and Cleve , have one of the highest total with 52 millimetre . MIS plantation forestry tax incentive to stay the Federal Government have decide not to remove tax advantage for investor in plantation forestry under manage investment scheme -lrb- mi -rrb- . but under new change it will change the law , to ensure that at least 70 per cent of investor 's money be spend on tree , instead of other project . farmer believe the scheme create unfair competition for land and water , but assistant treasurer Peter Dutton say the farm sector also receive help . the government have put in place a deliberate strategy to make sure that we support the forestry industry , he say . at the same time we have provide many other tax incentive and support through the tax system and government policy and otherwise for traditional farming measure such as the Farm Management Deposit Account so it be about provide a balance . the government have also launch a three-month review of the taxation of non-forestry MIS for crop such as grape and tomato . but there be criticism from the investment and the farm sector over the continuation of the timber tax deduction . former rural banker and agricultural business consultant David Cornish say the government have do nothing to address community concern over the impact of plantation . he say traditional farm enterprise be be overlook . these be just massive tax distortion or subsidy which be lead to distortion of capital into rural Australia , he say . Govt to buy back more scallop fishing licence the Federal Government will buy back another 150 fishing licence as part of its program to reduce over-fishing in australian water . the new scheme include one third of the scallop fisher in the northern prawn fishery and 14 per cent of Bass Strait scallop fisher . they earlier application for buyout be not consider good value by the government . McGauran approve non-awb wheat export contract federal Agriculture Minister Peter McGauran have approve two wheat export contract for company other than awb . one of the contract be for 300,000 tonne for wheat Australia to ship wheat to Iraq , where AWB have be ban from trading and one for western australian-based cbh of 500,000 tonne to Indonesia . Mr McGauran say of the 46 application receive they be the only two consider to be in the public interest . he say AWB have give assurance the two application will not have a impact on national pool return . as a condition of the export permit , both Wheat Australia and CBH must contribute $ 4 a tonne to the national pool up to a total of 800,000 tonne . meanwhile , the head of AWB International have warn the Federal Government he will have no other choice than to wind up the company , if its veto over wheat export be remove permanently . AWB International chairman Ian Donges say the government must be careful in what it decide . I think a lot of commentary have be around , he say . we can have the the bulk veto power with someone else and have a permit system along side a single desk system . quite clearly you can not do that . if the single desk close down or in fact change to the point where we do not have a future for the say -lsb- in -rsb- the 2007 pool then we will phase out of business . early grain harvest see farmer enjoy pre-christmas activity victorian grain farmer be be rope into Christmas preparation by they family , with harvest finish early . usually most cropper be strip paddock right up to and after Christmas day , but the drought have have a drastic impact on yield . grain grower say the extra time this year be a mixed blessing . I actually do not sow a crop this year , so maybe I will have a early Christmas , a nice early Christmas , one grower say . have a bit more Christmas shopping time , so it be good to get that do instead of at the last minute , another say .
